loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie R. is from the village of Balbagon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 28 years old, married and has 1 infant. Jessie owns & operates a transportation business, providing habal-habal, or motorela services (habal-habal/motorela is a passenger carrying motorcycle with an extended seat). Jessie has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Jessie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed for the maintenance of this service. This will be his 1st loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to maintain service

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with two children, one of whom attends school while the other one is still too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has been operating a soft drink selling business for the past two years. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. Fatuma faces a major challenge in seasonality.  During the rainy season the demand for natural juices is low compared to the hot summer season. She hopes to own a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 25,000, she wants to purchase a fridge to store natural juices for sale. She decided to join Yehu because of its simple procedures.

loans.use: To purchase fridge to store juice to sell

Mercedita A. is from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. She is 40 years old. Mercedita is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Mercedita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling seafood products, including fish like sardines, milk fish & salmon,  in the local community. Mercedita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Mercedita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercedita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish like boboron & tamban. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Mercedita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda R. is from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. She is 36 years old. Florenda is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Florenda owns & operates a mini-restaurant. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community, like chicken/pork adobo, afritada & caldereta. Florenda has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Florenda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florenda is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Florenda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.use: To purchase food & drinks for restaurant

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has been operating an open air food stall business for the past three years.  Her customers are neighbours and passersby. Mwanaidi faces a major challenge in competition from other food stall operators. She hopes to establish a restaurant in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000, she wants to purchase wheat flour, cooking fat oil, rice, and maize flour. She decided to join Yehu to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, cooking fat oil, rice, and maize flour

loans.name: Charlito

texts.en:
Charlito L. is from the village of Anakan, Gingoog City. He is 48 years old. Charlito is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Charlito owns & operates a business venture in the services sector running a transport business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorcycle or habal-habal services to local community members. Charlito has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Charlito joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Charlito is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed for the maintenance of the service. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Charlito from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer O. is from the village of Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 35 years old. Jennifer is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Jennifer owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a seafood business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling seafood products, including fish like milk fish & mackerel, in the local community. Jennifer has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jennifer joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jennifer has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Jennifer is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish like solid & bilong-bilong. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Jennifer from HSPFI. loans.name: Mwanatuma

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is a married woman with five children, four of whom attend school while one is still too young for school.  She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She has been operating a cosmetics shop for over six months.  Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. Mwanatumu faces a major challenge of competition from other cosmetics shop operators. She hopes to be a cosmetics wholesaler in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase cosmetics for her shop. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics for shop

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara B. is from the village of Talisayan, Misamis Oriental. She is 45 years old. Clara is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Clara owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & snack foods in the local community. Clara has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Clara joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Clara is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products like beverages & breads. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Clara from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

Alfonsa is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Alfonsa from HSPFI. loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo M. is from the village of Rizal in West San Isidro. He is 43 years old. Reynaldo is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Reynaldo owns & operates a business venture in the services sector running a transport business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorcycle transport services. Reynaldo has been engaged in his business for over 13 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Reynaldo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Reynaldo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. Reynaldo is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to repair the vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Reynaldo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

location.town: San Luis, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Meali

texts.en:
MeA. is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has been operating a food stall business for the last two years, selling at the market to her neighbours and market goers. In addition, she sells green vegetables to contribute to her income. MeA. faces a major challenge in competition from other food stall operators in the market. She hopes to establish a permanent restaurant in the future. 

With the Kshs 15,000, she wants to purchase sacks of beans, rice, wheat flour, and potatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase beans, rice, wheat flour, and potatoes

loans.name: Kibibi

texts.en:
Kibibi is a widowed woman with six children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over ten years, she has been operating a restaurant business at the market.  Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. Kibibi faces a major challenge of competition in her business. She hopes to expand and start a hotel business. 

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase wheat flour, rice, beans, cooking fat oil, and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, rice, beans, cooking fat oil, and sugar

loans.name: Jyambere Mugore Group

texts.fr: Marie Gorette M. est agricultrice, et elle est un membre du group Jyambere Mugore.  Elle a 28 ans, elle est mariée, et elle a 3 enfants entre 2 ans et 5 ans.  Deux de ses enfants vont à l’école.  Son niveau d’éducation est l’année 6eme primaire, et elle va utiliser son prêt pour acheter 300kgs de pommes de terres et intra-agricoles pour son agriculture a Rubavu.  Sa strategie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’avoir la capacité d’autofinancement, est d’améliorer des quantités pour son affaire.  Elle voudrait s’autofinancer, assurer le bien être de sa famille, et payer les frais d’études pour ses enfants.  Marie Gorette est aussi élévatrice des vaches.
texts.en: Marie Gorette M. is a farmer and a member of the Jyambere Mugore group. She is 28 years old, married, and has 3 children between 2 and 5 years old. Two of her children go to school. She attended school until the 6th year of primary school. She will use her loan to purchase 300 kilograms of potatoes and agricultural inputs for her farm in Rubavu. Her strategy for business growth is to become self-financing and to improve the output of her business. She would like to be self-financing, ensure her family’s well-being and pay for her children’s school fees.  Marie Gorette also raises cattle.

loans.use: To purchase 300 kilograms of potatoes

loans.name: Jovielyn

texts.en:
32-year-old Jovielyn U. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is married and has a 6-year-old child. Jovielyn raises pigs to earn a living. She sells the pigs at her town's market. She also runs a sari-sari store where she sells a variety of different products. Jovielyn does her best to help provide for the increasing needs of her household.

Jovielyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovielyn has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Jovielyn is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional piglets and feeds. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and feeds

loans.name: Jovencia

texts.en:
Jovencia A. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 55 years old and married. To make a living, Jovencia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Jovencia also plants and harvests vegetables that she sells at the market.

Jovencia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovencia has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Jovencia is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, and farm supplies

loans.name: Dufatanye Bategarugori Group

texts.fr: Rachel Nyiragasiqwa est agricultrice, et elle est un membre du groupe Dutanfane Bategarugori.  Elle a 39 ans, elle est mariée, et elle a 6 enfants entre 1 an et 6 ans.  Trois de ses enfants vont à l’école.  Son niveau d’éducation est l’année 7eme primaire, et elle va utiliser son prêt pour acheter 100kgs de pommes de terres, 50kgs de mais, et autres pour son activité d’agriculture.  Sa strategie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’améliorer son activité en utilisant bien ce prêt en vue d’augmenter sa capacité.  Elle voudrait devenir une agricultrice en grande capacité dans son district de Rubavu.  Pour sa famille, elle voudrait leur bien-être, lutte contre la pauvreté, et l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Rachel Nyiragasiqwa is a farmer and a member of the Dutanfane Bategarugori group. She is a 39 year old married mother with 6 children between 1 and 6, three of whom attend school. She left school after year 7 of primary school.  She is seeking a loan in order to purchase 100 kg of potatoes, 50kg of corn and other supplies for her farming.  Her growth strategy for the business is to boost her output by using this loan. She would like to increase the scale of her business in the Rubavu district. Her aim is to help to see to her family's needs, including her children's education, and to fight against poverty.

loans.use: To purchase 100kg of potatoes

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a divorced woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over ten years, she has owned rental houses. Her potential customers are neighbours and tenants. In addition, she sells fresh water, which contributes to her income. Rehema faces a major challenge of delayed payments of rent by her tenants. She hopes to open more businesses in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase cement and sand to renovate her rental houses. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase cement and sand to renovate her rental houses.

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
42-year-old Merlina H. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is married and has 2 children, aged 18 and 14. To make a living, Merlina owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Aside fronm raising pigs, Merlina also runs a sari-sari store and helps her husband maintain their rice farm.

Merlina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlina has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Merlina is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase feeds, vitamins, and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase feeds, vitamins, and other supplies

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is a 39-year-old married woman from Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. She is married and has 2 children, aged 19 and 16. Nora earns income  through farming and raising pigs. She and her husband, who is also a farmer, plant and harvest rice crops. They sell their harvest in their town's market. Nora also grows pigs for fattening and sale. Like any other mother, Nora aims for her children to finish college and have bright futures. 

Nora joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nora has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Nora is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm supplies and pig feeds. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies and pig feeds

loans.name: Normelita

texts.en:
Normelita has been engaged in farming for over 20 years. She and her husband own and till their own land. They plant rice crops and sell their harvest to the market. They also alloted a part of their land to plant vegetables. Normelita does her best to help sustain their family. She has 6 children, with the eldest aged 17. Five of her kids go to school and it has been a challenge for Normelita and her husband to sustain their education. Normelita hopes to build up their business and earn a better income.

Normelita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Normelita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Normelita is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, and farm supplies

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel T. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 26 years old. Ritchel is married and has 2 young children. To make a living, Ritchel owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Ritchel also spends time at their farm. She helps her husband maintain their rice farm and keep it productive.

Ritchel joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ritchel has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Ritchel is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP, which will be used to buy additional merchandise to sell and also to buy farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy products to sell, and to buy supplies for farm

loans.name: Syovata

texts.en:
Syovata is a married woman who lives in a rental house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is rent.

She has been operating a retail shop for the past two years, selling to her neighbours and passersby. Syovata faces a major challenge in delayed payments by creditors. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, and sugar

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is a farmer who lives in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. He is 53 years old and married. He has 3 children – aged 18, 16, and 14. All of his 3 children go to school. Roberto works hard to sustain their education because he wants them to have bright futures.

Roberto has been farming for more than 20 years. He says he spends most of his days keeping the farm free of weeds and pests. He wants to increase his harvest and hopes for good weather and financial provision for his farm. 

Roberto joined CEVI in 2006. He said that the MFI's financial services has been very helpful to his business. He is now requesting a loan of PHP 15000,  which will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies. He is hopeful that this loan will help him increase his harvest and earn better income.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers. and farm supplies

loans.name: Twikuremubukene Group

texts.fr:
Farida M. est commerçante dans le secteur Rugerero, et elle est un membre du groupe Twikuremubikene.  Elle a 23 ans, et elle a 2 enfants entre 3 ans et 5 ans.  Un de ses enfants va à l’école.  Son niveau d’éducation est l’année 6eme primaire, et elle va utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 paires des habits pour son commerce.  Sa strategie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de rembourses bien ce crédit en vue de solliciter un autre.  Avec son prêt, elle voudrait acheter beaucoup de biens.  Elle voudrait s’autofinancer elle-même, épargner pour sa famille, et payer des frais d’études pour ses enfants.
NB: Sur la photo il y a une nouvelle femme qui est nouveau membre qui n'a pas encore sollicité le prêt.
texts.en:
Farida M. is a shopkeeper in Rugerero and is a member of the Twikuremubikene group. She is 23 years old and has two children, aged 3 and 5, one of whom attends school.  She left school after the sixth year. 
She would use her loan to buy 10 dresses for her business. Her growth strategy for the business is to repay this loan and request another. With the loan she receives she would like to purchase some goods. She would like to finance the business herself, put some money aside for her family and pay her children's school fees. 
NB in the photograph there is another woman who is a new member of the group and has not yet sought a loan.

loans.use: Achta de 10 paires de tissus pour les tailler en  habits finis

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She operates a water selling business from home, selling to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she operates a poultry business which contributes to her income.  Alice faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to open another business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase water pipes to pipe water for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase water pipes

loans.name: Twizerane Group

texts.fr: Anastasie Mujanamariya est agricultrice, et elle est un membre du groupe Twizerane.  Elle a 53 ans, elle est mariée, et elle a 3 enfants entre 19 ans et 25 ans.  Son niveau d’éducation est l’année 5eme primaire, et elle va utiliser son prêt pour acheter un champ pour son agriculture, acheter 100kgs de pommes de terre, 10 kgs de mais, et aussi pour le paiement de ses travailleurs.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’acheter beaucoup des champs et cultiver les différents produits.  Elle voudrait autofinancer elle-même, et devenir une grande agricultrice dans le secteur.  Elle voudrait aussi développer sa famille, lutte contre la pauvreté, et financer les études pour ses enfants.
texts.en: Anastasie Mujanamariya is a farmer and a member of the Twizerane group. She is a 53 years old, and married with three children aged between 19 and 25. She left school after the 5th year of primary school. She will use the loan in order to purchase a field for farming, 100kg of potatoes, 10 kg of corn, and also to pay her workers. Her growth strategy for her business is to purchase a number of fields and cultivate various crops. She would like to finance the business herself and become one of the most successful farmers in the area. She would also like to see to her family's needs, fight poverty and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: Purchase of a field for cultivating 100kg of potateos, 20kg of corn and paying labour cost

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over ten years, she has been selling charcoal from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she operates a tailoring business which contributes to her income. Nancy faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to open another business in the future.

With the Kshs 60,000, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal for resale

loans.name: Maritina

texts.en:
Maritina is a married woman with seven children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She has been operating an M-pesa (mobile money transfer) services for the past three years.  Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. Maritina faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to open another business in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking oil for her retail shop. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking oil for retail shop

loans.name: Urumuri Group

texts.fr: Therese N. est agricultrice, et elle est un membre du groupe Urumuri.  Elle a 52 ans, elle est mariée, et elle a 4 enfants entre 15 ans et 30 ans.  Quatre de ses enfants vont à l’école.  Son niveau d’éducation est l’année 5eme primaire, et elle va utiliser son prêt pour acheter 400 kgs de pommes de terre et intra-agricoles pour son activité d’agriculture.  Son stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’améliorer son activité âpres avoir bien remboursée ce prêt, et augmenter les produits.  Elle voudrait financer les autres, et avoir propre capital.  Elle voudrait le bien être de sa famille, acheter les vaches pour eux, et éduquer ses enfants.
texts.en: Therese N. is a farmer and a member of the Urumuri group. She is 52 years old, married, and the mother of four, from 15 to 30 years of age. All four of her children [have gone or] go to school. She has completed fifth grade of elementary school. She is going to use her loan to purchase 400 kg [900 lbs] of potatoes and agricultural inputs for her farming business. Her strategy for growing her income is to improve her business after repaying this loan, and increasing her produce. She would like to be able to provide financing for others, and to have her own capital. She would like to provide for the well-being of her family members, to buy cows for them, and to pay for her children’s studies.

loans.use: Purchasing 400 kg of potatos and fertilizers for her field

loans.name: Mwanahawa

texts.en:
Mwanahawa is a married woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has been operating a clothes selling business for the past five years.  She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. Mwanahawa faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase a bale of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of clothes for resale

loans.name: Bibi

texts.en:
Bibi is a single woman who owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, clothing, and electricity bills. 

She has been operating a food stall business for the past four years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Bibi faces a major challenge in  competition from other food stall operators. She hopes to establish a restaurant in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes, cooking fat oil, and bundles of wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes, cooking fat oil, and wheat flour

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a single woman who rents a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are hospital bills, rent, and food. 

She has been operating a food stall business for over two years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Amina faces a major challenge in seasonality and competition from other food stall operators. She hopes to establish a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase stocks of Irish potatoes, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase Irish potatoes, rice, beans, and cooking oil

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married woman with six children, three of whom attend school while three graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, electricity, clothing and school fees.

She has operated a food stall business for the past three years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Mwanaisha faces a major challenge of competition in her business. She hopes to establish a retail shop in the future.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of Irish potatoes, bundles of wheat flour, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of Irish potatoes, bundles of wheat flour, and cooking oil

loans.name: Galiphah

texts.en:
Galiphah is a married woman who lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and clothing.

She has operated a cafe business for the past two years, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Galiphah faces a major challenge of seasonality and competition from other cafe operators. She hopes to expand her business and establish a restaurant in the future.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bundles of cooking flour, baking flour, sacks of rice, cooking oil and sacks of beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of cooking flour, baking flour, sacks of rice, cooking oil and sacks of beans

loans.name: June

texts.en:
June is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees, clothing and electricity bills.

She has operated her clothes-selling business for the past 10 years, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she operates a pharmacy shop which contributes to her other source of income. June faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation in her business.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards. With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase cloth materials for resale.

loans.use: To purchase cloth materials for resale

loans.name: Mshikamano Group

texts.en:
Chiku I. is in her early thirties and is married with three children. Chiku began with selling water from door to door, but three years ago she began selling childrens clothes and traditional garments (Vitenge) on her door to door routes. Chiku does this from 09:00 am to 04:00 pm and earns Chiku a low monthly profit. 

This will be Chiku's fourth loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. Chiku used her previous loans to increase her stock of clothes and Vitenges. These loans have since been successfully repaid. Chiku aims to once again increase her stock of clothes to get ready for the busy christmas period which is coming up. Chiku's dream is to one day open up a shop where she can sell food and clothes. 

Chiku will take this loan with her loan group Mshikamano, which totals 17 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans. 

In the picture, Chiku can be seen as the person on the far left, wearing brown and a brown head cover.

loans.use: Increase stock of clothes and traditional garments.

loans.name: Crane Group

texts.en:
Shaban Mohammed is in his late thirties and is married with five children. Shaban has been selling used clothes for the past five years. The business is open between 06:30 am and 06:00 pm and earns Shaban a low monthly profit.

This will be Shaban's fifth loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. Shaban used the previous loans to increase his stock of clothes. All these loans have since been successfully repaid. With his fifth loan, Shaban aims to incraese his business and to again increase his stock. Shaban's dream is to one day own a large clothing shop.

Shaban will share this loan with his loan group Crane, which totals 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans. 

In the picture, Shaban can be seen in the front row, doing a funny face.

loans.use: Increase his clothing inventory.

loans.name: Mikoroshini Group

texts.en:
Monda K. is in his early thirties and is married. For the past five years, Monda has been running a broiler farm, where he breeds and sells broiler chickens. The business is open between 07:00 am and 05:00 pm and earns Monda a low monthly profit.

This will be Monda's first Motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A Mothisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. Monda aims to use this loan to increase the working capital of his business. He also aims to buy more broiler chicks to increase his stock. 

Monda will share this loan with his loan group Mikoroshini, which totals 11 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Monda can be seen in the front row leaning on the bench.

loans.use: Increase the capital of the business and buy new broiler chicks.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, clothing and school fees.

She operates a clothes-selling business in a shop, selling to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she operates a beauty salon which contributes to her other source of income. Jane faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation and competition in her business. She hopes to open a cosmetics shop in the future.

With the 80,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase a bale of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of clothes for resale

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a food-vending business for the past three years, selling at the market, from home and door-to-door. Millicent faces a major challenges in transportation and seasonality in her business. She hopes to establish a cafe in the future.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to start a retail shop purchase 40 pieces of Kikoi (a piece of colored cloth used as clothing and wrapped around the waist and legs or shoulders) and kitchen utensils (plates, jugs and glasses) for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To start a retail shop, purchase 40 pieces of kikois (a colorful wrap) and kitchen utensils (plates, jugs and glasses) for sale.

loans.name: Momela Group

texts.en:
Mwajuba J. is in her late thirties and is married with four children. Majuba has been running a small fish restaurant for the past 20 years. The shop is open between 11:00 am and 04:00 pm daily and earns Mwajuba a low monthly profit. 

This will be Mwajuba's fourth loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. Mwajuba used her previous loans to buy land and started to build a new house for herself. These loans have since been successfully repaid. Mwajuba will use her fourth loan to increase basic supplies for the shop, such as plates, buckets, cutlery and cups. Mwajuba's dream is to one day finish her house.

Mwajuba will share this loan with her loan group Momela, which totals 19 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans. 

In the picture, Mwajuba can be seen wearing a green dress in the front row.

loans.use: To increase her stock of plates and cutlery at her fish restaurant.

loans.name: Suipacha Group

texts.es: El Banco D. Emprendimiento SUIPACHA es un banco que ya está en su cuarto ciclo y el Banco está conformado por 9 Integrantes 7 Mujeres y 2 Varones y las señoras se dedican al comercio y venta ropas y otros, y la Sra. EVELIN ROCIO es la presidenta del Banco y  tiene una hija y ella se dedica a la venta D. tenis en la feria D. desaguadero y con el préstamo a lograra comprar más mercadería y aumento D. su capital D. trabajo y la Sra. MARIBEL es la secretaria en el Banco y ella se dedica a la venta D. edredones, sabanas y camas a facilitad y con el préstamo comprará más mercaderías para su negocio D. esta forma mejorara sus ingresos económicos y aumento D. su capital D. trabajo, y la Sra. MERCEDES ella es la tesorera del banco y tiene 6 hijos y se dedica a la venta D. ropa americana ropa usada y víveres y el préstamo se invertirá en compra D. mercaderías y D. esta forma mejorara sus ingresos, y su calidad D. vida y aumento D. capital D. trabajo para poder seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The Suipacha community bank is already in its fourth loan cycle.  The bank has 9 members: 7 women and 2 men.  The ladies work in sales, selling clothes and other items.

Mrs Evelin Rocio is the bank's president.  She has a daughter and she sells sneakers in Desaguadero Market.  She will use her loan to buy more merchandise and increase her working capital.

Maribel is the bank's secretary and she sells comforters, sheets and beds on credit.  She will use her loan to buy more merchandise for her business and thereby increase her income and her working capital.

Mercedes is the bank's treasurer and she has 6 children.  She sells American clothes, second-hand clothes and food.  Her loan will be invested in buying merchandise so that she can improve her income and her quality of life, and increase her working capital so that she can get ahead in life.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of sports shoes

loans.name: Medina

texts.en:
Medina is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent.

She has operated a timber-selling business for the past five years, selling to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she has a garage which contributes to her other source of income. Medina faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase timber for sale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase timber for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more gallons of red oil, peppers, onions, tomatoes, rice etc

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Isaura Suyen

texts.es:
Isaura se dedica al comercio desde hace cinco años, es una madre muy dedicada para apoyar a sus dos hijos. 
Su negocio es la venta de ropa, cosméticos iniciando con poco dinero y con ayuda de su esposo quien trabaja en una empresa de embotelladora. Que gracias a su tenacidad y empeño por apoyar a la familia comienza a trabajar con financiamiento que Afodenic. Lo que vino a mejorar sus niveles de ventas como captar clientela. Ha comprado vitrinas donde exhibir sus productos variados a si como de la Avon lo que trabaja por catálogos. 
Sus productos de ropa los compra en un mercado de la capital a mayoristas lo que viene a dar a precios accesibles a sus clientes. Con este nuevo préstamo comprara. Una docena de trajes de niños, una docena de blusas de dama y caballero, sandalias, carteras, cosméticos ya que la demanda es mucha
texts.en:
Isaura has been in business for the past five years.  She is a mother who is very dedicated to the support of her children.
With the help of her husband who works in a bottling plant, she sells clothing and cosmetics which she started with little money.  Thanks to her tenancity and hard work supporting her family, she began to work with Afodenic.  This gave her the ability to improve her sales in attracting customers.  She has bought showcases to exhibit her various products such as Avon that she sells through catalogs.  Her clothing is bought from wholesalers in the capital so that she can have affordable prices for her customers.  
With this new loan she will buy a dozen children's outfits, a dozen men and women's shirts, sandals, wallets and the very popular cosmetics

loans.use: To buy a variety of clothing and cosmetics to have more sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ingredients for making bread such as: flour, sugar, cheese, yeast, etc. to increase her production

loans.name: Orlando Jose

texts.es:
Orlando es un hombre muy trabajador, padre de familia de dos hijos. Casado. Hoy en día trabaja en servicio de taxi siendo el vehículo propio, adquirido con muchos esfuerzos.
Entre las dificultades es lo altos costos de la gasolina, lo que los clientes no abordan por no pagar la carrera. Pero hay días buenos en donde puede equilibrar sus gastos.
Es atreves de los financiamientos que ha logrado dar mantenimientos a su vehículo lo que para él, es de gran beneficio para seguir dando un mejor servicios a sus clientes.
Son cinco  ciclos lo que ha venido trabajando, con este nuevo préstamo hará compra de llantas, batería, tapizado y mano de obra. Lo cual lo hace cada diez oh doce meses.
texts.en:
Orlando is a very hard-working man.  He has two children.  He currently works providing taxi services in his own vehicle which he acquired through a lot of hard work.

One of the difficulties he has in his business is dealing with high gasoline costs which his customers don't help to cover when they skip without paying for their journeys.  However, there are also good days in which he can balance his expenses.

Through loans, Orlando has managed to keep his vehicle in good working order which, for him is a great help toward providing a better service to his customers.

Orlando has been through five loan cycles.  He will use this new loan to buy tires, a car battery, upholstery and labor.  He does this every ten or twelve months.

loans.use: To have maintenance work done on his taxi, buying a battery and tires.  He does this every twelve months, so that he can provide a good service to his customers since it is his source of income

loans.name: Lucas

texts.es: El señor Lucas O. Castellón tiene 47 años soltero, vive con su hermana Bertha O. Castellón también es soltera con 2 hijos, viven en sector de Candelaria Chimpa Rancho que está ubicado a 62 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, El señor Lucas es agricultor produce papa, papa liza, oca es una persona humilde pero trabajador, él necesita dinero para reintegrar de un lote de terreno que está comprando de ocasión. Para él es muy difícil acudir a los Bancos de la ciudad además les piden muchos requisitos, se tuvo la iniciativa de ir a la zona y otorgar crédito, El señor Lucas está muy contento de haber conseguido un crédito, ahora va poder comprar el lote de terreno agricola y ampliar la producción agrícola así va tener más ingresos económicos para hacer estudiar a sus 2 sobrinos menores, El señor Lucas tiene el sueño de sacar profesionales a sus sobrinos como técnicos en la agricultura para que ellos puedan mejorar la producción para la seguridad alimentaria.
texts.en:
Señor Lucas O. Castellón is 47 years old and single. He lives with his sister, Bertha O. Castellón, who is also single with 2 children. They live in the sector of Candelaria Chimpa Rancho which is located 62 kms. from the city of Cochabamba. Señor Lucas is a farmer. He produces potatos, papa liza (a tuber grown in the Andean region), and Oca (an edible root). He is a humble but hardworking person.

He needs money in order to pay back a debt for an agricultural parcel that he is buying at a bargain price. For him, it is very difficult to get to banks in the city. In addition, these banks have a lot of requirements. Cidre took the initiative to go to his area and grant credit.

Señor Lucas is very happy to be getting a loan. Now, he is going to be able to purchase the agricultural land, enlarge his crop production, and, thus, have more income to put into the education of his two young nephews. Señor Lucas’ dream is that his nephews become professional agricultural technical experts so that they can improve production for food security.

loans.use: To pay off a loan for agricultural land

loans.name: Mirsa Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mirsa es una pequeña comerciante de venta de cosméticos en su casa de habitación, iniciando hace nueve años. Con poca mercadería, hoy en día con Afodenic sus niveles de venta aumentaron al ofrecer más variedad en sus mercaderías con precios más competitivos.
En donde está afiliada con la Avon que distribuye una gama de variedad de producto en donde trabaja por catálogos, a si como otros que compra en un mercado de la capital a mayoristas, lo que vende a mejor precio  a sus clientes.
Con este nuevo financiamiento invertirá en la compra de perfumes para dama, caballeros, shampoo, gelatina, cremas de cuerpo, pinturas, vanidad, a si como la compra de ropa como pantalones, faldas, camisas. Logrando la captación de cliente como sus ventas.
texts.en:
Mirsa runs a small business selling cosmetics from her home, which she began nine years ago. With little merchandise to offer Afodenic helped her increase her level of sales over time and she now offers more product variety at competitive prices.

She is affiliated with Avon, which distributes a wide product range through catalog orders. Like others she also buys from wholesalers at a market in the capital, and then resells at higher prices to her customers.

With this new financing she will buy perfume for women and men, shampoo, gel, body creams, cosmetics, vanities, as well as clothing such as pants, skirts, and shirts. She is achieving customer acquisition through her sales efforts.

loans.use: Buy perfume for women and men, shampoo, gel, various articles of clothing to increase her sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: He will buy fabric in various colors to increase his production

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es: El señor Manuel de Jesús V. G., tiene 59 años habita en el barrio Waspan Norte , es casado y su esposa se dedica a las labores del hogar, ellos tienen 2 hijos menores de edad que estudian la escuela primaria, él labora como mesero en un restaurante desde hace 16 años, actividad que se ha convertido en la fuente principal de ingresos de la familia, es para su hogar que solicita un préstamo para la construcción de un cuarto de su hijo mayor y poder ofrecerle mayor privacidad, ya que está creciendo y este le demanda esa condición, seria  para él un alivio el poder brindarla  su familia las condiciones optimas para su buen desarrollo social de su familia.
texts.en: Manuel de Jesús V. G. is 59 years old.  He lives in Waspan Norte neighborhood.  He is married and his wife is a housewife.  They have two dependent children who are in elementary school.  Manuel has worked as a waiter in a restaurant for 16 years.  This job is the main source of income for his family.  He is requesting this loan for his household so that he can build a room for his eldest son, so that he can offer him more privacy since he is growing and needs more privacy.  It would be a relief for him to be able to provide his family with optimum conditions for good social development.

loans.use: To build a room in his home

loans.name: Rossio Angela

texts.es: La Sra. Rossio es una mujer que a su corta edad ya cuenta con un negocio establecido que levanto ella sola, La Sra. Rossio es madre de un niño de 3 años que adoran , viven los tres junto con el padre del niño en anticrético cuenta con todas las comodidades necesarias, Ella tiene una frase que siempre la recuerda " Una mujer debe de tener sus propios ingresos económicos para sus gustos y además apoyar al marido" . por eso Ella tiene una tienda en un Nuevo centro comercial donde alquila una tienda y vende accesorios para celulares, (Funditas , Llaveros Cargadores , Carcasas , etc.) a ella siempre  le gusto diferenciarse entre otras comerciante por la novedad Razón por la cual ella solicita el crédito para comprar accesorios y celulares  de novedad para este fin de año.
texts.en:
Ms. Rossio is a woman who at her young age already has an established business that she started on her own. She is the mother of a 3-year-old she dotes on, and lives along with the father of the child under an anticretico arrangement (special rental contract specific to Bolivia) with all the necessary amenities.

She uses a phrase that I always remember "A woman should have her own income to satisfy her own needs and also to support the husband”. Therefore she is renting a store in a new mall where she sells cellphone accessories, (cosies, keychains, chargers, cases, etc.).

She always likes to distinguish herself from other merchants through novelty items. That is the reason why she requested a loan to buy accessories and novelty phones for this year-end period.

loans.use: Buy accessories and novelty phones

loans.name: Neil Tamaris

texts.es: La señora Neil Tamaris M. C., es una mujer de 41 años, casada, que habita en el peligroso barrio de Laureles Norte , tiene un hijo pequeño que aun no asiste al preescolar, ellos con su esfuerzo lograron la apertura de una pulpería, y desde hace 2 años han tenido ese ingreso importante en su hogar, es para su negocio que solicita un préstamo para la compra de abarrotes, productos para el hogar, personal y gaseosas, que surtan su tienda y cubran la buena demanda navideña ha beneficio de la economía para futuras inversiones o proyectos con su hijo que tenga en pro de su desarrollo social.
texts.en:
Mrs Neil Tamaris M. C. is a 41 year-old, married woman who lives in the dangerous neighborhood of Laureles Norte.  She has a young son who still doesn't go to pre school.  Through a lot of hard work, she has managed to open a grocery store and she has had this important source of income for her household for two years now.

She is requesting this loan for her business, to buy groceries, household products, personal items and soda with which to stock her store and cover the high demand which exists during the Christmas period.  She has benefited from the money to make future investments or projects for her son, in favor of his social development.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Fidelia

texts.es:
La señora M. Fidelia A. V.D.,  tiene 56  años D. edad, viven en la comunidad D. callejas D. la  provincia D. mizque del departamento D. cochabamba,   tiene cinco  hijos, el esposo D. la señora falleció muy joven a causa D. una enfermedad, la señora tuvo que trabajar sola para hacer estudiar y darles D. comer a sus hijos,  ahora la mayoría D. sus hijos son mayores y  casados y solo una es dependiente D. ella. 

Esta época por el desastre natural D. la sequía que hubo en toda la zona  su pequeña parcela D. cebolla no maduro bien, este desastre le hizo fracasar en sus ingresos económicos que ella esperaba. 

La señora M. Fidelia A. V.D.  es una persona  muy querida y respetada en el lugar donD. vive, por lo dedicada a sus hijos  y su trabajo que a veces hasta tiene que trabajar en jornal en la agricultura para ganar algunos pesos y así mantenerse, ella está solicitando el crédito para comprar abonos orgánicos para sus cultivos para aumentar su producción y mejorar sus ingreso económico y  darle una mejor calidad D. vida a su hijo y pueda asistir al colegio  en mejores condiciones.  El crédito ayudara mucho a su hijo y a ella en el duro trabajo que realiza.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fidelia A. Vda. D. Montaño, 56, lives in the community of Callejas, Mizque province, Cochabamba department.  She has five children.  Her husband died very young due to an illness and she had to work alone to proviD. food and education for her children.  Now, most of them are married adults and only one is still dependent on her.

Because of the natural disaster that the drought was throughout the zone, her small onion crop did not mature properly.  This disaster led to complete failure of her expected income.

Fidelia is a very respected and esteemed person where she lives because of her dedication to her children and her work; sometimes she even had to work as an agricultural day laborer to earn a few pesos to support herself.

She is asking for this loan to buy organic manure for her crops to increase production and improve income to proviD. a better quality of life for her son so that he can go to school in better conditions.  The loan will help her son and her with the hard work she does.

loans.use: To buy organic manure.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: El Sr. El Pedro es cliente antiguo, trabajo en grupo Tríos del sur, el vive en la zona de Alto Lima de la ciudad del El Alto. Se dedica a la venta de DVDs de música seleccionada en la zona sur, por ACHUMANI Y San Miguel,  todos los días tiene que levantarse desde tempranas horas de la mañana para ir a trabajar es una distancia larga que el tiene que recorrer, el  Sr. Pedro esta separado de su esposa, el vive con sus cuatro hijos, quienes ya trabajan independientemente y también le ayudan en el negocio es una persona que viaja para traer su mercadería a la localidad de Desaguadero, le va muy bien en esta actividad, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mr. El Pedro is a long-time client. He works in the group Trios from the south and lives in the Alto Lima zone in the city of El Alto. He sells music DVDs chosen in the southern zone around Achumani and San Miguel. Every day he has to get up very early in the morning to go to work, and the distance he travels in very long. Mr. Pedro is separated from his wife and lives with his four sons, who already work independantly and also help him with his business. He is a person who travels to bring his merchandise to the Desaguadero locality. He likes this activity and is very grateful to the institution for the support they bring.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Mariluz Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora  Mariluz del Socorro, es madre soltera de 38 años de edad que tiene 2 hijos adolecentes, que estudian la escuela primaria, ella se dedica a vender ropa y zapatos, hace unos meses su madre se enfermo y tuvo que cubrir unos gastos hospitalarios, y descuido las ventas de su tienda por lo cual entro en una crisis económica, es ahora para su negocio solicita un préstamo para la compra de mayor mercadería de ropa y zapatos para dama, que favorezcan las ventas sobretodo en esta temporada navideña que se incrementan los volúmenes de ingresos, espera le brinden un apoyo económico en pro de las condiciones de toda su familia.
texts.en: Ms. Mariluz del Socorro is a single mother of 38 and has 2 adolescent children who study in primary school. She sells clothes and shoes. A few months ago her mother got sick and she had to cover some hospital costs. She neglected her store and for this reason she entered into an economic crisis. She is now requesting a loan for her business to buy more merchandise of ladies clothing and shoes, which favour sales especially in the Christmas season and increase income volumes. She hopes they bring her economic support to improve the conditions of her entire family.

loans.use: Purchase clothes and shoes for her store

loans.name: Virginia Rita

texts.es: Sra. Virginia es cliente antigua que esta retornando después de mas de tres años, su familia solo compone de su hija de 20 años y ella, ya que sus hijas mayores tienen ya familia y ya no viven cerca de ella solo la visitan de vez en cuando los fines de semana, Sra. Virginia como la conocen todos tiene un almacén en la zona de Cota Cota esta cerca de su  casa esta aproximadamente de  2 cuadras y media de la tienda, además que ella con su hija participa en la venta de artesanías y también vende sándwich y refrescos en en la cancha de césped sintética los fines de semana ya que requiere de una buena inversión ya que solo en refrescos lleva 20cajas cada fin de semana, ella en este momento solicita el crédito para hacer un pedidos de panetones que solo se hace una ves por mayor y además solicita el resto para la compra de abarrotes de por lo que se solicita el financiamiento kiva.
texts.en: Ms. Virginia is an old client who has returned after more than three years. Her family is only made up of her 20 year-old daughter and herself. Her older daughters already have families and no longer live near her, only visiting from time to time on the weekends. Ms. Virginia, as everyone knows, has a grocery store in the Cota Cota zone approximately 2 and a half blocks from her house. As well, her and her daughter participate in the sale of crafts and also sell sandwiches and soft drinks at the synthetic grass playing field on the weekends. This requires a good investment since she handles 20 cases of soft drinks alone each weekend. At this time she is requesting a loan through Kiva financing to make an order of panetones, which are only made once for wholesale, and the rest she is requesting for the purchase of groceries.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (panetones and groceries)

loans.name: Lázaro Antonio

texts.es: El señor Lázaro Antonio E. G., tiene la edad e 31 años es soltero pero tienen 2 hijos a los cuales apoya económicamente ellos se dedican a los estudios y son bastante unidos, el señor Lázaro es Maestro de Obra, pero sus contratos no son estables económicamente, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo ya que sus limitados ingresos no le permiten remodelar la fachada de su casa, es para esto que solicita un préstamo para la compra de matariles de construcción que favorezcan la obra y mejore las condiciones en la que actualmente habita y que sus hijos convivan en un ambiente agradable para su desarrollo social.
texts.en: Mr. Lázaro Antonio E. G., 31, is single but has 2 children in school that he supports economically and with whom he is close. Mr. Larzaro is a foreman but his contracts are not economically stable and for this reason he is asking for a loan since his limited income doesn't allow him to remodel the facade of his house. This is why he is asking for a loan to buy construction materials useful for the work and to improve his current living conditions so that his children can live together in a pleasant environment for their social development.

loans.use: To build a wall

loans.name: Rita Ana

texts.es: La señora Rita Ana S. C. tiene la edad de 37 años, es madre soltera y sus hijos son adolecentes que estudian en un colegio público, ella vende tortillas, actividad que se ha convertido en el sustento de la familia, sus hijos son pequeños para trabajar, por tanto ella no tiene el apoyo de ningún familiar, fue con sus ahorros que compro un quintal de maíz, el mes pasado pero para este mes las ventas se duplican las ventas se duplican y espera poder cubrir la demanda es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para la compra de materia prima, este crédito le permitirá incrementar sus ventas y tener capital necesario para reinversiones a su negocio, estudios de sus hijos y mejora de las condiciones de vida de su pequeña familia.
texts.en: Rita Ana S. C. is 37 years old.  She is a single mother and her children are teenagers who are in school.  She sells tortillas.  This is an activity which now supports her family.  Her children are too young to work therefore she doesn't have support from any family members.  She used her savings to buy a 100kg sack of corn last month but this month her sales will double and she hopes to be able to cover the demand.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can buy raw materials.  This loan will allow her to increase her sales and have the capital she needs to reinvest in her business and her children's studies and to improve her small family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making her tortillas

loans.name: Santos Juan

texts.es: El Sr. Santos es cliente de la agencia que se encuentra en segunda secuencia el señor tiene dos hijos uno de quince años el cual estudia por las noches en un colegio nocturno ya que trabaja en el mismo sindicato que el Sr. Santos de control de parada, hasta las cuatro de la tarde porque tiene que ir a cuidar a su hermanito pequeño hasta que lleguen sus papas, don Santos trabaja desde las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 8:00 de la noche, hora que llega a sus casa descansa una hora y vuelve a salir pero le acompaña su esposa, ya que ella trabaja en el día en una fabrica donde elaboran chicharrones, ellos se dedican a trabajar todo el día , el crédito que están solicitando es para el pintado de la movilidad, el Sr. Santos tiene una familia muy trabajadora, el dinero lo utilizara en el pintado de su movilidad y el mantenimiento de la misma, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Santos is a client of our agency who is in his second loan cycle.  He has two children.  One of his children is 15 years old and studies at night school since he works in the same taxi union as Mr Santos until four in the afternoon.  At that time he has to go and take care of his little brother until his parents arrive home.

Santos works from 7.00am to 8.00pm when he returns home to rest for an hour and then goes back out.  This time his wife accompanies him.  She works during the day in a factory where they make fried pork rinds.  Santos and his wife work all day.  His family is very hard working.  The loan he is requesting will be used to paint and service his vehicle.  He is very grateful to the institution for the support they have provided.

loans.use: To fix his vehicle (bodywork or paint)

loans.name: Saturninio

texts.es: El señor Saturninio G. P., es un hombre de 43 años, que habita en el barrio Laureles Sur, es casado y su esposa le apoya con sus ingresos de su trabajo de operaria de zona franca, ellos tienen 3 hijos que estudian, él labora como guarda de seguridad, desde hace 3 años, los ingresos de la familia son bastante limitados y habitan en una casa humilde de un peligroso barrio de la capital, ellos solicitan un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción para una falda de bloques y terminarla arriba con laminas de zinc en su vivienda ya que la fuertes lluvias de invierno le deterioraron en gran manera su casa y es para ellos una necesidad e emergencia la remodelación en beneficio de toda su pequeña familia.
texts.en:
Saturninio G. P. is a 43 year old man who lives in the neighborhood Laureles Sur. He is married, and his wife helps him with the income from her work as an operator in the free trade zone. They have three children who are in school. He has been working as a security guard for three years. The family income is fairly limited, and they live in a humble house in a dangerous neighborhood in the capital.

They are requesting a loan for the purchase of construction materials for a block wall and to finish the top of their house with sheets of metal roofing, since the strong rains of winter cause their house to deteriorate greatly and therefore they need an emergency remodeling for the benefit of their entire small family.

loans.use: To build a block wall and finish it up top with sheets of metal roofing.

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es: El señor Sebastián  es transportista propietario de un automóvil pequeño que trabaja como Minibús en un  sindicato,   lleva en esta actividad 27 años, El Sr.  Sebastián vive junto a su esposa y a su hijo , su esposa para poder solventar sus gastos familiares  se dedica a la venta de comida puesto que en el lugar donde viven se encuentra la parada de una línea de micros, don Sebastián y su esposa con muchos esfuerzo lograron comprar una casa, actualmente se encuentra en construcción, por eso es que solicitan el crédito, para cubrir los costos de la mano de obra y la compra de material de construccion, El Sr. Sebastián solicita por segunda vez crédito en la institución demostrando responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos.
texts.en: Sebastián is the driver of a small car that he owns, and he works as a microbus taxi driver in a labor union.  He has been in this business for 27 years.  Sebastian lives with his wife and their son.  In order to pay the family expenses, his wife sells food.  Since in the place where they live, there is a stop for the microbus taxi line, with a lot of effort Sebastian and his wife managed to buy a house that is currently under construction.  They are requesting the loan to cover the costs of the labor and the purchase of construction materials.  Sebastian is requesting his second loan from the institution and will demonstrate responsibility and punctuality in his payments.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Esau Eliazar

texts.es: El señor Esau Eliazar S. C. es un joven de 21 años, soltero sin hijos, trabajador de Café Soluble, la empresa nicaragüense que exporta el mejor café de Nicaragua,  él es un hombre inteligente que se ha enfrentado a muchas dificultades económicas pero ha podido salir adelante gracias a su esfuerzo y el firme propósito de ayuda a su familia, el solicita un préstamo para componer el baño principal de la vivienda de sus padres, es para él un símbolo de honra a sus padres el devolverles un poco lo que han hecho por el apoyándolo a que habiten en un hogar mas digno de vivir.
texts.en: Esau Eliazar S. C. is a young man who is 21 years old.  He is single and doesn't have any children.  He works in Café Soluble, the Nicaraguan company that exports the best coffee of Nicaragua.  He is an intelligent man that has been faced with many economic difficulties, but he has been able to get ahead thanks to his efforts and the solid intention to help his family.  He is requesting a loan to repair the main bathroom of his parent's house.  For him it is a symbol of honor to his parents to return to them a little of what they have done in supporting him, so they can live in a more dignified home.

loans.use: To repair the bathroom in his parent's house

loans.name: Norma Azucena

texts.es:
la señora Norma Azucena E. tiene 37 años de edad, vive en el barrio San Francisco, Norma es una mujer muy trabajadora, se dedica a la venta de joyas, su producto lo vende por pedidos grandes y tambien al detalle con los vecinos de su comunidad.
Norma es una mujer responsable y honrada.
junto con su esposo trabajan duro para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de joyas, en esta epoca de navidad muchas personas comprar joyas y es la oportunidad de vender mas.
las ganancias las necesita para dales una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señora Norma Azucena E., age 37, lives in the San Francisco neighborhood. Norma is a very hardworking woman. She is engaged in the sale of jewelry. She sells her product through wholesale orders and also at retail to neighbors in her community.

Norma is a responsible and honorable woman. Together with her husband, she works hard to cover the household expenses. During this Christmas season a lot of people buy jewelry, and it is an opportunity to sell more. She needs the earnings to provide a better quality of life to her children.

loans.use: The purchase of earrings, rings, chains, bracelets, and medals.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Eddy Santiago

texts.es:
Eddy es un padre de familia de cinco hijos, casado, siendo su oficio la compra y venta de reciclaje de plásticos desde hace ocho años, viene trabajando solo,  ya que anteriormente trabajaba en una empresa de reciclaje.
Cuando inicio lo hizo con poco capital lo que necesitaba más dinero para la inversión. Lo que  Afodenic da el apoyo mediante su préstamo lo que da otro giró en su negocio comprando más plástico.
Este es su segundo financiamiento lo que comprara materia prima en la compra de variedad de plástico para seguir aumentando sus niveles de ganancias.
Como planes es seguir invirtiendo en su negocio para la ayuda económica de su familia que es lo primordial.
texts.en:
Eddy is married and has five children.  He has worked buying and selling plastic recyclables for eight years.  He works alone now, but he used to work for a recycling business.

When he started his business, he had little money and needed more capital to invest.  Afodenic supported him with a loan, which he invested in his business by buying more plastic products.

This is his second loan.  He will purchase a variety of plastic products to continue increasing his income.  

He plans to continue investing in his business because financially supporting his family is most important.

loans.use: Purchase plastic products to increase sales

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
la señora Matilde V. A. tiene 58 años de edad, vive en el Barrio Fonseca de la ciudad de Choluteca, Matilde se dedica a la produccion y venta de nacatamales, tambien tiene una cria de cerdos, los cerdos los destaza los fines de semana para vender la carne a sus vecinos y en carnicerias de choluteca.
los nacatamales los vende por encargos y siempre deja unos para venta por unidad a sus vecinos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales para la fabricacion de sus deliciosos nacatamales.
El nacatamal es muy comido para la epoca de navidad, es una comida tradicional de nuestro pais y se come mucho para las fiestas navideñas, es por eso que tiene muchos pedidos y necesita producir mucho para no quedarle mal a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Matilde V. A. is 58 years old and lives in the Fonseca neighborhood in the city of Choluteca.  Matilde works making and selling nacatamales; she also raises pigs which she kills on the weekends to sell the meat to her neighbors and in butchershops of Choluteca.

She sells the nacatamales by order though she always makes a few extra to sell one by one to her neighbors.

She will use this loan to buy ingredients to make her delicious nacatamales.

The nacatamal is a very popular dish at Christmastime; it is a traditional dish of Honduras which is eaten frequently during Christmas parties.  This is why she has many orders that she needs to fulfill to make her customers happy.

loans.use: Purchase cornmeal, chicken, pigs, condiments, banana leaves, olives, vegetables

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is thirty-eight years old.  She lives in the district of Tambogrande in the province of Piura in northern Peru.  It is a semi-tropical zone, primarily populated by farmers and ranchers.  Many residents own small fruit plantations or raise cattle or other animals.  Mercedes owns her home and shares it with her two children.  She is a single mother.

Out of her home, Mercedes operates a small juice and fruit selling business.  She can be found in the door of her home each day offering a wide range of juices to passersby, workers on break or other members of the community.  She is well known in the region for the high quality of her products.  In addition, Mercedes raises fowl in corrals behind her home.  She raises ducks, chickens and turkeys.

Mercedes plans to use the loan proceeds to purchase additional fruit, supplies and equipment to improve her business.  She hopes this will attract additional clients and further improve the quality of her service.  This will be her first loan with Edpyme Alternativa.  She is thankful for the opportunity to be able to obtain credit at a reduced interest rate as a result of the Kiva support.

loans.use: To purchase additional fruit, supplies and equipment to improve her business.

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es:
la señora Dionicia N. vive en el barrio San Jose de la ciudad de Choluteca, Dionicia se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pequeña pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion, ahi vende productos relacionados con la canasta basica. Dionicia se levanta todos los dia a las 5 de la mañana y a las 6 empieza a atender a sus clientes.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia y asi tener bien surtido su negocio ya que las ventas en diciembre aumentan y desea estar preparada para cubrir con todas las exigencias de sus clientes.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Dionicia Nunez lives in the San Jose neighborhood of the city of Choluteca.  Dionicia works selling basic foodstuffs and groceries; she has a small store that she runs out of her home.  She sells basic consumer goods.  Dionicia gets up early every day at 5 am and starts selling to her customers at 6.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise to stock her business since sales in December are always higher and she would like to be prepared to meet all the demands of her customers.

She will use her earnings from sales to cover her household expenses.

loans.use: Purchase flour, beans, cold cuts, sugar, rice, bread, soft drinks, pastries, candles, milk, churros, and cereal

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is forty-four years old.  She lives in the district of Las Lomas in the province of Piura in northern Peru.  It is a semi-tropical zone, primarily populated by farmers and ranchers.  Many residents own small fruit plantations or raise cattle or other animals.  Nancy maintains a stable home, living with her husband and their daughter.

Nancy raises sheep and hogs in corrals behind her home.  She has a small herd which she feeds with various local plants and feed from local mills.  She cares for the animals until they reach the appropriate size and weight to be sold in local markets or to neighbors.  The animals serve as an important part of many traditional dishes and the nutrition of the local populace.  The family has a small parcel of agricultural land which they inherited.  Nancy’s husband works on the land raising crops and also works as a farm hand on local plots during varying seasons and harvest times.

This will be Nancy’s first loan with Edpyme Alternativa.  She plans to use the loan to purchase additional feed for her animals in order to ensure their proper growth and maturation.  She hopes to be able to increase her family’s income over time in order to ensure that they are more stable economically and less dependent on the labors of her husband outside of the home.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed for her animals in order to ensure their proper growth and maturation.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.en:
Jose is thirty-three years old. He lives in the district of Tambogrande in the province of Piura in northern Peru.  It is a semi-tropical zone, primarily populated by farmers and ranchers.  Many residents own small fruit plantations or raise cattle or other animals.  Jose maintains a stable home, sharing it with his partner and their three young children.

Jose and his wife raise animals in corrals near their home.  The raise sheep, hogs, chickens and ducks.  They feed these animals with local products from farmers or products from local corn and rice factories.  The animals are raised and cared for until the reach the appropriate size and weight to be sold in local markets or to neighbors.  Peru has a rich cultural tradition and many special dishes using farm-raised animals.
