In addition to raising animals, Jose works as a farm hand earning approximately $9.00 a day.  Between these activities he and his family are able to maintain a relatively consistent income stream and meet their basic needs.

The requested loan will be used to purchase additional feed and animals in order to continue to expand the family’s herd.  Jose hopes to be able to increase the activity of their business, improve their corrals and make better use of their land.  He is proud to be able to earn income independently.  He hopes to be able to improve his family’s lifestyle and provide his children with greater opportunities.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed and animals in order to continue to expand the family’s herd.

loans.name: Maria Salome

texts.es:
María es una mujer emprendedora, con un pequeño negocio la venta de comida en su casa de habitación, el cual lleva varios años elaborando ricas fritanga.
Ha sido una madre esforzada para apoyar  a sus hijos, ya que no cuenta con el apoyo del padre. Pero gracias a su empeño y apoyo de  la institución mediante su crédito ha logrado incrementar las ventas, con un menú variado. 
Es su octavo ciclo lo que su préstamo será para comprar productos en granos básicos, frutas, verduras, carne, pollo, lácteos, tasas, vasos, de plásticos como bolsa para empaque, leña ya que cocina en fuego de leña ya que es de menos gasto aunque se ajita mas. Contenta por hacer posible su nivel de ventas diarias, ya que hay día que no se vende todo pero se equilibra con su capital.
texts.en: Maria is an entrepreneurial woman with a small business of selling prepared food from her home; for several years she has been making tasty fritanga dishes (a type of fried food) Maria has been working very hard to support her children, given that she does not have the support of the father. But thanks to her efforts and the help of the institution that provides her loans, she has been able to increase her sales with a varied menu. This is Maria's eighth loan cycle and the funds will be used to purchase supplies such as staple grains, fruit, vegetables, meat, chicken, dairy products, cups and glasses, plastic wrap for packaging, as well as firewood which Maria uses for cooking since it is the least expensive option. Maria is happy about her daily sales volume, since although there are days when she does not sell the whole stock, it evens out with the help of her working capital.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients such as staple grains, fruit, vegetables, dairy products, meat, and chicken

loans.name: Santos Elida

texts.en:
Santos is thirty-eight years old.  She lives in the district of Tambogrande in the province of Piura in northern Peru.  It is a semi-tropical zone which is very productive in fruits and feed for animals.  Many residents have small fruit plantations or raise animals near their homes.  Santos lives in her family’s home, along with her parents, her husband and their young child.

Santos raises sheep and goats in the yard behind their home.  She currently has eleven sheep and fourteen goats.  She raises these animals on local farm products or by-products from local rice and corn mills.  She cares for the animals until they reach the appropriate size to be sold in local markets or to neighbors.  Her husband works as a farm laborer on local properties.  Santos’s father owns a small property on which he raises crops.

This will be Santo’s first loan with Edpyme Alternativa.  She plans to use the funds to purchase additional feed and expand her herd.  She hopes that the increased capital will allow her to continue to grow her business and improve the income prospects of her family.  She dreams of making various improvements to the family home and providing her child with the opportunity to attend school.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed and expand her herd.

loans.name: Johana Yamileth

texts.es:
la joven Johana R. tiene 24 años de edad, vive en el barrio San Jose de la ciudad de Choluteca, Johana se dedica a la venta de camarones, la zona sur de Honduras es productora de camaron, aqui se producen camarones de muy buena calidad ya sea en tamaño y sabor, la mayoria del producto lo vende en Tegucigalpa ya que trabaja con personas que le encargan en grandes cantidades todas las semanas y tambien distribuye su producto a dueños de  restaurantes.
Johana trabaja muy fuerte para sacar adelante a su hija y crecer como empresaria.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de camaron al por mayor.
texts.en: Johana R., age 24, lives in the neighborhood of San Jose in the city of Choluteca. The southern part of Honduras is known as a shrimp-producing region -- very high quality shrimp in terms of both size and taste is made here. Johana works in shrimp sales; she sells most of her product in Tegucigalpa, given that she works with clients who place large orders every week, and she also distributes shrimp to owners of restaurants. Johana works really hard to raise her daughter and to be able to grow as a businesswoman. She will use the loan in order to purchase shrimp wholesale.

loans.use: wholesale purchase of shrimp

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jose Mercedes

texts.en:
Jose is forty-three years old.  He lives in the district of Tambogrande in the province of Piura.  It is a semi-tropical zone primarily populated by small farmers and ranchers.  Many families have small fruit plantations or raise animals.  Jose owns his home.  He lives with his young wife and their one-year-old daughter.

In the mornings Jose works as a farm hand on local plots of land of larger land owners.  He earns about $7 daily in this activity.  In addition, Jose maintains corrals near his home in which he and his wife raise sheep, hogs and fowl.  They raise the animals until they reach the appropriate size and weight to be sold in local markets or to neighbors.

Jose plans to use the loan to make improvements to his corrals and purchase additional feed for his animals.  He hopes these investments will improve the general health of his herd and increase the production of his farm.  He dreams of increasing his family’s income so that he can provide for the education of his child and better his family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: To make improvements to his corrals and purchase additional feed for his animals.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is thirty-eight years old.  She is single and lives with her two brothers.  Their parents have passed away.  Rosalia and her brothers reside in the district of Tambogrande in the province of Piura in northern Peru.  It is a semi-tropical zone which is very productive in fruits and feed for animals.  Many residents have small fruit plantations or raise animals near their homes.

Rosalia operates a small general store out of her home.  She sells hygienic supplies, dry goods, food, candy and beverages.  She can be found in her store every day, greeting her clients with a smile and selling them the items they require.  On Saturdays and Sundays, Rosalia also sells hamburgers, hot dogs and sodas.  She is happy to be a part of the community, increasing their access to basic items and also providing food to people out for a stroll on the weekends.

This will be Rosalia’s first loan with Edpyme Alternativa.  She appreciates having access to credit at a lower interest rate as a result of the partnership with Kiva.  She plans to invest the funds in expanding her selection of merchandise and purchasing a few items in bulk.  She hopes this will allow her to attract additional clients and further improve the image of her store.  She dreams of having a bigger store and restaurant so that she can provide more income for her family.

loans.use: Expand her selection of merchandise and purchase a few items in bulk.

loans.name: Monica Elizabeth

texts.en:
Monica resides in the district of Tambogrande in the province of Piura in northern Peru.  It is a semi-tropical zone which is very productive in fruits and feed for animals.  Many residents have small fruit plantations or raise animals near their homes.  She is twenty-seven years old.  She shares her home with her mother-in-law, her husband and their three children.

Monica operates a small restaurant, selling hamburgers, hot dogs and sodas in her parent’s home, which is two blocks away from her own home.  She enjoys serving her neighbors and providing them with a location to hang out during their free time.  Her husband is a salesman; he sells fruit in local markets and in the neighborhood.

Monica plans to use the loan to purchase additional supplies for the restaurant and to improve the serving supplies.  She hopes to be able to attract additional clients and obtain bulk discounts in order to increase the profitability of the business.  She dreams of having her own restaurant one day and being able to provide her children with full access to education.

loans.use: To purchase additional supplies for the restaurant and to improve the serving supplies.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro tiene 70 años de edad, es viudo y reside en el Caserío Sime, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en el distrito de Pítipo, provincia de Ferreñafe. La localidad se encuentra ubicada a más de cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la ganadería y crianza y comercialización de animales. El cría vacas, ovejas y aves de corral en su domicilio. Las suele alimentar de granos y pastos naturales. Cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona y al público en general. El negocio le brinda los ingresos que necesita para subsistir y llevar una vida tranquila.

Alejandro desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales y alimento balanceado, de modo que pueda ampliar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los cuales espera lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 70 years old, he is a widow and he lives in the community of Sime, an agricultural region located in the district of Pitipo of the Ferrenafe province. The region is located more than forty five minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

His business is agriculture, cattle farming and the sale of livestock. He raises cows, sheep, and foul from his home. He strives to feed those grains and natural grasses. When the livestock have reached a certain stage in development he sells them to the merchants who visit the region and to the general public. The business provides him with the income necessary to live and to lead a quiet life. 

Alejandro wishes to expand his business with the purchase of more livestock and feed. He will increase his sales and see better earnings. To this end he has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan in the amount of 1000 soles. With this loan he hopes to reach his goal.

loans.use: To purchase animal feed.

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es:
la joven Angela E. tiene 27 años de edad, vive en el caserio La Lomita de la ciudad de Choluteca, Angelica se dedica a la cria y venta de cerdos, le vende sus cerdos a carniceros que destazan en San Lorenzo y Choluteca, ahorita tiene un pedido grande de cerdos ya que para la epoca de navidad muchas personas comen cerdo en la cena navideña.
Angela trabaja muy fuerte para sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos, Angela cuenta con buenos principios morales y religiosos.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar cerdos, su meta es seguir creciendo como microempresaria y de esta manera tener una mejor calidad de vida para ella y para sus hijos.
su sueño es darles una buena educacion a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Angela E. is 27 years old; she lives in the community of Limita in the city of Choluteca.  Angela raises and sells pigs. She sells her livestock to butchers in the cities of San Lorenzo and Choluteca. She has a large order for pigs for the Christmas season when many people eat pork meat for the Christmas supper. 

Angela works very hard to support her 2 children. Angela depends on sound personal principles, moral and religious. 

She will use the loan to purchase more pigs. Her goal is to keep growing as a small business owner and to provide a better quality of life for herself and her children. 

Her dream is to give her kids a good education.

loans.use: To purchase pigs and feed.

loans.name: Esperanza Violeta

texts.es:
Esperanza es una madre de familia de 52 años de edad que reside en el distrito de Chepén, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la región La Libertad, a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de ocho años a la venta de verduras y tubérculos en una calle aledaña a uno de los mercados más importantes de la localidad. El negocio cuenta con bastante acogida ya que ella siempre trata de brindar productos frescos y un buen trato a sus clientes. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le sirven para colaborar con la economía de su familia.

Esperanza desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más verduras, de modo que pueda responder de mejor manera a la demanda de sus clientes. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Esperanza is a mother, she is 52 years old and she lives in the district of Chepen, an agricultural region which is much commercialized for being located in the region of La Libertad.  It is located more than one hour form the city of Chiclayo, the capital region of Lambayeque. 

For more than eight years she has been selling vegetables and tubers on a street along one of the biggest markets in the region. Her business counts on a solid client base because she always tries to provide fresh products and good client service. The income that she earns from her business helps her contribute towards the family's finances.

Esperanza wishes to expand her business with the purchase of more vegetables. She wishes to respond to client demands. To this end she has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1000 soles.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and tubers for resale.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Leonor es una madre de familia de 35 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito de Chepén, una zona agrícola de regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada en la región La Libertad, a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir para todo público. Ella tiene un puesto de venta en uno de los mercados centrales del distrito y también las vende por pedidos durante la semana. Su negocio tiene bastante acogida ya que ella lleva trabajando bastante tiempo en esta actividad y es conocida en el rubro. Los ingresos que percibe de este negocio los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo, que es estibador, con los gastos económicos familiares.

Leonor es una mujer que tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante. Actualmente desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más prendas de vestir, de modo que pueda aumentar sus ingresos y ayudar aun más a su familia. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Leonor is a mother, she is 35 years old and she lives together with her husband and their children in the district of Chepen, an agricultural region which is highly commercialized given its location in La Libertad. It is located more than one hour from the city of Chiclayo. 

She sells items of clothing to the general public. She has a stand in one of the central markets in the district and she also sells during the week by taking orders. Her business counts on a solid client base because she has had a long time in the business and she is well known. The income that she earns is used to contribute with her husband, a fork lift operator, towards the family’s finances. 

Leonor is someone with a great will to come out ahead. She wishes to expand her business with the purchase of more items of clothing. She will be able to increase her profits and she will be able to help her family even more. In order to meat her goal she has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan in the amount of 1000 soles.

loans.use: To purchase items of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel es un padre de familia de 56 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el distrito de Pueblo Nuevo, un distrito agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Chepén, en la región La Libertad. Una localidad situada a una hora y veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la comercialización de refrescos y papas rellenas en un quiosco situado en un colegio de mujeres de la zona en donde vive. El ofrece su mercadería a diario y la temporada de mejor acogida es la temporada escolar. Actualmente ya tiene más de seis años de experiencia y con los ingresos que obtiene de estas actividades se encarga de sacar adelante la economía de su familia.

Daniel desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más insumos para seguir preparando refrescos y papas rellenas durante el verano. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Daniel is a father, he is 56 years old and he lives together with his wife and their children in the district of Pueblo Nuevo, an agricultural region in the province of Chepen, in the region of La Libertad. It is located one hour and twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo, capital region of Lambayeque. 

He sells fresh fruit drinks and stuffed potatoes from a food stall located in a ladies' college in the region where he lives. He sells his products every day, products that sell very well, especially during the school year. He has more than six years in the business and the income that he earns he is able to support his family. 

Daniel wishes to expand his business with the purchase of more ingredients and stuffed potatoes during the summer. He has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan in the amount of 1200 nuevos soles in order to reach his goal.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for his business.

loans.name: María Delia

texts.es:
María Delia tiene 30 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en la localidad de Tranca Fanupe, una zona rural que se encuentra situada en el distrito de Mórrope, provincia de Lambayeque, situada a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir para todo público. Ella cuenta con un taller instalado en su vivienda en donde confecciona prendas de vestir por pedido. Usualmente trabaja en conjunto con algunos comerciantes de la ciudad, los que la visitan para realizar sus pedidos y recoger la mercadería una vez que esta esté terminada. Esta actividad le sirve para ayudar a su esposo a sacar adelante la economía de su familia.

María desea adquirir más material para continuar trabajando y cumplir con algunos pedidos que tiene pendientes, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1700 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Maria Delia is 30 years old, she is married and she lives together with her husband and their children in the community of Tranca Fanupe, a rural region located in the district of Morrope in the province of Lambayeque. It is located more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

She sews clothing for sale to the general public. She has a shop set up in her home from where she takes order to make items of clothing. Usually she works together with some merchants in the city who visit her to place new orders and pick up the items when they are done. Her business helps her contribute with her husband towards the family's economy. 

Maria wants to acquire more material in order to keep working and to fill some orders that she has outstanding. She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan of 1700 nuevos soles in order to meet her objective.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics to make items of clothing.

location.town: Caserío Fanupe Casa Blanca - Morrope - Lambayeque

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca tiene 64 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su esposo y a uno de sus hijos en el sector San Pedro de Sasape del distrito de Illimo,una zona agrícola que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Lambayeque, la localidad está situada a más de cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la preparación y venta de chicha de jora (una bebida típica del país que se prepara desde épocas remotas en base a un tipo especial de harina de maíz), ella prepara esta bebida en su domicilio y la ofrece en venta en su domicilio. El negocio tiene buena acogida ya que estas bebidas son bastante consumidas en la zona, sobretodo en diversas celebraciones y festividades. Además los trabajadores de su localidad tienen por costumbre consumir chicha antes de iniciar sus actividades ya que creen que la bebida les ofrece energía y vigor. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales. Los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades le permiten ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Francisca desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más insumos para seguir preparando Chicha, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le permitan lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Francisca is 64 years old, she is married and she lives together with her husband and one of their children in the San Pedro de Sasape sector of the district of Illimo, an agricultural region located in the province of Lambayeque. It is located more than forty five minutes from the city of Chiclayo. 

Her business is to make and sells 'chicha de jora', a national drink that has been enjoyed from age of old, made from a special corn flour. She prepares the drink in her home but she also sells from her home. The business counts on a good client base especially because this type of drink is very sought out in the region, especially during festivities and celebrations. 

The workers in the neighborhood are accustomed to start their day with a drink of chicha because they believe the drink gives them more energy. Aside from this, she also raises and sells livestock. The profits that she earns from her businesses help her to contribute with her husband to the family's finances. 

Francisca wishes to expand her business by acquiring more ingredients needed to prepare chicha. She has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles which will help her reach her objective.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make chicha.

location.town: Sector San Pedro de Sasape - Illimo - Lambayeque

loans.name: Mirtha Janett

texts.es:
Mirtha es una madre de familia de 28 años de edad que reside junto a sus familiares en el sector San Martín, una zona marginal que se encuentra ubicada en la ciudad de Lambayeque, una zona de movimiento comercial considerable, localizada a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de hamburguesas en el exterior de su domicilio. Ella cuenta con un carrito sanguchero en donde realiza sus ventas de lunes a sábado durante la noche. Debido al buen trato que suele brindar a sus clientes actualmente cuenta con bastante demanda. El negocio le permite tener los ingresos que necesita para sacar adelante a sus hijos y colaborar con la economía de su familia.

Mirtha desea adquirir insumos para ampliar su negocio. Ella planea comprar carne de pollo, aceite, papas, etc. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Mirtha is a mother, she is 28 years old and she lives together with her family in the region of San Martin, a suburban region neighboring the city of Lambayeque. It is a commercial region located more than twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo. 

She sells hamburgers from her home. She has a sandwich cart from where she makes her sales from Mondays to Saturdays in the evenings. Given the excellent client service she provinces she always enjoys a great demand. This business gives her the income she needs to support her children and to contribute to the household finances. 

Mirtha wishes to purchase more ingredients for her business. She plans to purchase chicken meat, cooking oil, potatoes etc. She has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan of 500 nuevos soles.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her burger stand.

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
Wilmer es un padre de familia de 23 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a su menor hijo en el caserío Hornitos del distrito de Mórrope, una localidad agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en la crianza y venta de animales desde hace más de tres años. El cría ovejas en su domicilio alimentándolas de pastos naturales, cuando estas ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. La actividad es una de sus principales fuentes de ingreso, por lo que siempre trata de mantener su negocio del mejor modo posible.

El desea adquirir más animales y alimentos, asimismo desea realizar algunas mejoras en sus corrales, todo ello con la finalidad de mejorar su negocio y percibir mayores ganancias al momento de realizar sus ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Wilmer, 23, is a father living with his wife and minor son in Hornitos, Mórrope district, a farming area located in Lambayeque province over an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

He has been raising animals to sell for the last three years.  He raises sheep at home feeding them natural grasses.  When they reach a good level of development he sells them to merchants that tend to visit the area where he lives.  This activity is one of his main sources of income so he always strives to run the business the best way possible.

He wants to acquire more animals and animal feed.  He also wants to make some improvements to the corrals to improve his business and earn better profits when he makes his sales.

He has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new sol loan.

loans.use: To buy animals and animal feed.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 27 años de edad, es casado y no tiene hijos dependientes, reside en el distrito de Mochumí, una zona agrícola de regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en la crianza y venta de aves desde hace más de tres años. El las cría en su domicilio alimentándolas de granos y pastos naturales, cuando estas ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. La actividad es una de sus principales fuentes de ingreso, por lo que siempre trata de mantener su negocio del mejor modo posible. Adicionalmente trabaja como obrero en un proyecto especial de conservación e investigación de monumentos históricos de civilizaciones pre-incaicas (abundantes en la zona).

El desea adquirir más animales y alimentos, todo ello con la finalidad de mejorar su negocio y percibir mayores ganancias al momento de realizar sus ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Carlos, 27, is married and does not have any dependent children.  He lives in Mochumí district, a fairly active farming area located in Lambayeque province, half an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

He has raised barnyard fowl to sell for the last three years.  He raises them at home feeding them grains and natural grasses.  When they reach a good level of development he sells them to merchants that tend to come by the area where he lives.  This activity is one of his main sources of income so he always strives to manage it in the best possible way.  He also works as a laborer for a special project to study and conserve historical pre-Incan monuments (which are quite abundant in the area).

He wants to acquire more animals and animal feed in order to improve his business and earn higher profits from his sales.

He has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan.

loans.use: To buy animals and animal feed.

loans.name: Rosy Janet

texts.es:
Rosy es una madre de familia de 37 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito de Jayanca, una zona agrícola que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con establecimiento en su domicilio en donde suele ofrecer todo tipo de artículos de uso personal, como prendas de vestir, cosméticos y accesorios. El negocio ya tiene una antigüedad de cinco años y durante este tiempo se ha vuelto bastante conocida, actualmente cuenta con una clientela fiel. Los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo a solventar los gastos económicos de su familia.

Rosy desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más productos de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda que suele incrementarse durante la temporada navideña. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Rosy, 37, is a mother living with her husband and children in Jayanca district, a farming zone located in Lambayeque province, over an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

She has an establishment in her house where she tends to sell all kinds of items for personal use like: clothing, cosmetics and accessories.  The store has been in business for five years and has become quite well known in this time; she can now count on a regular clientele.  She uses income from sales to help her husband meet family expenses.

Rosy would like to expand the business acquiring more products so that she can meet demand that tends to increase during the Christmas season.  She has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: David Allen

texts.es:
David tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada a más de una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de planchado y pintado de vehículos para lo cual cuenta con un taller instalado en la zona donde reside. Su negocio es bastante conocido en la zona y actualmente cuenta con una clientela fiel que siempre hace uso de sus servicios. El negocio le permite solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar al desarrollo económico de su familia.

David desea adquirir materiales para poder seguir brindando un buen servicio. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
David is 22 years old.  He is single and lives with his family in Olmos district, an agricultural area with regular commercial activity which is located more than one hour and forty-five minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

David provides bodywork and painting services for vehicles.  He has a workshop in the area where he lives.  His business is quite well known in the area and he currently has a number of loyal customers who always use his services.  His business allows him to cover his personal expenses and support his family's financial development.

David would like to acquire materials so that he can continue providing a good service.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which will help him to achieve this goal.

loans.use: To buy materials to expand his vehicle repair business

loans.name: Tomás

texts.es:
Tomás es un padre D. familia D. 45 años D. edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el sector Las Norias del distrito D. Olmos, un distrito agrícola situado en la provincia D. Lambayeque, ubicado a dos horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en la siembra D. maracuyá, la cual es una fruta muy producida en la zona, L. agricultores se han venido asociando y actualmente existen diversos fundos (extensiones D. terrenos agrícolas colindantes pertenecientes a diversos agricultores) especializados en el cultivo D. esta fruta, esta asociación les permite conseguir desarrollar su cultivo D. una manera óptima para poder obtener productos D. buena calidad, así como también conseguir vender sus cosechas en el mercado a un buen precio.

Tomás desea aplicarle a su cultivo fertilizantes y riegos para que la producción sea D. calidad, siguiendo este objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el mantenimiento D. su cultivo.
texts.en:
Tomás is a 45-year-old father who lives alongsiD. his wife and children in the Las Norias sector of the Olmos district, a farming district situated in the Lambayeque province located two hours from the city of Chiclayo.

He is dedicated to planting passion fruit which is a much produced fruit in the area. The farmers have been teaming up and there are currently different farms (adjoining agricultural land tracts belonging to different farmers) specializing in farming this fruit. This association allows them to develop their crop in an optimal manner to be able to obtain good quality products, as well as sell their harvests in the market at a good price.

Tomás wishes to apply fertilizers and irrigation to his crop so that the production will be of good quality. With this objective in mind, he has seen the need to request a loan of 1500 new "soles" from Edpyme Alternativa which he is thinking of using for the maintenance of his crop.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers to maintain his passion fruit crop.

loans.name: María Martina

texts.es:
María Martina es una madre de familia de 37 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmoa, una zona agrícola de regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con establecimiento en su domicilio en donde suele ofrecer prendas de vestir para todo público. Usualmente ofrece su mercadería al crédito y al contado. El negocio ya tiene una antigüedad de cuatro años y durante este tiempo se ha vuelto bastante conocida, actualmente cuenta con una clientela fiel. Los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades los utiliza para ayudar a su familia a salir adelante.

María desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más mercadería de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda que suele incrementarse durante la temporada navideña. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
María Martina, 37, is a mother living with her family in Olmoa district, a farming zone with fairly active commercial movement, located in Lambayeque province over an hour and forty-five minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She has an establishment at home where she sells clothes to the public.  She usually sells both for cash and on credit.  The store has been in operation for four years and has become quite well known during this time; she can currently count on her regular customers.  She uses income from sales to help her family get ahead.

María would like to expand the business acquiring more merchandise to meet customer demand that tends to increase during the Christmas season.  She has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Doña Santos de 47 años de Edad, vive con su esposo Horacio Lucio Romero, quien le ayuda tambien en las actividades diarias en la Comarca Santa Rita, Finca las Lajitas, Colonia La Union Nueva Guinea, donde tiene su unidad de Trabajo como es una finca de 40 manzanas, las cuales las explota sacando produccion de reices y tuberculos y tambien se dedica a la comercializacion de Ganado de donde obtiene sus ingresos y asi poder mantener su familia gozando de una buena salud y su finca en muy buen estado apta para el desarrollo ganadero.  

Está solicitando su segundo crédito, para realizar estableciento de siembra de pasto mejorado.  Su mayor sueño es aumentar su inventario Ganadero y brindarles mejoras condiciones de vida a su Familia.
texts.en:
Santos, 47, lives with her husband, Horacio Lucio Romero, who helps her with her daily chores in Santa Rita, Las Lajitas farm, in La Unión, Nueva Guinea.

She has a 40 manzana (unit of land measurement) farm there where she farms root and tubers.  She also raises cattle to earn income to support her family and keep them in good health.  Her farm is in good condition and apt for cattle raising.

She is asking for her second loan to plant improved pasturage.  Her greatest dream is to increase her herd size and provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: For pasturage planting.

loans.name: Santos Coronado

texts.es:
Santos  de 31 años de edad, vive con su esposa doña Felipa del Carmen Sevilla en Colonia Villa Alvarez, del Municipio de El Almendro, desde su niñes se dedica a la ganaderia, sus padres le dieron como herencia su finca y ganado, por lo que el Sr. A. esta todo el tiempo cuidando su ganado de modo que éste se mantenga en buen estado sanitarios y nutricionales, recibe ingreso de la venta de quezo, leche y la comercializacion del Ganado, en la comunidad tiene buenas referencia, siendo un hombre trabajador, responsable y con muchos deseos de superarse en el ambito Ganadero.

y agradece el apyo de Kiva ya que gracias a este Finaciamiento podra obtener mejores resultados en su inversion,  

Su mayor sueño es que su Familia goce de buenas condiciones de vida y mantenerse unidos para poder realizar actividades cotidianas en Conjunto.
texts.en:
Santos is 31 years old and lives with his wife, Felipa del Carmen Sevilla, in Colonia Villa Alvarez in the town of El Almendro.  

Since he was a child, he has worked in cattle farming.  His parents gave him the family farm and livestock. He spends his time caring for his cattle so that they stay in good health and have good nutrition.  He earns income from the sale of cheese, milk, and livestock. 

He is well respected in the community and is a hard-working, responsible man who wants to succeed with his livestock business.  He is thankful for Kiva's support since this loan will allow him to have better results in his business.

His dream is that his family enjoys good living conditions and that they stay united to do everyday activities together.

loans.use: Purchase calves to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase calves to raise

loans.name: Noe Antonio

texts.es:
El Sr Noe de 42 habita en la  colonia san Pablo, soltero actualmente estudiante de la carrera tecnico superior en ciencias agrarias, ademas labora en la unidad de produccion de sus padres, los que le han dado el derecho de poder desarrollarse realizando actividades agricolas y pecuarias y tambien de mejorar las condiciones tecnicas de la misma, su principal fuente de ingreso es la producción de leche que le genera su inventario ganadero y la produccion de maiz y frijoles en tiempo de cosech.

Requiere de este financiamiento para realizar establecimiento de pasto en la  finca de sus padres y asi poder tener condiciones para menejar la alimentación de su hato ganadero.

espera ser beneficiaddo con el FONDO KIVA, para hacer realidad su sueño y poder vivir  en mejores condiciones, ya que como todo ser humano tiene mejores aspiraciones.
texts.en:
Sr. Noe is single, 42 years old and lives in the district of San Pablo. He is studying agrarian sciences at a great technical school. Also, he works in his parent's production unit. They have given him the privilege to be able to develop his skills through his work with agriculture and livestock. His main source of income is milk production from his cows and corn and beans during the harvest. 

He needs this loan to make a space on his parents' farm for his cows to graze and therefore to be able to have conditions that improve the diet of his herd of cows. 

He hopes to be a beneficiary of FONDO KIVA (Kiva Fund) in order to make his dream a reality and to be able to live in better conditions, as every human being has aspirations of improving their life.

loans.use: To set up an area on his farm for his cattle to graze.

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es:
Maria Margarita de 42 años de edad es casada, tiene 2 hijos, uno de 12 y el otro de 8 años, ambos estudiando la secundaria y primaria, labora para el MINSA desempeñandose como Enfermera Especial responsable de la zona # 3 de Juigalpa, con 19 años de servicio, con sus creditos ha logrado dar mejores condiciones a su casa y gracias al aopoyo de KIVA con el credito anterior logro construir el cuarto de su hijo mayor. 

Esta solicitando su 8vo credito con el objetivo de construir ahora el baño en su casa, acondicionandolo con el lavamanos, el inodoro, y ponerle azulejos y de esta manera continuar mejorando las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Margarita is 42.  She is married and has two children, 8 and 12, who are in primary and secondary school, respectively.  She has worked as a Special Nurse in Juigalpa for 19 years.  Previous loans have allowed her to improve her house, and she is grateful to Kiva for the loan she used to built her older son's bedroom.

She is asking for her eighth loan so that she can build a bathroom, with a sink, toilet, and tiling, so that she can continue to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: Construction of a bathroom

loans.name: Virginia Francisca

texts.es:
La Señora. Virginia C. es socia del banco comunal Yanaturo, vive en la comunidad que lleva el mismo nombre en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por su belleza natural, su cultura, su gastronomía que deleita los paladares de propios y extraños, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora. Virginia tiene 36 años de edad, vive en unión libre y tiene 6 hijos de 20, 15, 12, 5, 2 y 1 año de edad, su primer hijo estudia, trabaja y ayuda en la economía del hogar, su segundo hijo estudia en el colegio, su tercera hija esta en la escuela, su cuarta hija estudia en el jardín de infantes. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y trabaja conduciendo un trailer, con el sacrificio y trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña Virginia se dedica a la venta de joyas y ropa, actividad que la realiza hace 14 años y su producto lo vende recorriendo su comunidad a sus amigas y conocidas. También se dedica a la cría de pollos, esta actividad la realiza hace 5 años.

Es el segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y sus vecinas le han incentivado a formar parte de la banco, su crédito lo va  a invertir en la compra de ropa para surtir mas su mercadería. Su meta es tener un almacén para vender sus productos en su propia casa.
texts.en:
Virginia is a member of the “Yanaturo” Communal Bank, and she lives in the community of the same name in the city of Cuenca.  This city is known for its natural beauty, culture, and a gastronomy that delights the taste of locals and outsiders.  Its people maintain their culture and traditions.

Virginia is 36 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 6 children, aged 20, 15, 12, 5, 2 and 1.  Her 1st child studies, works and helps in the household economy; her 2nd son is a student; her 3rd child, a daughter, is also in school; her 4th, a daughter, is in kindergarten.  Her husband is a trucker who hauls a trailer.  With much sacrifice and work by both, they have been able to construct their own house.

Virginia has sold jewelry and clothing in her community for 14 years, selling to friends and acquaintances.  She also raises chickens, which she has done for 5 years.

This is her 2nd loan with her communal bank.  Virginia's neighbors motivated her to join the bank.  The loan will be invested in buying clothes to expand her merchandise.  Virginia's goal is to have a store to sell her goods from her own home.

loans.use: TO BUY CLOTHES TO SELL

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.es:
Don Leoncio habitante de Comarca Triunfo #2, labora en su unidad de producción realizando actividades agricolas, sobre todo en los cultivos de raices y tuberculos, como también el manejo de su inventario ganadero, los que le sirven como su pricipal y mayor fuente de ingreso para la estabilidad laboral y economica del nucleo familiar, su familia esta conformada por su esposa y 3 hijos los que cooperan en los quehaceres de la unidad de producción.

Necesita este financiamiento para realizar compra de 2 vacas paridas y poder ahumentar su inventario ganadero y la producción de leche, lo cual le permitira mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia, espera ser beneficiaddo con el FONDO KIVA, para realizar la obra que tiene proyectada.  

Su mayor sueño es progresar y brindar lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Leoncio lives in Triunfo #2 region.  He works on his production unit doing farm work.  His main crops are root vegetables and tubers.  He also manages his livestock inventory which serves as his main, and best, source of income for the working and financial stability of his immediate family.  His family is made up of his wife and three children who help work on the farm.

Leoncio needs this loan to buy two calved cows to increase his livestock inventory and his milk production which will enable him to improve his family's quality of life.  He hopes to receive a Kiva loan so that he can achieve this.

Leoncio's biggest dream is to make progress and provide his family with the best.

loans.use: To buy calved cows

loans.name: Esperanza Del Pilar

texts.es:
La Señora Esperanza Pilar es socia del banco comunal Yanaturo, vive en la comunidad que lleva el mismo nombre en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por su belleza natural, su cultura, su gastronomía que deleita los paladares de propios y extraños, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

Doña Esperanza tiene 33 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 14, 13, 9 y 7 años de edad, sus dos primeras hijas estudian en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión mecánico y labora en su propio taller, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de su hermana.

La Señora. Esperanza hace 3 años se dedica a trabajar en un pequeño taller que tiene en su casa, realiza ropa deportiva y también hace arreglos de todo tipo de prendas de vestir, no tiene un horario fijo de trabajo y labora de lunes a sábados, en sus tiempos libres se dedica  a vender cosméticos de la marca Yanbal y lleva 3 años en el mismo.

Se encuentra en su cuarto crédito y esta muy agradecida con su amiga quien le invito a formar parte del banco comunal,  su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de materia prima como es tela, hilos etc. Su meta es  tener su casa propia y también un vehículo.
texts.en:
Esperanza Pilar, 33, is a member of the Yanaturo communal bank.  She lives in Yanaturo, a community in the city of Cuenca.  Cuenca is well known for its natural beauty, its culture, its gastronomy that delights the taste buds of locals and foreigners alike.  Its people maintain its culture and traditions.

Esperanza is married and has four children who are 14, 13, 9 and 7 years of age.  Her two oldest daughters are in high school and the two youngest boys go to the local elementary school.  Her husband is a mechanic working in his own shop.  They do not own a house so they live in her sister’s house.

For the last three years Esperanza has been working in a small workshop she has at home making sportswear.  She also does all kinds of clothing repairs.  She does not have a set work schedule but works from Monday through Saturday.  During her free time she sells Yanbal brand cosmetics, something she’s been doing for the past three years.

She is in her fourth loan and is very grateful to her friend who invited her to become part of the communal bank.  She will use the loan to buy raw materials like fabric, thread, etc.  Her goal is to have a house of her own as well as a vehicle.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Juan Maria

texts.es:
Juana Maria de 33 años de edad, su esposo labora para el IPADE, el la ayuda con los gastos del hogar y con los compromisos adquiridos, ella trabaja para el ministerio de Educaciòn desde hace 24 años como docente de primaria, donde se desempeña con mucho esmero y dedicacion, es una persona humilde y esforzada a venido obteniendo sos propios bienes con mucho sacrificio realizando creditos a nuestra Institucion y de esta manera sacar a delante a su Familia.  

Solicita su  decimo credito para construir una habitaciòn para su hijo mayor, el cual espera ser beneficiada con Kiva para poder realizar este pequeño protecto. 

Su mayor sueño en la vida es llegar a tener su casa muy bonita y que sus hijos gocen de buena salud
texts.en:
Juana Maria is 33 years old.  Her husband works for IPADE and helps her with their household expenses and financial commitments.  Juana Maria has worked as an elementary school teacher for the Ministry of Education for 24 years and she does her work with a lot of care and commitment.  She is a humble and hard-working person who has accumulated her own assets through a lot of sacrifices, taking loans from our institution and getting her family ahead.

Juana Maria is requesting her tenth loan in order to build a room for her eldest son who hopes to receive a Kiva loan so that they can carry out this little project.

Juana Maria's greatest dream in life is to have her house looking really nice and for her children to enjoy good health.

loans.use: To build a room

loans.name: María Angeles

texts.es:
La Señora María I. es socia del banco comunal Yanaturo, vive en la comunidad que lleva el mismo nombre en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por su belleza natural, su cultura, su gastronomía que deleita los paladares de propios y extraños, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

Nuestra socia se dedica a la venta de animales como  gallinas, cerdos y ganado, sus animales los vende en su casa o en las ferias de la ciudad, también se dedica a la agricultura pero labora en tierras ajenas.
 
Doña María tiene 50 años de edad, es casada y tiene 12 hijos, 4 de ellos son varones y 8 mujeres, cuatro hijos son casados y viven independientes, seis hijos estudian en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y también vende helados, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Es el quinto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue  invitada por su hija a formar parte de este grupo, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra pollos y ganado. Su sueño es  tener su casa propia para vivir con toda su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. María I. is a member of the Yanaturo communal bank.  She lives in Yanaturo, a community in the city of Cuenca.  Cuenca is known for its natural beauty, its culture and its gastronomy that delights the palates of locals and foreigners alike.  Its people keep its culture and traditions.

María raises animals like chickens, pigs and cattle to sell.  She either sells them at home or in the local markets.  She’s also a farmer but on other people’s lands.

María is 50 years old, married and has 12 children: 4 boys and 8 girls.  Four of the children are married and live independently and six are in school, the two youngest in a school in the city.  Her husband is a farmer and also sells ice-cream.  She does not own a house; she rents.

This is the fifth loan she’s negotiated with the communal bank.  Her daughter invited her to become part of this group.  She will use the money from her loan to buy chickens and cattle.  Her dream is to have her own house in order to live with her whole family.

loans.use: To buy chickens and cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a room

loans.name: Jose Arosman

texts.es:
osé Arosmán de 44 años de edad, habitante de Barrio Linda Vista en Nueva Guinea,  trabaja para el MAGFOR desde hace dos años, su esposa trabaja como administradora de ENACAL,  los dos luchan por el bienestar de su humilde Familia ya que con dedicacion y esfuerzo han podido salir adelante, son personas muy queridas por sus vecinos y amigos. 

Solicita el apoyo de kiva en su tercer crédito para invertirlo en construccion de una habitación y de esta manera tener mejores condiciones en su vivienda,  

Su mayor sueño en la vida tener estabilidad laboral, que su hijo goce de mejores condiciones y que su familia permanezca bien con Dios
texts.en:
José Arosmán is 44 years old and lives in Linda Vista neighborhood in New Guinea. He has worked for MAGFOR for two years. His wife works as an administrator for ENACAL. The two of them fight for the well-being of their humble family since with dedication and effort they have been able to get ahead. They are well loved by their neighbors and friends.

He is requesting the support of Kiva in his third loan, which will be invested in the construction of a room and, in this manner, have better conditions in his home.

His greatest dream in life is to have job stability, that his son enjoys better conditions and that his family remains right with God.

loans.use: House construction.

loans.name: María Soledad

texts.es:
La Señora. María G. es socia del banco comunal Yanaturo, vive en la comunidad que lleva el mismo nombre en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por su belleza natural, su cultura, su gastronomía que deleita los paladares de propios y extraños, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora. María tiene 39 años de edad, es  casada y tiene 8 hijos de 22, 20, 18, 16, 14, 12, 9 y 7 años de edad, su primera hija es soltera y se dedica a trabajar, su segunda hija es casada y vive independiente, su tercera hija trabaja y ayuda económicamente, sus tres hijos siguientes están estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad y sus dos ultimas hijas estudian en la escuela. Su esposo labora como estibador, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña María se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, esta actividad la realiza desde que tenía 10 años de edad y hace 6 años cuenta con su puesto propio en un mercado de la ciudad.
 
Es el quinto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por su hermana, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más frutas y verduras y también va a comprar pollos para iniciarse en esta actividad. Su sueño es tener su casa propia y  darles a sus hijos una buena educación para que en el futuro sean unos buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Guama is a member of the Yanaturo communal bank.  She lives in Yanaturo, a community in the city of Cuenca.  Cuenca is known for its natural beauty, its culture and its gastronomy that delights the palates of locals and foreigners alike.  Its people keep its culture and traditions.

María is 39 years old, married and has 8 children who are 22, 20, 18, 16, 14, 12, 9 and 7 years old.  Her oldest daughter is single and employed.  The next daughter is married and lives independently.  Her third daughter is employed and helps out economically.  The next three children go to high school in the city and the two youngest go to the local elementary school.  Her husband works as a stevedore.  She does not have a house of her own; she rents.

María is a fruit and vegetable merchant.  She’s been doing this since she was 10 years old and has had her own stand in one of the city’s markets for the last 6 years.

This is the fifth loan she’s negotiated with the communal bank.  Her sister invited her to become part of this group.  She will use the money from her loan to buy more fruit and vegetables.  She will also buy chickens to start out in this activity.  Her dream is to have her own house and to provide her children with good educations so that they will become good professionals in the future.

loans.use: To buy fruit, vegetables and chickens.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina Marín habitante colonia Verdún en la Ciudad de Nueva Guinea, de 53 años de edad y con 26 años de laborar para el Ministerio de Educación como docente del colegio Alfonso Cortéz,  esta clienta ha demostrado excelente record crediticio en todos los créditos que AFODENIC le ha otorgado, y es una mujer luchadora y esmerada en su trabajo a la vez ha sacado  adelante a su familia aunque con algunas trancas que le pone la vida pero ahi va luchando para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.  

Solicita su onceavo crédito para invertirlo en mejora de sus vivienda y tener mejores condiciones en la misma. Su mayor sueño en la vida es que sus hijas sigan estudiando para que sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Cristina Marín is a resident of the Verdún suburb in the city of New Guinea, is 53 years old, and has 26 years experience working for the Ministry of Education as a teacher for the Alfonso Cortez college. This client has demonstrated an excellent loan record with all her loans that AFODENIC has granted her and she is a hard-working woman, careful in her work while getting her family ahead even though life has put obstacles in her path but is now fighting to improve her living conditions.

She is requesting her eleventh loan to invest it in improving her home and have better conditions for herself. Her greatest dream in life is that her daughters continue studying so that they can be good people.

loans.use: Home repairs.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Auxiliadora de 27 años de edad habitante de colonia Los Angeles, tiene 8 años de laborar para el MINED como docente de educacion Primaria en el Colegio: Salomón Ibarra Mayorga de esa comunidad, ella aun no tiene hijos vive con sus padres,  pero es una persona bien obligada y comparte gastos con sus padres. Está solicitando su tercer préstamo para invertirlo  en compra de eléctrodoméstico para tener mejor presentacion en su cocina  y contar con lo necesario para la preparacion de sus alimentos.   

Es importante destacar que María Auxiliadora tuvo dos créditos anteriores el cual pago en tiempo y forma cada cuota establecida, hay buenas referncias comerciales y personales en su comunidad como una persona honesta trabajadores y de buenas costumbres.  

Su mayor sueños en la vida es culminar sus estudios y llegar a ser una excelente profesional.
texts.en:
Auxiliadora is 27 years old and a resident of the Los Angeles suburb. She has worked for MINED for eight years as a primary school teacher in the Salomón Ibarra Mayorga College in that community. She does not have children yet and she lives with her parents but she is a trustworthy person and she shares her earnings with her parents. She is requesting her third loan in order to invest it in the purchase of appliances to have better presentation in her kitchen and to have what is necessary for the preparation of her dishes.

It is important to point out that María Auxiliadora had two previous loans which she paid on time and in the established amount. She has good commercial and personal references in her community as a person who is honest and has good manners.

Her greatest dreams in life are to finish her studies and become an excellent professional.

loans.use: Improve the kitchen.

loans.name: Wilmer Donaldo

texts.es:
Wilber de 31 años de edad, habitante de Col. Rio Plata labora como asesor pedagogico del Ministerio de Educaciòn desde hace 11 años desempeñandoce como una persona trabajadora y muy responsabl.

solicita su septimo crédito para invertirlo en mejora de sus vivienda la que vendrá a darle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. En su colonia dan buenas referencias personales de él, también en el trabajo como una persona responsable en sus compromisos y de muy buenas costumbre.  

Su mayor sueño en la vida es que su familia permanezca unida y que no les haga falta  lo basico en el hogar, solicitamos al comité de crédito la aprobación de su préstamo
texts.en:
Wilber is 31 years old, a resident of Col. Rio Plata, and has worked as a pedagogical advisor for the Education Ministry for eleven years acting as a hard-working and responsible person.

He is requesting his seventh loan in order to invest it in the improvement of his house which he will sell in order to give better living conditions to his family. In his area, they give him good personal references. Also, at work, he's considered a person who is trustworthy and has good manners.

His greatest dream in life is that his family remains united and that they don't lack for the basics in the home. We are requesting that the loan committee approves his loan.

loans.use: Home repair.

loans.name: Thalia Rosana

texts.es:
En la ciudadela nueva california de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Jerusalén.
 
Aquí encontramos a la señora Talía, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación ha procreado tres hijos, dos de ellos ya son mayores de edad, el menor tiene 14 años y estudia en colegio, su marido es comerciante. Lleva seis años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado a través de los créditos.

Se dedica al comercio vende ropa  y accesorio de damas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja todos los días desde las 8 am hasta las 14h00, recorre la ciudad para vender su mercadería,   también vende en su casa a cualquier hora, deja a crédito y cobra por semana o por quincena de acuerdo a lo que quieran sus clientes. Cada quince o al fin de mes se va  Guayaquil a comprar su mercadería. Y también en su casa le entregan ropa colombiana.

Este crédito es para ir a Guayaquil a comprar sus productos en especial pantalones, blusas, y ropa de niños.  Sus sueños tener un local propio y seguir ayudando a sus padres y hermanos.
texts.en:
In the new California citadel in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabi, known for many years as the city of tamarind royalty, the members of the Nueva Jerusalén Community Bank meet every 15 days.

Here we find Talía who is 47 years old, is married and, from this relationship, three children have been born. Two of them are adults. The youngest is 14 years old and studies at high school. Her husband is a vendor. She has been with the community bank for six years and she likes it for the help that they have given through the loans.

She is dedicated to selling clothing and accessories for women. Her mode of selling is door-to-door. She works every day from 8AM until 2PM walking the city to sell her merchandise. She also sells from her house at any time allowing credit and taking a week or a fortnight in accordance with what her customers wish. Every fortnight or at the end of the month she goes to Guayaquil to buy merchandise. And also in her home, she sells them Colombian clothing.

This loan is so that she can go to Guayaquil to buy products, especially pants, tops and children's clothing. Her dreams are to have her own shop and continue helping her parents and siblings.

loans.use: Purchase pants, blouses and children's clothes.

loans.name: Victor Alfredo

texts.es:
En la ciudadela nueva california de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Jerusalén. 

Aquí encontramos a Víctor, tiene 37 años de edad, está soltero y vive en la casa de una hermana la cual alquilan a medias. Este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que les dan los créditos para su negocio y porque los intereses son bajos en relación a otras instituciones financieras.

Se dedica a la venta de periódicos y revistas, tiene un puesto en el mercado # 1 de la ciudad de Portoviejo, trabaja todos los días desde 04h30 hasta las 13h30. Nos cuenta que lleva varios años que se dedica a esta actividad y que ha ido creciendo poco a poco, ahora espera invertir este crédito y aumentar su negocio con la venta de boletos de rifas y lotería lo que le dará mejores ganancias.

Este crédito lo va a invertir en comprar boletos de lotería para la venta, además de revistas, Su sueño es tener un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
Víctor, 37, can be found in Manabí’s capital Portoviejo’s Nueva California neighborhood.  Portoviejo has been known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.  The members of the Nueva Jerusalén (The New Jerusalem) communal bank meet here every two weeks.

He is single and shares a house with his sister; they split the rental cost fifty-fifty.  This is his third cycle in the communal bank.  He likes it because of the benefits the loans provide for his business and because the interest rates are low compared to other financial institution.

He sells newspapers and magazines in a stand in Puertoviejo’s #1 Market.  He works every day from 4:30am until 1:30pm.  He tells us that he’s been in this business for several years and it has been growing gradually.  He hopes to use this new loan to increase business selling lottery and raffle tickets which will produce better profits.

He will use this loan to buy lottery tickets to sell as well as magazines.  His dream is to have a bigger business.

loans.use: To buy magazines and lottery tickets.

loans.name: Carmen Asunción

texts.es:
En la ciudadela nueva california de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Jerusalén.
 
La señora Carmen esta en el Banco Comunal desde sus inicios  y está muy contenta porque gracias a los créditos que ha recibido de la  Fundación Espoir ha podido mejorar la producción. Tiene 50 años, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene 4 hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes. El marido es agricultor.

Ella y su esposo se dedican a las faenas del campo, desde muy de mañana ellos con la ayuda de de dos personas más a quienes les pagan un sueldo se van al campo a cultivar la tierra y a recoger los frutos que la tierra y el duro trabajo les da, ellos cultivan plátano, mangos y verduras las mismas que una vez que la recogen las llevan al mercado de Portoviejo. Nos cuenta que a veces llevan hasta dos cargas por semana de plátano y que este se vende a muy buen precio.

Este crédito es para comprar insumos agrícolas y abono para obtener mayor producción. Sus sueños son seguir trabajando y gozar de salud ella y los suyos.
texts.en:
Carmen, 50, can be found in Manabí’s capital Portoviejo’s Nueva California neighborhood.  Portoviejo has been known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.  The members of the Nueva Jerusalén (The New Jerusalem) communal bank meet here every two weeks.

She has been a member of the communal bank since its beginning and she’s very happy because thanks to loans from Fundación Espoir she has been able to improve production.  She’s married and has four children who are now adult and independent.  Her husband is a farmer.

She and her husband farm.  With the help of two salaried employees they head to the fields very early in the morning to till the soil and harvest the fruit that the earth and their hard work produces.  They farm bananas, mangoes and vegetables which, once gathered, are taken to market in Portoviejo.  She tells us that sometimes they take up to two loads of bananas per week and that it sells for a very good price.

This loan is to buy farming supplies and manure to obtain better production.  Her dreams are to continue working and that both she and her loved ones enjoy good health

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and manure.

loans.name: Dolores Jacqueline

texts.es:
En la ciudadela nueva california de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Jerusalén.
 
En este lugar encontramos y conocimos a la señora Dolores, tiene 46años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene tres hijos dos de ellos ya son mayores y el ultimo tiene 15 años y estudia en colegio. Todos sus hijos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es taxista.

Ella tiene un carro que la utiliza como transporte escolar, muy de mañana se levanta y sale a hacer su recorrido diario parra levar a sus estudiantes a los diferentes centros de estudio, realiza esto dos veces en las mañanas y dos en las tardes. Trabaja de lunes a viernes. Nos cuenta que su transporte es muy solicitado por la seriedad y el cumplimiento de ella ya que siempre lleva a sus alumnos a tiempo.

Este crédito lo solicito para comprar algunos repuestos y llantas ya que tiene que tener su carro en buen estado para brindar el mejor servicio.  Lleva 4 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. Sus sueños son tener una furgoneta más grande y brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Dolores, 46, can be found in Manabí’s capital Portoviejo’s Nueva California neighborhood.  Portoviejo has been known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.  The members of the Nueva Jerusalén (The New Jerusalem) communal bank meet here every two weeks.

She is married and has three children.  Two of them are already adults and the youngest is 15 and going to secondary school.  All of her children still live with her.  Her husband is a taxi driver.

She has a vehicle she uses to provide school transportation services.  She gets up very early every morning to travel her route taking students to various educational institutions.  She makes two trips in the morning and two in the afternoon.  She works Monday through Friday.  She tells us that her transportation service is highly sought after due to the seriousness and commitment with which she always delivers her students on time.

She asked for this loan to buy some replacement parts and tires because she must have her vehicle in good condition to provide the best service.  She has been in the communal bank for 4 years and likes it because the loans are quick.

Her dream is to have a larger van to provide better service.

loans.use: To buy vehicle replacement parts and tires.

loans.name: Adriana Patricia Del Rocio

texts.es:
En la ciudadela nueva california de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Jerusalén. 

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Adriana. Tiene 54 años, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene 3 hijos todos mayores de edad, dos aun están solteros y viven con ella. El marido es jubilado. Está en el Banco Comunal hace ya un año  y está muy contenta porque en las reuniones ha hecho muy buenas amigas.

Se dedica al comercio, vende productos de la marca Avon y Yanbal  (productos de cosméticos, belleza, perfumería y accesorios de damas) trabaja  todos los días de  la semana desde las 9am hasta las 14h00, ella enseña la revista anota los pedidos y luego realiza los pedidos a la empresa, recibe los productos en su casa y entrega los productos a sus clientas a quienes les da facilidades de pago, les cobra por semana o cada quince días. Nos cuenta que lo que más vende son los cosméticos.

Este crédito es para comprar cremas, perfumes, cosméticos y otros productos. Su meta es  poner su propio bazar.
texts.en:
Adriana, 54, is a member of the Nueva Jerusalén (The New Jerusalem) communal bank which meets every two weeks in Portoviejo’s Nueva California neighborhood.  Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, has been known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.

Adriana is married and has three adult children.  Two of them are still single and live with her.  Her husband is retired.  She’s been in the communal bank for a year and is very happy because she’s made good friends at the meetings.

She is a merchant.  She sells Avon and Yanbal brand products (cosmetics, beauty supplies, perfumes and women’s accessories).  She works every day of the week from 9am until 2pm.  She shows the catalogue and takes down orders which she then places with the firm.  She receives the products at home and delivers them to her customers to whom she provides easy payment plans.  She collects either weekly or bi-weekly.  She tells us that cosmetics are her best sellers.

This loan is to buy creams, perfumes, cosmetics and other products.  Her goal is to set up her own store.

loans.use: To buy creams, perfumes, cosmetics and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Ramona Monserrate

texts.es:
En la ciudadela nueva california de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Jerusalén. 

La señora Ramona es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y está muy feliz ya que de la decisión que tomaron hace muchos años han podido recibir ayuda no solo ella si no también sus compañeras del Banco. Tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación procreo 4 hijos dos  mayores de edad y dos de 14 y 9 años  que viven aun con ella y estudian en colegio y escuela. Su marido trabaja en el cuerpo de bomberos. Hace varios años aprendió corte y confección en la Academia Manuela Cañizares de la ciudad de Portoviejo.

Tiene un pequeño taller de costura donde desde hace muchos años se dedica a coser y confecciona todo tipo de ropa, trabaja a base de pedidos, lo que mas le gusta hacer es ropa de mujer. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 22h00. Ella compra sus materiales de costura en Portoviejo, nos cuenta que ya son 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas y otros materiales para la costura. Sus sueños son tener un taller más grande y un almacén en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Ramona, 45, is a member of the Nueva Jerusalén (The New Jerusalem) communal bank which meets every two weeks in Portoviejo’s Nueva California neighborhood.  Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, has been known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.

Ramona is a founding member of the communal bank and is very happy because thanks to the decision they made so many years ago not only she but all her fellow bank members have been able to receive help.

She is married and has four children.  Two of them are adults and two, who are 14 and 9 years old, still live with her and go to secondary and elementary school.  Her husband is a fireman.  She learned clothes making and design several years ago at Portoviejo’s Manuela Cañizares Academy.

She has a small sewing workshop where she’s been making all kinds of clothes for many years.  She makes items to order.  What she enjoys making the most is women’s clothes.  She works every day from 6am until 10pm.  She buys her sewing supplies in Portoviejo and she tells us that she’s been in this occupation for 15 years now.

She will use this new loan to buy fabric and other sewing supplies.  Her dreams are to have a larger workshop and a store downtown.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Mónica Marbella

texts.es:
En la ciudadela nueva california de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Jerusalén.
 
La señora Mónica tiene 47 años de edad,  está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 27, 21 y 20 años, todos aun viven con ella y  dos de ellos estudia en la Universidad. Su marido es comerciante. Está en el Banco Comunal  hace cuatro años y le agrada por las facilidades de pago y porque le brindan un buen servicio.

Se dedica al comercio, vede  ropa de todo tipo y bisutería. Tiene un pequeño local en su casa, allí llegan muchos de sus clientes que le realizan  sus pedidos y también sus compras. Ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra semanalmente lo cual es una ventaja ya que a la vez que realiza sus cobros también utiliza este momento para realizar nuevas ventas. Compra sus productos en Portoviejo  y Guayaquil, trabaja sola todos los días y realiza los cobros los días sábados.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa como: pantalones, blusas, camisas, ropa de niños, etc. Su sueño es tener un local comercial.
texts.en:
Mónica, 47, is a member of the Nueva Jerusalén (The New Jerusalem) communal bank which meets every two weeks in Portoviejo’s Nueva California neighborhood.  Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, has been known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.

Mónica is married and has three children who are 27, 21 and 20 years old.  All of them still live with her; two are university students.  Her husband is a merchant.  She’s been in the communal bank for four years and she is pleased with the easy payment plans and because it provides a good service.

She is a merchant; she sells all kind of clothes and costume jewelry.  She has a small store in her house where lots of customers come by to place orders and make their purchases.  She sells her items on credit and collects weekly which is an advantage because she uses her collection visits to secure new sales.  She buys her products in Portoviejo and Guayaquil.  She works every day and collects on Saturdays.

She will use this loan to buy clothes like: pants, blouses, shirts, children’s clothes, etc.  Her dream is to have a commercial locale.

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, shirts, children's clothes, etc.

loans.name: Angel Eugenio

texts.es:
En la ciudadela nueva california de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Jerusalén.
 
Aquí conocimos a Ángel él tiene 24  años de edad, está casado y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 6 y 11 años los mismos que están en la escuela. Su mujer es comerciante.

Se dedica a la venta de periódicos y revistas, tiene un puesto en las calles América y AV. Manabí en la ciudad de Portoviejo, trabaja todos los días desde 06h00 hasta las 12h00. Nos cuenta que lleva varios años que se dedica a esta actividad y que ha ido creciendo poco a poco, ahora espera invertir este crédito en ropa para aprovechar la temporada que las personas compran mucho de estos productos.

Este crédito lo va a invertir para ir a Guayaquil a  comprar ropa, pantalones, camisas, camisetas, etc. lleva en el Banco Comunal tres ciclos y le gusta por la rapidez para conseguir los créditos. Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que donde vive es arrendado.
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank of Nueva Jerusalén meet every fifteen days in the Nueva California neighborhood of the city of Portoviejo. Portoviejo is the capital of Manabí Province and has been known for years as the city of the Royal Tamarind Trees.
