This is where we met 24-year-old Ángel. He is a married and has two children from this relationship, ages six and eleven. Both of his children are in school and his wife is a shopkeeper.
 
He works selling newspapers and magazines at a stand in Portoviejo, located at the intersection of Calle América and Avenida Manabí. He works every day from 6 to 12. He told us that he's been doing this job for several years now and that he has grown his business bit by bit. He would like to use this loan to purchase clothing in order to take advantage of the fact that people are buying lots of clothing right now.

He will use this loan to travel to Guayaquil to buy clothes such as pants, shirts, undershirts etc. He has participated in three funding cycles with the Communal Bank. He appreciates how quickly he can obtain loans through the bank. His dream is to own his own house as he is currently renting.

loans.use: Purchase of pants, shirts, undershirts etc.

loans.name: Carmen Italica

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Los Andes.

Aquí encontramos a la señora Carmen, ella lleva dos ciclos  en el Banco Comunal y dice que está muy a gusto porque ha recibido muchos beneficios de parte de la Fundación Espoir para sacar su negocio adelante. Tiene 47 años, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene  6 hijos, 4  de ellos ya son mayores y tiene  dos de 16 y 12 años y los dos estudian en colegio. Su marido es ebanista.
 
Ella se dedica al comercio, vende  zapatillas y sandalias, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja todos los días tres horas por dia, su mercadería la compra en Portoviejo, en la actualidad espera con este crédito empezar a vender ropa ya que estos productos tienen más salida en esta temporada.
 
Por eso este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar ropa de todo tipo y aprovechar la temporada  para ganarse un buen dinero. Su sueño es tener una casa mas grande.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, known as the City of the Royal Tamarinds since colonial times, the communal bank "Los Andes" meets every 15 days.  

Here we find Carmen, who has been with the communal bank for 2 loan cycles.  She says that she is very pleased because she has received benefits from being part of the Fundación Espoir which have helped her to succeed with her business.  She is 47 years old, and is in a common-law marriage which has produced 6 children.  Four of her children are grown, and the other two, aged 16 and 12, are in school.  Her husband is a cabinetmaker.

Carmen has a retail business selling sneakers and sandals.  She sells door-to-door, and works every day for 3 hours per day.  She buys her merchandise in Portoviejo, and now hopes with this loan to start selling clothing, since these products sell well in this season.

With this loan she will purchase all types of clothing, taking advantage of the season to earn good money.  Her dream is to have a bigger house.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Los Andes.

La señora Josefa es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que brinda la institución como por ejemplo el seguro de vida. Tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación ha tenido seis hijos, cuatro  son mayores de edad, los dos menores estudian en colegio y viven con ella. Ella es de la Provincia de  Chimborazo pero ya hace años se vino a esta ciudad.

Tiene un puesto en el centro de Portoviejo en el cual  se dedica a la  venta de frutas, más que todo frutas de la sierra como: manzanas, uvas, peras, duraznos, entre otras ricas frutas de esta parte del país. Ya son como 20 años que se dedica a esta actividad en esta ciudad. Las frutas las traen desde una distribuidora mayorista en Guayaquil.

Este crédito es para comprar frutas  como: manzanas, uvas, peras, duraznos, entre otras frutas. Su sueño es tener salud para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the members of the 'Los Andes' community bank meet in the city of Portoviejo which has been known since colonial times as the City of the Royal Tamarind Trees.

Josefa is a founding member of the community bike and she likes it for the additional benefits which the institution provides such as, for example, life insurance.  Josefa is 50 years old.  She is married and has six children.  Four of her children are already grown up and the two youingest are in high school and live with her.  She is from Chimborazo province but she came to this city years ago.

Josefa has a stall in the center of Portoviejo where she sells fruit, above all fruit from the mountains such as: apples, grapes, pears and peaches, as well as other delicious fruit from this part of the country.  She has been in this business for around 20 years.  She gets her fruit from a wholesale supplier in Guayaquil.

This loan will be used to buy fruit such as: apples, grapes, pears, peaches, etc.  Josefa's dream is to remain in good health so that she can continue working.

loans.use: To buy apples, grapes, peaches, pears, etc.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Los Andes.

Encontramos a la señora Mariana, Está desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son bajos, tiene 60 años de edad, es madre soltera de una hija de 18 años de edad que estudia el segundo semestre en la universidad. Ella aprendió corte y confección en un centro de enseñanza.

Tiene un pequeño taller de costura donde desde hace muchos años se dedica a  confeccionar todo tipo de ropa, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares y también elabora uniformes para instituciones, escuelas y colegios de la localidad. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 22h00.
 
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas, hilos botones y otros materiales para la costura. Su sueño es tener un taller más grande y bien implementado.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the members of the 'Los Andes' community bank meet in the city of Portoviejo which has been known since colonial times as the City of the Royal Tamarind Trees.

Here we meet Mariana.  She has been a member of her community bank since the beginning and she likes it because the interest rates are low.  She is 60 years old and a single mother with an 18 year-old daughter who is in her second semester at university.  Mariana learned dressmaking in an educational center.

Mariana has a small dressmaking workshop where she has been making all kinds of clothes for many years.  She works on orders from individuals and also makes uniforms for institutions, elementary schools and high schools in the area.  She works every day from 6.00am until 10.00pm.

Mariana will use her new loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons and other dressmaking materials.  Her dream is to have a bigger, well-equipped workshop.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Dilia Moncerrate

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Los Andes.

En este lugar encontramos y conocimos a la señora Dilia, tiene 42 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y fruto de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 16, 14 y 12 años todos estudian en colegio. Su marido es comerciante.

Tienen una pequeña fábrica en la que elaboran  chifles, en este negocio trabajan todos los días desde las  8h30 hasta las 16h00, en el mismo labora con la ayuda de su esposo y de su hermana, sus productos los entregan a varias tiendas, picanterías  y cevicherías de la ciudad. Tienen con su negocio ya un año en el cual han crecido mucho porque cada dia tienen más clientes.
 
Este crédito es para comprar plátano, aceite, manteca y otros ingredientes para la elaboración de este producto. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado a través de los créditos. Su sueño es tener un negocio mas grande.
texts.en:
The members of the Los Andes Communal Bank meet every fifteen days in the city of Portoviejo. Portoviejo has been known since colonial times as the city of the Royal Tamarind Trees. 

This is where we met and got to know Dilia. She is 42 years old, lives in a common law relationship, and has three children from this relationship. Her children are 16, 14, and and 12 years old and are all in school. Her husband is a shopkeeper.

They have a small factory where they produce plantain chips. They work there every day from 8:30am until 4:00pm. She works there together with her spouse and her sister. They deliver their products to various stores, restaurants and ceviche restaurants in the city. They started this business a year ago and it has grown significantly since then, given that they have new customers every day.

This loan will go toward the purchase of plantains, oil, butter, and other ingredients used to make this product. She has been part of the Communal Bank since the beginning and she appreciates the help the bank has given her through its loans. Her dream is to own a larger store one day.

loans.use: Purchase of plantains, oil, butter, salt etc.

loans.name: Segundo Alfonso

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Los Andes.

En este lugar encontramos a don Segundo el tiene 32 años de edad, está casado y fruto de esta relación tiene 4 hijos de 16, 14, 12 y 6 años de edad que estudian en colegio y en escuela. El es nacido en la ciudad de Riobamba pero hace varios años se vino a vivir a esta linda ciudad. Su esposa es comerciante.
 
Se dedica al comercio, vende frutas más que todo frutas de la sierra como: manzanas, uvas, peras, duraznos, entre otras ricas frutas de esta parte del país. Trabaja todos los días desde las 7 am hasta las 18h00 el trabaja solo, ya que su esposa también tiene otro negocio igual. Las frutas las traen desde una distribuidora mayorista en Guayaquil.

Este crédito es para comprar frutas  como: manzanas, uvas, peras, duraznos, entre otras frutas. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque los intereses son bajos. Su sueño es tener una gran tienda.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the members of the 'Los Andes' community bank meet in the city of Portoviejo which has been known since colonial times as the City of the Royal Tamarind Trees.

Here we meet 32 year-old Segundo.  He is married and has 4 children aged 16, 14, 12 and 6 who are studying in high school and elementary school.  Segundo was born in the city of Riobamba but he came to live in this beautiful city several years ago.  His wife is a saleswoman.

Segundo sells fruit, particularly fruit from the mountains such as apples, grapes, pears and peaches, as well as other delicious fruits from this part of the country.  He works every day from 7.00am to 6.00pm.  He works alone since his wife has another business the same.  He gets his fruit from a wholesale supplier in Guayaquil.

Segundo will use this loan to buy fruits such as apples, grapes, pears, peaches, etc.  He has been a member of his community bank from the beginning and he likes it because the interest rates are low.  His dream is to have a big store.

loans.use: To buy apples, grapes, pears, peaches, etc.

loans.name: Emperatriz

texts.es:
Emperatriz de 39 años de edad es casada, tiene 2 hijos, ambos estudiando la secundaria y primaria, labora para el MINED en la Escuela 17 de Julio desempeñandose como docente, con 16 años de servicio. 

Esta solicitando su 8vo credito con el objetivo de hacer las divisiones de los cuartos de sus hijos, repellando y embaldosandolo, pues ambos desean tener su propio espacio,  y de esta manera tratar de brindar mejores condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Emperatriz is 39 years old, married, and has two children who are in primary and secondary school.  She works for the Ministry of Education in the 17th of July school.  She has been a teacher for 16 years.

She is asking for her 8th loan in order to build a wall in her children's room with plaster and tiles.  They both want to have their own space, and she can try to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: Build a dividing wall in her children's room

loans.name: Nelly Elizabeth

texts.es:
Nelly, de 32 años de edad es casada, tiene 2 hijas, ambas estudian la primaria, tiene 7 años de trabajar para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa, es técnica en Administracion de Empresas, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien asume los gastos del hogar.

Esta solicitando su 4to credito con el objetivo de continuar mejorando su casa, pues fue beneficiada con kiva para mejorar el techo de su cuarto, ahora pretende construir los servicios higienicos de su casa (sumidero, inodoro, baño, lavamanos) para asi de esta manera poder brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Nelly is 32 years old, married and has two daughters who are both in elementary school.  Nelly has been working for the City of Juigalpa for 7 years.  She is a business management technician.  She has the support of her husband who takes care of their household expenses.

Nelly is requesting her 4th loan so that she can continue improving her house.  She used her previous Kiva loan to improve the roof of her room.  She now plans to build a bathroom in her home (drain, toilet, bath, sink) so that she can provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: To build a bathroom

loans.name: Maria Abigail

texts.es:
Maria Abigail de es soltera, labora para el MINED desde hace 20 años como docente de primaria en una escuela de Santo Domingo, Chontales. 

Esta solicitando  su 9no credito con el objetivo de mejorar su casa levantando una pared y cambiando el techo de su casa que esta en mal estado y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.  

Cabe señalar que sus creditos anteriores los ha invertido en mejorar su casita, pero hasta ahora espera ser beneficiada con kiva.
texts.en:
Maria Abigail is single.  She has worked for MINED for 20 years as an elementary school teacher in a school in Santo Domingo, Chontales.

She is requesting her 9th loan so that she can improve her house by building a wall and replacing her roof which is in a bad state.  She hopes to improve her family's living conditions.

We must point out that Maria Abigail invested her previous loans in improving her house.  She now hopes to benefit from Kiva loans.

loans.use: To repair walls

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan Pablo de 23 años de edad es casado, no tiene hijos, labora para el MINED de Santo Tomas desde hace 5 años como docente en una comarca del municipio, su esposa se dedica al cuido de la casa. 

Juan Pablo esta solicitando su 3er credito y espera seguir siendo beneficiado con el Fondo Kiva para continuar mejorando su casa, esta vez quiere ponerle el piso, y terminar de repellar la vivienda. 

El mayor sueño de Juan Pablo es poder terminar su casita para ofrecerle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida, ademas desea terminar la universidad para asi poder tener mejores oportunidades de trabajo. Expresa que cuando cancele este credito solicitara otro para seguir acondicionando su casa.
texts.en:
Juan Pablo is 23 years old, married, and has no children.  He has worked as a teacher for the Ministry of Education in Santo Tomas for five years.  His wife takes care of their home.

Juan Pablo is asking for his 3rd loan and he hopes to continue benefiting from Kiva funds so he can continue improving his home.  He would like to put in a floor and finish plastering his house.

Juan Pablo's dream is to be able to finish his house and give his family better living conditions.  He would also like to finish university so that he can have more career opportunities.  He said that when he pays back this loan, he will apply for another to continue renovating his home.

loans.use: Put in a floor and plaster his home

loans.name: Teresa De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Teresa de 27 años de edad es soltera, tiene un bebe de 6 meses de edad, labora como empledada domestica desde hace 5 años, ademas vende productos AVON, ZERMAT y otras cositas que sus clientes le encargan.

Esta solicitando su 2do credito con el objetivo de mejorar su casa, pues quiere reparar el techo de su cuarto que se encuentra en mal estado. 

El mayor sueño de Teresa es poder tener su casita con las condiciones basicas para su bebecito, pues es su razon de ser.
texts.en:
Teresa is 27 years old.  She is single and has a 6 month-old baby.  She has worked as a cleaner for 5 years and she also sells Avon and Zermat products and other things that her customers request.

She is requesting her second loan in order to improve her house because she would like to fix the roof of her room which is in a bad state.

Teresa's biggest dream is to have her house in the basic conditions necessary for her baby since he is her raison d'être.

loans.use: To repair the roof of her room

loans.name: Norwin Antonio

texts.es:
Norwin de 36 años de edad es soltero, tiene un niño de 5 años de edad, labora como fontanero en ENACAL Santo Tomas desde hace 2 años, ademas hace trabajos extras de fontaneria a personas que le buscan despues de su jornada laboral.

Esta solicitando su 1er credito con el objetivo de mejorar su casa, pues con las lluvias y los vientos se le ha dañado el techo de su cuarto y quiere cambiarlo, ya que desea evitar cualquier enfermedad a su pequeño hijo. 

Su mayor sueño es poder brindarle a su familia las condiciones basicas del hogar y que su hijo crezca y sea una persona de bien.
texts.en:
Norwin is 36 years old, single, and has a 5 year old child.  He has worked as a plumber in ENACAL Santo Tomas for two years.  He also does extra plumbing work for people who find him after his work-day.  

He is asking for his first loan to improve his home.  Rain and wind have damaged the roof of his room and he would like to change it since he doesn't want his young child to get sick. 

His dream is to provide his family with good living conditions and that his son grows up to be a good person.

loans.use: Change the roof on his home

loans.name: Gladys Del Rosario

texts.es:
Gladys de 38 años de edad es soltera, tiene 2 hijos, uno de 5 y el otro estudiando la universidad, labora para el MINED desde hace 18 años como docente en el Colegio Floresmilda D.. 

Esta solicitando su 4to credito con el objetivo de cambiar el techo de su casa que se encuentra en mal estado y al mismo tiempo cambiar los pilares de madera que con la humedad se estan deteriorando, para asi brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. 

Sueña con poder ir mejorando poco a poco sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia, pues son su razon de ser.
texts.en:
Gladys is 38 years old, single, and has two children.  One child is 5 years old and the other studies at the university.  She has worked for the Ministry of Education as a teacher at Floresmilda D. High School for 18 years.

She is asking for her 4th loan in order to repair the roof of her home that is in poor condition and also change the wooden pillars that are deteriorating because of the humidity.  This will allow her family to enjoy a better quality of life.

She dreams of being able to improve the living conditions of her family because they are her reason for being.

loans.use: Repair the roof and pillars of her home

loans.name: Maritza Guadalupe

texts.es:
Maritza de 45 años de edad es soltera, tiene 2 hijos, el mayor Luis Alberto de 16 años y el menor Eyner de 8 añitos que sale en la foto con ella, labora para el MINED desde hace 16 años como docente. 

Esta solicitando su 10mo credito con el objetivo de terminar la construccion de su casa haciendo el porche, para asi brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. 

Expresa que gracias a los creditos financiados por AFODENIC ha ido mejorando poco a poco su vivienda y agradece el apoyo brindado por kiva.
texts.en:
Maritza is 45 years old, single and has two children.  Her eldest, Luis Alberto, is 16 and her youngest, Eyner (who appears in the photo with her) is 8.  She has worked as a teacher for the Nicaraguan Ministry of Education for 16 years.

Maritza is requesting her 10th loan so that she can finish building her house, adding a porch, so that she can provide her family with better living conditions.

Maritza expresses her thanks to her previous loans from AFODENIC which have helped her to gradually improve her home.  She is also grateful for the support provided by Kiva.

loans.use: To build a porch

loans.name: Gabriel Narciso

texts.es:
Gabriel de 56 años de edad es casado, tiene 3 años de trabajar para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa como policia municipal.

Esta solicitando su 2do credito con el objetivo de terminar la letrina de su casa y cercar el patio de la misma para asi de esta manera poder brindarle mayor seguridad y mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.  

Sueña con ir mejorando poco a poco su casa y ofrecerle a su familia lo mejor.
texts.en:
Gabriel is a 56-year-old married man. He has been working for the Juigalpa Sheriff's Office for three years as a city policeman.

He is requesting his second loan in order to finish the bathroom in his house and to build a fence around his property. These projects will provide his family with greater safety and better living conditions.

His dream is to continue improving his house bit by bit and to offer his family the very best he can give them.

loans.use: Restroom construction

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es:
Jose Francisco de 24años de edad es casado, tiene una niña de 4 añitos de edad, labora para AFODENIC Vivienda como Responsable de mantenimiento de areas verdes en el residencial bosques de Juigalpan de hace 1 años. 

Esta solicitando  su 2do credito con el objetivo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida construyendo un cuarto con madera, ya que actualmente no cuenta con uno.

Sueña con poder darle a su familia las mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Jose Francisco is 24 years old and married.  He has a 4 year-old daughter and works for AFODENIC Vivienda.  He is the person in charge of maintaining the green spaces in the 'Bosques de Juigalpan' residential area.  He has been in this job for one year.

He is requesting his second loan with the goal of improving his living conditions by building a room from wood, since he currently doesn't have one.

Jose Francisaco dreams of being able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: To build a room

loans.name: Elcita Mercedes

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo, encontramos un lugar conocido como los arenales, aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Generación, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Elcita ella tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad pero que aún viven con ella. Su esposo es pescador.

Ella trabaja y administra el bar en el colegio Teniente Hugo Ortiz en Los arenales, en el cual vende sanduches, corviches, empanadas, jugos, gaseosas, agua entre otros bocadillos, trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 11amm hasta las 17h00 y los sabados y domingos se encarga de fabricar y vender adornos y recuerdos.

Este crédito es para comprar productos que sirven para  la preparación de los alimentos y para comprar gaseosa y jugos. Esta en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres ciclos y le ha gustado por la amistad que ha hecho dentro del Banco. Sus sueños son ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y que su hija sea una gran medico.
texts.en:
A place called Los Arenales is in Portoviejo’s Crucita parish.  The members of the Nueva Generación (New Generation) communal bank meet here every two weeks.  The place is known for its beautiful beaches, its gastronomy and the warmth of its people.

We can find Elcita, 47, here.  She is married and has two children who are now adults but still live with her.  Her husband is a fisherman.

She works at and runs the snack bar at the Teniente Hugo Ortiz School in Los Arenales.  She sells sandwiches, "corviches" (dough made from grated plantain, deep fried and stuffed with spicy fish or minced meat, topped with salad, mayo, chili), turnovers, juices, soft drinks and water among other snacks.  She works from Monday through Friday from 11am until 5pm.  On Saturdays and Sundays she makes decorations and keepsakes to sell.

She will use this loan to buy products she needs to make the food and to buy soft drinks and juices.  She has been in the communal bank for three cycles and has enjoyed the friendships she’s made within it.  Her dreams are to see her children finish their studies and that her daughter becomes a great physician.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs, soft drinks and juices.

loans.name: Rosa Melida

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo, encontramos un lugar conocido como los arenales aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Generación, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Rosa, ella tiene 54 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una hija de 24 años la cual junto a su esposo y su pequeña hija viven en su casa con ella. Su marido es agricultor.

Se dedica a la cría de pollos y junto a su esposo a la agricultura, siembran cultivos de ciclo corto como melón, arroz, maíz, pimiento. Trabajan de lunes a viernes desde las 7am hasta las 16h00, los productos cuando ya están de cosecha los recogen y los llevan a los mercados donde las entregan a comerciantes al por mayor, nos cuenta que el trabajo es duro pero que tiene su recompensa cuando se tiene buenas cosechas, con ellos trabajan dos personas a los que les pagan un sueldo semanal.
 
Este nuevo crédito es para abonar un terreno para sembrar cebolla perla, además de insumos agrícolas, fertilizantes. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace como 18 años y le gusta por los diferentes créditos que ofrece la Fundación Espoir. Sus sueños son ver  a su nito grande y tener buena salud ella y los suyos.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Nueva Generación' community bank meet in Crucita parish, in Portoviejo canton, in a place known as 'Los Arenales'.  This place is known for its beautiful beaches, its wonderful food and the warmth of its people.

Here we find 54 year-old Rosa who lives with her common-law husband and has a 24 year old daughter who lives with Rosa together with her own husband and young daughter.  Rosa's husband is a farmer.

Rosa raises chickens and, together with her husband, she farms.  They both grow short-cycle crops such as melon, rice and pepper.  They work from Monday to Friday, from 7.00am to 4.00pm.  When their produce is ready to harvest they take it to market where they deliver it to salespeople wholesale.  Rosa tells us that her work is hard but that it has its reward when she has good harvests.  Two other people work with Rosa and her husband and she pays them a weekly wage.

This new loan will be used to rent a plot of land to grow pearl onions and also to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers.  Rosa has been a member of her community bank for around 18 years and she likes it for the different loans which Fundación Espoir offer.  Her dreams are to see her grandson grow up and for herself and her family to enjoy good health.

loans.use: To buy manure, agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Carmen Elodia

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo, encontramos un lugar conocido como los arenales aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Generación, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Carmen, ella tiene 55 años de edad, mantuvo una relación de la cual tuvo 8 hijos, los mismos que ya son mayores de edad e independientes,  en su casa viven cuatro de sus nietos que ella los crio desde que nacieron y tienen 12, 11, 10 y 8 años todos están en escuela.
 
Se dedica a la compra y venta de pescado, todas las mañanas sale de su casa y se acerca a las embarcaciones que llegan de alta mar, luego de bajar el pescado ella les compra el pescado por gavetas a los pescadores para después llevarlos a vender por toda la localidad, trabaja todos los días desde las 5am hasta las 15h00,  también realiza trabajos de limpieza del pescado por lo que le pagan un sueldo. 

Este crédito es para ir a comprar pescado y llevarlo a vender. Lleva 8 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe de parte de la fundación Espoir. Sus sueños son ver que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
In the parish of Crucita in the canton of Portoviejo, there is a place known as Los Arenales where every fifteen days the members of the community bank Nueva Generación [New Generation] meet.  This area is known for their beautiful beaches, cuisine, and the quality of the people.

Carmen is 55 years old and maintains a relationship which gave her eight children, who are grown up and independent.  Four of her grandchildren live with her, and she raised them since they were born.  They are 8, 10, 11, and 12 years old and they are all in school.

She works buying and selling fish.  Every morning she leaves home and goes to the boats that come in from the sea.  After they unload their cargo, she buys fish from the fishermen and brings them to sell all over town.  She works every day from 5:00am until 3:00pm.  She also cleans fish, which pays her a salary.

This loan will be used to purchase fish and bring it to be sold.  She has been a member of the community bank for eight years, and she likes the benefits that she receives as part of the Espoir Foundation.  

Her dream is to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: Purchase fish

loans.name: Ana Candelaria

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo, encontramos un lugar conocido como los arenales aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Generación, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

La señora Ana fue socia fundadora del Banco Comunal Nueva Generación pero se retiro por unos ciclos y decidió volver ahora es su primer ciclo y nos cuenta que siempre le ha gustado el banco que lo dejó por motivos de viaje. Ella tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y  tiene dos hijos ya mayores de edad pero que aún viven en su casa. Su marido se dedica a  la pesca.

Es un ama de casa que para ayudarse y ayudar a su marido se dedica a la venta de ropa, tiene un pequeño local en su casa, lo que ella mas vende es ropa de mujer y  también vende ropa de hombres. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30 hasta las 16h00. Su mercadería la va a comprar cada fin de mes a Guayaquil.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pantalones, vestidos, blusas y camisetas. Sus sueños son tener una gran boutique.
texts.en:
A place called Los Arenales is in Portoviejo’s Crucita parish.  The members of the Nueva Generación (New Generation) communal bank meet here every two weeks.  The place is known for its beautiful beaches, its gastronomy and the warmth of its people.

Ana was a founding member of the Nueva Generación communal bank but she dropped out for two cycles.  She’s now decided to return and this is her first cycle.  She tells us that she’s always liked the bank but dropped out due to travel.  She is 55 years old, married and has two adult children that still live at home with her.  Her husband is a fisherman.

She is a housewife who started selling clothes to help herself and to help her husband.  She has a small store in her house.  What she sells the most is women’s clothes and she also sells men’s clothes.  She works every day from 8:30am until 4pm.  She goes to Guayaquil at the end of every month to buy merchandise.

This loan will be used to buy pants, dresses, blouses and undershirts.  Her dream is to have a great store.

loans.use: To buy pants, dresses, blouses and undershirts.

loans.name: Edita Elirita

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo, encontramos un lugar conocido como los arenales aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Generación, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

Ya son 12 años que la señora Edita es socia del Banco Comunal, nos cuenta que siempre le ha gustado por las reuniones y los créditos que son muy importantes para  su negocio. Ella tiene 58 años de edad, esta casada y fruto de esta linda relación tiene 8 hijos todos son mayores de edad, con ellos viven dos  nietos que los crio desde pequeñitos y que tienen 15 y 9 años el mayor estudia en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su marido es comerciante.
 
Tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, vende desde arroz, azúcar, carne, pescado camarón, queso y también vende ciertos remedios y artículos de bazar, trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 18h00. Dice que tiene en su tienda ya hace treinta años y  que en ella además de ganarse la vida ella también se distrae conversando con sus amigas. Los productos los compra en la ciudad de Portoviejo y otros los recibe en su local.

Este crédito es para surtir su tienda, para comprar arroz, azúcar, atún, detergentes, y otros productos.  Sus sueños son tener una casa más grande, mejor construida y un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
A place called Los Arenales is in Portoviejo’s Crucita parish.  The members of the Nueva Generación (New Generation) communal bank meet here every two weeks.  The place is known for its beautiful beaches, its gastronomy and the warmth of its people.

Edita has been a member of the communal bank for 12 years now.  She tells us that she’s always enjoyed the meetings and the loans which are very important for her business. 

She is 58 years of age, married and this beautiful relationship produced 8 children, all adults now.  Two grandchildren, who she has raised since they were babies, live with her.  They are now 15 and 9 years of age.  The older one is in secondary school and the younger is in elementary school.  Her husband is a merchant.

She has a grocery store installed in her house.  She sells rice, sugar, meat, fish, shrimp, cheese and also sells certain remedies and kitchen supplies.  She works every day from 6am until 6pm.

She says that her store has been around for 30 years and that besides earning a living in it she enjoys the distraction chatting with her friends is.  She buys her merchandise in Portoviejo; some others are delivered to her store.

This loan is to stock the store: to buy rice, sugar, tuna, detergents and other products.  

Her dreams are to have a larger, better built house and a larger business.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, tuna, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Alexi Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo, encontramos un lugar conocido como los arenales aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Generación, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Alexi, ella tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 23, 22 y 20 años, dos de ellos viven con ella. El marido es chofer. Ella es socia del Banco Comunal hace dos años y se desempeña como fiscal de reglamentos.

Tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, vende desde arroz, azúcar, también vende carne, pescado camarón, queso, ciertos remedios y artículos de bazar como ropa zapatos y bisutería, trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 20h00, trabaja con la ayuda de su esposo. La mercadería la compra en la ciudad de Portoviejo y otros de los productos los recibe en su local.

Este crédito es para surtir su tienda, para comprar arroz, azúcar, atún, detergentes, además de artículos de bazar, ya que esta cerca la navidad y en esta época se vende bastante lo que es ropa y zapatos.  Sus sueños son tener una casa más grande, mejor construida y un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
The place known as Los Arenales can be found in the Crucita parish in the Portoviejo province.  That is where the members of the “Nueva Generación” (New Generation) Communal Bank meet every two weeks.  This place is known for its beautiful beaches, its cuisine, and the warmth of its people.

This is where we find Alexi, age 40.  She is married and has three children; ages 23, 22, and 20.  Two of the children live with her.  Her husband is a driver.  She has been a member of the communal bank for two years, and she oversees the regulations for the bank.

She has a grocery store in her house.  She sells things like rice, sugar, meat, fish, shrimp, cheese, and certain remedies.  She also sells bazaar items like clothes, shoes, and costume jewelry.  She works every day from 6:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m.  Her husband helps her work.  She buys the merchandise in the city of Portoviejo, and some other products are delivered to her place.

This loan is to stock her store.  She will buy rice, sugar, tuna, detergent, and bazaar items.  It is close to Christmas, and lots of clothes and shoes are sold during this season.  Her dreams are to have a bigger house, which is built better, and to have a larger business.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, tuna, detergent, and bazaar items like clothes and shoes

loans.name: Seneida Maricela

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo, encontramos un lugar conocido como los arenales aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Generación, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Seneida, tiene 33 años, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 15  y un niño de 8 años, la mayor esta en colegio mientras que el menor esta en escuela, el esposo es agricultor. Ella es profesora en una escuela de la localidad.

Además de ser ama de casa y profesora también se dedica al comercio, vende productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y  accesorios de damas) trabaja de lunes a viernes,  su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y sale a vender en las tardes y noches,  también vende en el lugar de trabajo a sus compañeras y a madres de familia que quieran sus productos.  A veces ayuda a su esposo en los sembríos ya que el siembra cebolla perla, sandias, melón, pimiento, trabajan con la ayuda de 10 personas a los que les pagan un sueldo.

Este crédito es para comprar cremas, perfumes, pero sobre todo para comprar semillas, abonos y matamalezas, está en el Banco Comunal hace ya 8 años y le gusta el Banco por los beneficios que recibe. Sus sueños son llegar a ser licenciada ya que está haciendo la tesis y tener un nombramiento del estado como profesora
texts.en:
The place known as Los Arenales can be found in the Crucita parish in the Portoviejo province.  That is where the members of the “Nueva Generación” (New Generation) Communal Bank meet every two weeks.  This place is known for its beautiful beaches, its cuisine, and the warmth of its people.

This is where we find Seneida, age 33.  She is married and has two children, ages 15 and 8.  The older child goes to high school, and the younger child is in elementary school.  Her husband is a farmer.  She is a teacher in a local school.

In addition to being a housewife and a teacher, she also sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women’s accessories).  She works from Monday through Friday.  She sells door to door in the afternoons and evenings.  She also sells to her colleagues at her place of work and to mothers who want her products.

Sometimes she helps her husband with the crops.  He grows pearl onions, watermelon, cantaloupe, and pepper plants.  They work with the help of ten people, to whom they pay a salary.

This loan is to buy creams and perfumes, but above all, it is to buy seeds, fertilizers, and weed killers.  She has been a member of the communal bank for eight years.  She likes the bank because of the benefits that she receives.  Her dream is to get her degree.  She is working on her thesis, and she wants to obtain an appointment from the state as a teacher.

loans.use: To buy creams, perfumes, cosmetics, seeds, fertilizers, and weed killers

loans.name: Paula Lorena

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal La Unión Hace La Fuerza. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Paula, ella mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual ha procreado tres hijos, dos de ellos ya son mayores y uno de 16 años que estudia en colegio y vive con ella. Su marido es agricultor.

Tiene un negocio de venta de mariscos y legumbres actividad que la realiza todos los domingos en la ciudad de Rocafuerte en la cual tiene un puesto en el mercado, los demás días vende pescado por el lugar donde ella habita. El pescado lo compra todos los días bien de mañana a pescadores que llegan hasta las playas de los arenales.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado, verduras y otros mariscos. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta las charlas y los créditos. Sus sueños son tener una casa bien construida.
texts.en:
The members of the “La Unión Hace La Fureza” (Strength Through Unity) Communal Bank meet every two weeks in the Rocafuerte canton.  This place is known for the delicious sweets that its inhabitants make.  The sweets are known throughout the whole country.

This is the place where we find Paula.  She is in a common-law marriage, and they have three children.  Two of them are adults, and the 16 year old goes to high school and lives with her.  Her husband is a farmer.

She has a business selling seafood and vegetables every Sunday in the city of Rocafuerte.  She has a stall in the market there.  The other days she sells fish in the place where she lives.  She buys the fish early in the morning every day.  She buys from fishermen who come to the Los Arenales beaches.

This loan is to buy fish, vegetables, and other seafood.  This is her second cycle in the communal bank.  She likes the talks and the loans.  Her dream is to have a well-built house.

loans.use: To buy fish, vegetables, and other seafood

loans.name: Carmen Marilu

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal La Unión Hace La Fuerza. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Carmen, ella es madre  soltera de una niña de siete años que estudia en escuela. Vive en casa de sus padres.

Para poder sacar a  su hija adelante y no depender de nadie ella empezó un negocio de venta de sabanas, cortinas y de productos para el hogar como: planchas, licuadoras, camas, etc. productos de La Gran Cadena. Trabaja tres días a la semana en las entregas y los cobros ya que deja a crédito y cobra todas las semanas. Dice que lleva 5 años en esto y que le ha ido bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar sabanas, cortinas y otros productos para el hogar. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los créditos que son fáciles de conseguir. Sus sueños son tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
The members of the “La Unión Hace La Fureza” (Strength Through Unity) Communal Bank meet every two weeks in the Rocafuerte canton.  This place is known for the delicious sweets that its inhabitants make.  The sweets are known throughout the whole country.

This is where we find Carmen.  She is the single mother of a seven year old daughter who goes to school.  She lives in her parents’ house.  In order to be able to get her daughter ahead and not be dependent upon anyone, she started a business selling sheets and curtains.  She also sells household items like irons, blenders, and bedroom accessories, etc. She sells products from a large chain store.  She works three days a week on deliveries and collections.  She gives credit, and she collects every week.  She has been doing this for five years, and it has gone well for her.

She will use this loan to buy sheets, curtains, and other household items.  This is her second cycle with the communal bank.  She likes it because of the loans and the ease of getting a loan.

Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: To buy sheets, curtains, irons, and blenders, etc.

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal La Unión Hace La Fuerza. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar encontramos a José Luis L., tiene 30 años de edad, mantiene una relación de un ion libre de la cual tiene una niña de siete años la cual es discapacitada, no puede oír ni hablar, su mujer se dedica a las tares del hogar.

Tiene un pequeño taller de ebanistería en el cual realiza muchas obras como puertas, muebles, sillas, anaqueles y otras productos que el elabora con la madera y que los realiza bajo pedido, dice que lleva siete años con su taller y que gracias a Dios no le ha faltado trabajo, labora de lunes a viernes desde las 8am hasta las 18h00, la materia prima la compra en un depósito de madera en  la ciudad de Portoviejo.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar más madera, pintura, y otros productos para la elaboración de sus obras. Está en el banco comunal hace   dos ciclos y le gusta todas las charlas, los créditos etc.  Sus sueños son tener un taller mas grande y con maquinarias adecuadas.
texts.en:
The members of the “La Unión Hace La Fureza” (Strength Through Unity) Communal Bank meet every two weeks in the Rocafuerte canton.  This place is known for the delicious sweets that its inhabitants make.  The sweets are known throughout the whole country.

This is where we find José Luis L..  He is 30 years old and in a common-law marriage.  They have a seven year old daughter who is disabled.  She cannot hear or speak.  His wife devotes herself to the household chores.

He has a small cabinetmaking shop.  He makes lots of things like doors, furniture, chairs, shelves, and other products made from wood.  He makes things by order, and he has had his shop for seven years.  Thanks to God that he has had work.  He works from Mondays through Fridays from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  He buys the raw material in a wood depot in the city of Portoviejo.

He will use this loan to buy more wood, paint, and other products for his work.  He has been in the communal bank for two cycles.  He likes the talks and the loans, etc.  He dream is to have a larger shop with adequate machinery.

loans.use: To buy wood, paint, lacquer, nails, and glue, etc.

loans.name: Diodate Elizabeth

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal La Unión Hace La Fuerza. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

Para la señora Diodate este es su primer ciclo y fue una amiga la que la llevo a que se integraras al Banco Comunal y le gustado mucho por que el grupo la ha recibido muy bien. Tiene 36 años de edad mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual ha procreado tres hijos de 12, 9 y 7 años, todos están en escuela. Su marido es comerciante vende animales.
 
Trabaja en un restaurante en las tardes y noches y en la mañana  se dedica a la cría de gallinas y chanchos los mismos que cuando están grandes los vende por libras o enteros. Muchas veces al igual que su esposo también se ha dedicado al comercio de compra y venta de animales para lo cual acompaña a su esposo a los campos donde compran más barato para luego llevarlos  a los mercados de Portoviejo donde venden sus  animales a un mejor precio.
 
Este crédito es para comprar gallinas criollas y pollos para la cría, sus sueños son tener una casa de hormigón y bien construida.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'La Unión Hace La Fuerza' (Unity is Strength) community bank meet in Rocafuerte canton.  This place is known for the delicious sweet treats that its residents prepare and they are well known throughout the country.

This is Diodate's first loan cycle.  One of her friends brought her to join the community bank and she has liked it a lot because the group has made her very welcome.  Diodate is 36 years old and she lives with her common-law husband.  They have three children aged 12, 9 and 7.  All of the children are in school.  Her husband is a salesman.  He sells animals.

Diodate works in a restaurant in the afternoons and evenings.  In the mornings she raises hens and pigs which, when they are grown, she sells whole or by the pound.  Like her husband, she also works in the buying and selling of animals.  She accompanies her husband to the fields where they buy more cheaply and they then take their animals to the markets of Portoviejo where they sell them for a better price.

This loan will be used to buy creole hens and chickens to raise.  Her dreams are to have a well-built, concrete house.

loans.use: To buy creole hens and chickens

loans.name: Noé Eduardo

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal La Unión Hace La Fuerza. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar encontramos a Noé, tiene 42  años de edad, es soltero, vive en la casa de sus padres en la cual además de el también vive una hermana con sus cuatro hijos. Su papa se dedica a la carpintería.

Tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en la casa de su papa, dice que es pequeña pero que tiene de todo desde arroz, azúcar, hasta carne, pescado y también vende ciertos remedios y artículos de bazar, trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 20h00. Nos cuenta que tiene su tienda ya por 1 año y que a pesar de que al principio no tenía muchos clientes después le fue muy bien y ahora ya tiene muchos clientes que hasta se reúnen en  las noches en su local.
 
Este crédito es para surtir su tienda, para comprar arroz, azúcar, atún, detergentes, y otros productos. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por las facilidades que brinda la institución para obtener los créditos. Sus sueños son tener un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
The members of the La Unión Hace La Fuerza (Strength from Unity) communal bank meet every two weeks in Rocafuerte canton.  This place is known for the delicious sweets the locals make that are famous throughout the country.

We find Noé here.  He is 42 years old, single and lives in his parents’ house where a sister and her four children also live.  His father is a carpenter.

He has a small grocery store installed in his father’s house.   He says it’s small but stocked with everything from rice and sugar to meat and fish.  He also sells certain remedies and kitchen supplies.  He works every day from 6am until 8pm.  He tells us that he’s had the store for a year now and that even though at the beginning he had few customers he later did well and now has lots of customers that even get together at night in his store.

This loan is to stock the store: to buy rice, sugar, tuna, detergents and other products.  This is his second loan in the communal bank which he likes because of the ease with which the institution grants loans.  His dream is to have a larger store.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, tuna, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Hilda Efigenia

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal La Unión Hace La Fuerza. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

La señora Hilda es socio fundadoras del banco Comunal y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido y muy ordenado. Tiene 62 años de edad, mantienen una relación de unión libre por muchos años de la cual ha procreado 5 hijos, tres mujeres y dos varones todos  ellos ya son mayores de edad. Su marido es comerciante.

Tiene un puesto en el mercado donde vende frutas y legumbres. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 19h00, su negocio lo tiene al lado del negocio de su esposo que es comerciante de pescado. Además de esto también cría pollos y chanchos, las legumbres y frutas las compra en el mismo mercado a comerciantes mayoristas.

Este crédito es para comprar frutas y legumbres para la venta diaria. Sus sueños son tener bien construida su casa ya que es de madera y gozar de buena salud.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'La Unión Hace la Fuerza' (Unity is Strength) community bank meet in Rocafuerte canton.  This place is known for the delicious sweet treats that its residents make which are known throughout the country.

Hilda is a founding member of her community bank and she likes it because the group is very united and orderly.  Hilda is 62 years old.  She has lived with her common-law husband for many years and they have 5 children: 3 daughters and 2 sons who are all now grown up.  Her husband is a salesman.

Hilda has a stall in the market where she sells fruit and vegetables.  She works every day from 6.00am to 7.00pm.  Her business is next to that of her husband who sells fish.  In addition, she also raises chickens and pigs.  She buys her fruit and vegetables in the same market from wholesale traders.

Hilda will use this loan to buy fruit and vegetables to sell every day.  Her dreams are to have a well-built home, since her home is currently made of wood, and to enjoy good health.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Carmen María

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal La Unión Hace La Fuerza. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Carmen, tiene 35 años y es madre soltera de 4 hijo de 15, 8, 4 y 1 años, el mayor esta en colegio y otro de sus hijos esta en escuela lo que para Carmen le resulta muy difícil ya que es padre y madre a la vez.

Se dedica a la cría de animales y además junto a su hijo venden legumbres en el mercado, trabajan todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 14h00, los chanchos los compra pequeños los cría por tres meses y luego los vende a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa para llevarlos a los mercados y venderlos por libras, en algunos casos también ella los vende por libra ya que le dejan mejores ganancias.

Este crédito es para comprar chanchos pequeños y comida para estos. Además de legumbres y frutas. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la oportunidad que brinda la institución para otros créditos como el crédito emergente o de estudios. Sus sueños son ver que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'La Unión Hace la Fuerza' (Unity is Strength) community bank meet in Rocafuerte canton.  This place is known for the delicious sweet treats that its residents make which are known throughout the country.

Here we meet 35 year-old Carmen.  She is a single mother and has 4 children aged 15, 8, 4 and 1.  Her eldest child is in high school and her second child is in elementary school.  This is very difficult for Carmen as she must be both father and mother at the same time.

Carmen raises animals and also sells vegetables in the market with her son.  They work every day from 6.00am to 2.00pm.  They buy the pigs when they are young and then raise them for three months.  They sell then them to traders who come to her house to take the pigs to market and sell them by the pound.  Sometimes she also sells the pigs herself by the pounds since this makes her more profits.

Carmen will use this loan to buy young pigs and pig feed as well as fruit and vegetables.  This is her second loan with her community bank and she likes it for the opportunity that the institution provides for other loans such as emergency loans or student loans.  Her dreams are to see her children grow up to be professionals.

loans.use: To buy pigs, pig feed, fruit and vegetables

loans.name: María Floricelda

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal La Unión Hace La Fuerza. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

La señora Marina es socio fundadoras del banco Comunal y le gusta porque las socias son muy cumplidas, ella se desempeña como tesorera función que cumple muy bien ya que es por el bien del grupo. Tiene 40 años de edad, mantienen una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de tres años. Su marido trabaja en una camaronera.

Tiene una mini tienda de abarrotes en su casa, vende desde arroz, azúcar, también vende carne, pescado camarón, queso, ciertos remedios y artículos de bazar, trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 18h00.  También vende aguas, colas y helados. Los productos los compra en la ciudad de Portoviejo y otros los recibe en su local.

Este crédito es para surtir su tienda, para comprar arroz, azúcar, atún, detergentes, y otros productos.  Sus sueños son tener un negocio más grande y poder estudiar y terminar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'La Unión Hace la Fuerza' (Unity is Strength) community bank meet in Rocafuerte canton.  This place is known for the delicious sweet treats that its residents make which are known throughout the country.

Marina is a founding member of the community bank and she likes it because the members are very punctual.  Marina is the bank's treasurer.  She does her job very well since it is for the good of the group.  Marina is 40 years old.  She lives with her common-law husband and has a 3 year-old son.  Her husband works in a seafood restaurant.

Marina has a small grocery store in her home.  She sells products such as rice, sugar and also meat, fish, prawns, cheese, some medicines and other articles.  She works every day from 6.00am to 6.00pm.  She also sells water, coke and iced treats.  She buys some of her products in the city of Portoviejo and others are delivered direct to her premises.

Marina will use this loan to stock her store.  She will buy rice, sugar, tuna, detergents and other products.  Her dreams are to have a bigger store and to be able to study for a career.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, tuna, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Janeling

texts.en:
Janeling M. is from the village of Zone 1, San Mariano, Isabela. She is 29 years old. Janeling is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling clothing and shoes in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately $100 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Janeling joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Beneboy

texts.en:
Beneboy B. is from the village of Cabisera 25, Ilagan, Isabela. He is 33 years old. Beneboy is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Beneboy owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting corn for sale. Beneboy has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Beneboy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Beneboy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Beneboy is requesting a new loan of 29000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Beneboy from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Manny

texts.en:
Manny C. is from the village of Maluno Sur, Benito Soliven, Isabela. He is 38 years old. Manny is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Manny owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Manny has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Manny joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Manny is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Manny from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a 21-year-old man from Tulkarem city, Muhammad had to leave school when he was young and started working to help his family. He is now employed as a guard by the Engineers Association in Tulkarem. Muhamamd wants to go back to school and earn a degree. He came to FATEN for a loan to pay for high school exam fees and the college tuition next year.

Muhammad is a smart and respected man who wants to improve his situation and continue his education to improve his life and get a better job.


Muhammad is receiving the loan at the Tulkarem branch office in the picture above.

loans.use: To pay for high school exam now and university tuition fees later

loans.name: Muhannad

texts.en:
Muhannad is a young Palestinian man from Jenin. He has an auto repair workshop that he has been working in for a long time. Recently, Muhannad started fixing the cross-arm in cars, which connects the engine and the drive wheel. This work turned out to be very rewarding so he decided to start selling this part of the car as well as fixing it.

Muhannad came to FATEN for a loan to finish constructing the warehouse next to his workshop where he wants to keep the cross-arms. Muhannad's idea is the only one in Jenin. Usually people have to purchase the part from other places, such as Israel, which is very expensive.

Muhannad is a father of two daughters and one son and appears in the picture above in FATEN's office.

loans.use: To build a warehouse to store car parts

loans.name: Kifah

texts.en:
Kifah lives in Jenin and works with his family in agriculture. He is 21 years old and he had to pause studying after high school and start working. When Kifah decided to resume studying, he was admitted to school and could pay first year tuition fees from his savings. Now he has come to FATEN for a loan to pay for next year's fees.

Kifah is an ambitious young man who wants to get his degree and keep helping his family working on the farm they have.

Kifah appears in the picture above in FATEN's office.

loans.use: To pay college tuition fees

loans.name: Elmer
