loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a samosa selling business for the past ten years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Mwanaisha faces a major challenge of high competition in her business. She hopes to own a a café in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to renovate her house and purchase 50 pieces of blocks and sand. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to uplift her business.

loans.use: To renovate her house and purchase 50 pieces of blocks and sand.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a single woman who lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She has operated a sand selling business for the past one year, selling at wholesale to her neighbours and passersby. Her potential customers are house contractors. She hopes to be supplying sand in large quantities in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase six tons of sand for resale. She decided to work with Yehu to get a loan to uplift her living standards.

loans.use: To  purchase six tons of sand for resale.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is married woman with one child who is still  too young to attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a fresh water selling business for the past year, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Zawadi faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to sell at wholesale in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase a water tank for storing water for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank for storing water for sale.

loans.name: Katsaka

texts.en:
Katsaka is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a green grocer business, selling at the market and from home to her neighbours. Katsaka faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to open a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to renovate her house and purchase sheets of iron building material. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and uplift her living standards.

loans.use: To  renovate her house and purchase sheets of iron building material.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school while one is too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a food vending business for the past five years, selling at the market, from door to door and from home. Mwanakombo faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During dry hot season the availability of food stuff for sale in the market is inadequate and the demand is high while during cold winter season the supply of food is high in the market and demand is low. She hopes to own a café business in the future. 

With the 15000 KES she wants to purchase wheat flour, sacks of beans, cooking oil and kitchen utensils. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, sacks of beans, cooking oil and kitchen utensils

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy S. is a married man with two children, one of whom attends school while the other one is still too young for school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills.

Kennedy has operated a food vending business for the past two years, selling at the market and to his neighbors and passersby. Kennedy faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He hopes to own a café in the future.

With the 15000 KES he wants to purchase kitchen utensils, a frying pan, jugs and water glasses. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase kitchen utensils, frying pan, jugs and water glasses

loans.name: Gladiness

texts.en:
Gladiness M. is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a handbags and shoes business for the past two years, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Gladiness faces a major challenge of delayed payments by creditors. She hopes to expand her business and own her own shop in the future.

With the 15000 KES she wants to purchase 15 pairs of shoes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase 15 pairs of shoes for resale

loans.name: Cleophas

texts.en:
Cleophas P. is a married man with two children who both attend school. He owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family. 

He has operated a retail shop for the past three years, selling in the shop and to his neighbors. Cleophas faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He hopes to open a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 40000 KES he wants to renovate his retail shop, purchase timber, cement and drawers. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business.

loans.use: To renovate his retail shop, purchase timber, cement and drawers

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon O. is a married man who lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

He has operated a vegetable stall business for the past two years, selling from home to his neighbors and passersby. Simon faces a major challenge of seasonality and fluctuation of prices in the market. He hopes to expand his business and establish a retail shop in the future.

With the 20000 KES he wants to purchase green vegetables, tomatoes, onions and fruits. He decided to join Yehu because of the efficiency of the financial services.

loans.use: To purchase green vegetables, tomatoes, onions and fruits

loans.name: Muhamadi

texts.en:
Muhamadi H. is a single man who owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

He has operated a fruit and vegetable stall for more than a year, selling from home to his neighbors and passersby. Muhamadi faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in the market. He hopes to expand his vegetables stall and get more earnings from the sales.

With the 20000 KES he wants to purchase sacks of vegetables and fruits for his stall. He decided to join Yehu because of the efficiency of the financial services provided.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables and fruits for his vegetables stall

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma S. is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past 15 years, she has operated a natural juice selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. Fatuma faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the 25000 KES she wants to purchase a freezer for storing juices for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer for storing juices for sale

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina S. is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a juice selling business for the past two years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Amina faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the rainy season the demand for juice is very low. She hopes to expand and establish a retail shop in the future.

With the 20000 KES she wants to purchase flavors and sugar for making juices. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To  purchase flavors and sugar for making natural juices

loans.name: Kibibi

texts.en:
Kibibi K. is a single woman with one child who graduated from school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is rent bills.

She operates a Mnazi (local brew) business from home, selling to the local community. Kibibi faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to become a wholesale supplier in the future.

With the 20000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome C. is a married woman with four children. One has graduated from school while three still attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a charcoal selling business for the past three months, selling from home to her neighboring community. In addition she also sells firewood, which contributes to her income. Salome faces a major challenge of seasonality because of price fluctuations. She hopes to expand her business and supply a larger number of clients. 

With the 20000 KES she wants to purchase 100 bags of charcoal for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase 100 bags of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a single woman who owns a house that has no electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is clothing. 

She has operated a food stall business for the past three years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Mwanakombo's major challenge is competition from other food stall operators. She hopes to operate a restaurant in future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sacks of beans and utensils for her food stall. She decided to join Yehu to gain access to loans that will improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, sacks of beans and utensils for her food stall.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman with seven children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense, is food for the family.

She has operated a fish selling business for a year, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Agnes faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to establish a fish selling stall in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a french fries selling business for over eight years, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. Jackline faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand and diversify her products in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000, she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes to make french fries for sale. She decided to join Yehu because it is a source for reliable funds and a customer focused organization.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of potatoes to make french fries for sale.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has been operating a vegetable selling business for the past four years, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. In her business, Janet faces a major challenge of the high cost of transporting goods. She hopes to expand and diversify in the future.

With the Kshs 35,000 she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes, green vegetables and tomatoes. She decided to join Yehu to gain access to loans that will give a boost to her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of potatoes, green vegetables and tomatoes.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a single woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She operates a vegetable selling business at the market, selling to her neighboring community and passersby. Margaret faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand and diversify in the future.  

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes and green vegetables. She decided to join Yehu to gain access to loans that will provide a boost to her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes and green vegetables.

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en:
Mwanarusi is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has both electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing.

Mwanarusi has operated a food stall business for the past ten years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She also has housing properties that provide her with additional lincome. Mwanarusi faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the Kshs 15,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes as well as fruits for making natural juices. She decided to join Yehu because of its absence of complex legal requirements, and hopes to establish a restaurant in the future.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of potatoes, and fruits for making natural juices.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a married woman with six children, five of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees.

She has operated a food stall selling business for the past ten years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Monica faces a major challenge of competition from other food stall operators in her business. She hopes to establish a retail shop in the future. With the Kshs 35,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans and fish for resale. She decided to join Yehu because it is a simple process and requires no legal formalities.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans and  fish for resale.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is a married man with three children, two of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

He has operated a butcher shop for the past seven years.  Neighbors and passersby are his potential customers. Juma faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He hopes to establish another butcher shop in the future.

With the Kshs 75,000 he wants to purchase cow meat for sale in his butcher shop. He decided to join Yehu because of its simple enrollment procedure.

loans.use: To purchase cow meat for sale in his butcher shop.

loans.name: Mvazi

texts.en:
Mvazi is a married woman with six children, two of whom attend school while four graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a food selling business for the past five years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Mvazi faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to establish a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of beans and bundles of wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu because few legal formalities are required to join.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of beans and bundles of wheat flour.

loans.name: Ramla

texts.en:
Ramla is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She operates a firewood sales business from home, selling to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she sells fresh water which contributes another source of income. Ramla faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to become a big supplier of firewood in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of firewood for resale

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with three children, one of whom attends school while the other two are too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has operated a motorcycle business for the last four years. In addition she sells fresh water which contributes another source of income. Amina faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand and operate a taxi business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase spare parts to repair her motorcycle. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to repair her motorcycle

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is a married woman with five children, three of whom have graduated from school while two attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are house rent and school fees.

She operates a soft drinks sales business, selling in a shop to her neighbours and passersby. Jacinta faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to build her own home in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase fruit, flavours for making juices, and crates of sodas. She decided to join Yehu because not much collateral is demanded.

loans.use: To purchase  fruit,  flavours for making juices, and crates of sodas

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and rent bills.

She has operated a natural soft drinks sales business for the past two years, selling in a shop to her neighbours and passersby. Joyce faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to build her own house in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase a deep freezer for storing soft drinks. She decided to join Yehu because of its good reputation in society.

loans.use: To purchase a deep freezer for storing soft drinks

loans.name: Mwanahawa

texts.en:
Mwanahawa is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a retail shop for the past two years, selling to her neighbours and passersby. Mwanahawa faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to establish real estate property to generate income in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of rice, wheat flour, and sugar for sale. She decided to join Yehu because not much collateral is demanded.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of rice, wheat flour, and sugar for sale

loans.name: Khalila

texts.en:
Khalila is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school while the other one is still too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a retail shop for the last two years, selling to her neighbours and passersby. Khalila faces a major challenge of theft in her business. She hopes to build rental houses in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase cereals and sugar for her retail shop. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cereals and sugar for her retail shop

loans.name: Jerusha

texts.en:
Jerusha is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rented house that has electricity and piped water and her greatest monthly expenses are rent and school fees.

Jerusha has operated a shoe-making business for the past three years. She currently sells shoes wholesale, but her neighbors and passersby are also potential customers. Her major business challenge is theft. Jerusha joined Yehu to have access to loans. She is requesting 40,000 KES to purchase rubber, materials, and ornaments for making shoes. In the future, Jerusha hopes to establish a retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make shoes

loans.name: Phils

texts.en:
Phils is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rented house that has electricity and piped water and her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Phils has operated a beauty salon business for the past three years and her neighbors and passersby are potential customers. Her major business challenge is the change of seasons.  Phils decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase chemicals and hair weaves for her salon.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and hair weaves

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah is a married woman with five children, four of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and rent bills.

She has operated a retail shop for the past year, selling to her neighbours and passersby. Norah faces a major challenge of theft in her business. She hopes to build her own home in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sodas and packets of sweets for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sodas and packets of sweets for sale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a charcoal sales business for the past five years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Elizabeth faces a major challenge of theft in her business. She hopes to establish a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase 10 bags of charcoal for sale. She decided to join Yehu because of the good reputation of the organization in society.

loans.use: To purchase 10 bags of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Binitihamisi

texts.en:
Bintihamisi is married and has six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Bintihamisi operates a fish business, selling fish from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major business challenge is the change of seasons. Bintihamisi decided to join Yehu because of its good reputation. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to purchase a deep freezer to store fish. In the future, Bintihamisi hopes to establish a store to sell fresh fish.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer to store fish

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is clothing.

She has operated a vegetable stall business for the past year, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Fatuma faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to establish a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, fruit, and coconuts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase green vegetables, fruit, and coconuts

loans.name: Cosmas

texts.en:
Cosmas is a married man who owns a house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is  transport. 

He has operated a retail shop business for the past four years, selling to his neighbours and passersby. Cosmas faces a major challenge of theft in his business. He hopes to establish a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase sacks of sugar, beans and rice for resale. He decided to join Yehu because of its good reputation in the community.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of sugar, beans and rice for resale

loans.name: Claries

texts.en:
Claries is a single woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

She has operated a soft drink sales business for the past two years, selling in a shop to her neighbours and passersby. Claries faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to be self-reliant in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase a freezer for storing soft drinks for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer for storing soft drinks for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start a poultry business, purchase poultry feed and chicks.

loans.name: Yekaterina

texts.en:
Yekaterina, who is a married mother of two grown daughters and a son, works in the sphere of agriculture growing early spring vegetables, i.e. tomatoes and cabbage, in Velikaya Znamenka. The owner of three big spacious greenhouses, she grows 8,000 tall-growing tomatoes and 5,000 cabbage heads for retail sale in neighboring regions. Yekaterina has been in the trade for 25 years and has invested about 100,000 Grivnyas in this business. Her expenses on seeds and polyethylene film amount to 35,000 Grivnyas every year.

Yekaterina has six small greenhouses for seedlings requiring separate and very very costly heating. She is therefore requesting a 10,000 Grivnya loan to construct a separate new greenhouse for seedlings. She is planning to use the money to install a boiler unit in the greenhouse as well. There are basically no other employment options in this predominantly agricultural region of Ukraine which is why Yekaterina’s business is a stable source of income for her and her family.

loans.use: To construct a greenhouse for seedlings

loans.name: Vitalyi

texts.en:
Vitalyi is married with two daughters. He is a farmer from Kamenka, where he grows tomatoes and radishes in two big greenhouses. Every year, Vitalyi plants at least 4,000 tall-growing tomatoes. He started this venture 10 years ago. He has already invested about 80,000 Grivnyas in this business. His annual expenses for seeds and polyethylene film amount to 15,000 Grivnyas  

Vitalyi is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to purchase a land lot to expand his farming venture. He was planning to buy land property last summer. However, much needed remodeling in the house consumed all his savings and they couldn’t afford to buy land. Next year, Vitalyi is planning to construct a new greenhouse at the purchased land lot.

loans.use: To purchase a land lot

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with six children all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and electricity bills.

She has operated a natural  juice sales business for the past year, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Mwanasha faces a major challenge of seasonality of fruits for making natural juices. She hopes to open a retail shop in the future.

With the loan in the amount of Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase fruit for making natural juices and flavourings. She decided to join Yehu because of its good reputation in the community.

loans.use: To purchase fruit and flavourings to make natural juices

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To open a soft drinks shop and purchase crates of sodas

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a beauty salon for the past two years; neighbours and passersby are her potential customers. Amina faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to build another beauty salon in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase hair weaves and pay for her business license. She decided to join Yehu because of its good reputation in the community.

loans.use: To purchase hair weaves and pay for business license

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and house rent.

She has operated a coconut-selling business for the past three years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Fatuma faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to construct a permanent house in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase a plot to construct her house. She decided to join Yehu because of its good reputation in society.

loans.use: To purchase a plot to construct her house.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and electricity. 

She has operated a beauty salon for the past year. Neighbors and passersby are her potential customers. Elizabeth faces the major challenge of theft in her business. She hopes to establish a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase packets of hair weaves and chemicals for her beauty shop. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase packets of hair weaves and chemicals for her beauty shop.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. 

She has operated a business of selling tablecloths for the past 10 years, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. Elizabeth faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the month of January to May the demand for tablecloths is low while during festive season the demand for table cloths is very high. She hopes to be a wholesale supplier of tablecloths in the future. 

With the Kshs 10,000, she wants to purchase 10 pieces of tablecloths for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase 10 pieces of  tablecloths for resale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with five children, three of whom attend school. The others have already graduated from school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a green grocery business for over 20 years, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. Jane faces the major challenge of price fluctuation of products in her business. During the month of January to August the price for vegetables is low while during holiday season the price is high. She hopes to open a big cereal shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes and potatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes and potatoes.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a married man with seven children. Five of his children attend school, while the other two have graduated. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food. 

Wilson operates a hawking business, selling biscuits and sweets from door to door to his neighbors and to shopkeepers. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. With his KES 30,000 loan he wants to purchase a motorcycle and start a motorcycle business. He hopes to purchase a light transport van in the future.

Wilson decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle and start a motorcycle business

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a single woman with two children, both of whom have graduated from school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Margaret operates a second-hand business, selling clothes, hand bags and shoes in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. She has been in business for nine years, but seasonality is a major challenge. Demand is high during the holiday season, but low during the other months.  

Margaret decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business. With this KES 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase more clothes, materials, handbags and shoes for sale. She hopes to establish another boutique in the future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes, materials, handbags and shoes for sale

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:

Alexander has operated a vegetable-selling business for over seven years, selling wholesale to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. 

He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business. With his KES 40,000 loan he wants to purchase tomatoes, bananas and potatoes for sale. He hopes to purchase a pick-up van and open a cereal shop in the future.

Arlyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the first loan taken out by Arlyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:

She has operated a Khanga’s (African garments) selling business for the past two years, selling from door to door. Her potential business is from customers and neighbours. Saumu faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation incurred when moving from door to door. She hopes to become a wholesale supplier in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of Khanga’s for sale. She decided to join Yehu because of its simple procedures to join.

loans.use: To purchase a  water tap.

loans.name: Mwanamgeni

texts.en:
Mwanamgeni is a married woman with four children. Two of whom attend school while two graduated from school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She has operated a food stall selling business for over ten years, selling at the market and from home to her neighbours and passersby. Mwanamgeni faces a major challenge of seasonality. During rainy season the number of customers that turn up is low. She hopes to establish a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase stock of food staff and kitchen utensils. She decided to join Yehu because of no legal requirements.

loans.use: To purchase stock of food staff and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Chum

texts.en: Chum S. is a 48-year-old married woman and a local villager living in a medium-sized home with family members in Kompong Tom Province. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She and her husband use this land to grow vegetable. This couple has eight children and all of them are single. The five of them are working in different jobs. Chum S. has also built a pigpen behind her house where she raises many pigs to earn a living. Because the pig-raising business is a very profitable one for Chum S. and her family, she has requested a loan in order to buy additional feed and piglets to rise for sale during the period when pork is commanding the highest price.

loans.use: To buy additional feed and piglets to rise for sale.

loans.name: Rhodah

texts.en:
Rhoda is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is transport.

She has operated a clothes selling business going door to door, selling to her neighbours and passersby. Rhoda faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand and become a wholesaler of clothes.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase a bale of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of no harassments of clients.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Some people tend to migrates to different places even abroad to seek for a greener pasture. There are people who earned a big amount and has an investment but there are some who are not successful and later they only found out the fortune that they looked for is in their own place. That’s what happened to Jocelyn M., one of the active members of ASHI Antique North Branch. She is from Caridad, Culasi, Antique Philippines, she is already 41 years old and a single businesswoman. She is living with her elder brother Johny M., a fisherman.

Before her life in ASHI, she was experienced work in another country. She doesn’t have any comment for her employer because they treat her as their family. Her salary was only enough for the needs of the family until she decided to go back here in Philippines without any savings. She decided to join ASHI last 2002.

At very start, she has been wise in utilizing her capital for her business, with her first loan in ASHI amounted to Php.5,000.00, she started to put a small variety store in their community. Little by little her business is improving and she earned it. Her income from this business really helps her to sustain her basic needs and to invest in some equipment like refrigerator and television.

As her loan increases, her project is also improving. Her variety store is expanding and she almost sell grocery items in there. She also put up small refreshment near her store. 

As of now she wanted to repair the store so that it is convenient and more comfortable to the costumers and she is now proposing Php.25,000.00 for her next loan to realize these dream. 

She is aspiring that someday, she will become financially stable so that she could also help her nephews and relatives.

loans.use: Refreshment and Variety Store

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:

She has operated a food staff selling business for over ten years, selling to her neighbours and passersby. Asha faces a major challenge of delayed payments by creditors in her business. She hopes to own a clothes selling stall in the future. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase stock of food staff and kitchen utensils. She decided to join Yehu because of no legal formalities required.

loans.use: To purchase stock of food staff and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Satelital Group

texts.es:
Verónica es directora de una marca de productos de belleza en este trabajo ha encontrado su independencia y estabilidad económica ahora ella depende de su trabajo fue por medio de  una amiga que aprendió todo sobre belleza y la venta de los productos que ofrece, actualmente  maneja a 62 personas que están a su cargo a las que supervisa,  pero no descuida  a sus propios clientes  quienes siempre le compran sus productos de este modo sus ganancias son mas productivas y así  ayuda a su esposo en la manutención del hogar y el pago del colegio de sus hijos. El mayor sueño para ella es tener su casa propia sabe que con mucho esfuerzo lo podrá lograr muy pronto, su préstamo le servirá para comprar productos de belleza esta época es una buena inversión por que muchos buscan regalos para sus familiares y amigos, por otro lado ella es miembro del grupo “SATELITAL” que esta formado por 07 socias en su mayoría vecinas y amigas del mismo lugar.
 
* Veronica es la 1ra de la foto viste jean y polo negro.
texts.en:
Verónica is the director of a brand of beauty products. Through this job she has found independence and economic stability. She now depends on her job. It was through a friend that she learned everything about beauty and selling the products that she offers. She currently manages 62 people and supervises them. However, she always takes care of her own clients who always buy from her—that way she earns more. 

She helps her husband with the household expenses and their children’s’ school fees.  Her greatest dream is to have her own house. She knows that with much hard work, she can achieve this soon. 

She will use her loan to buy beauty products. This season is a good time to invest because many people look for gifts for their family members and friends. She is a member of the “Satelital” group, which is made up of 7 members, the majority f whom are friends from the same neighborhood.

*Verónica is the first one in the photo, wearing jeans and a black shirt.

loans.use: To buy beauty products

loans.name: Ngoun

texts.en: Ngoun L. is a 61-year-old farmer who lives in Kompong Tom Province Ngoun L. is married to Nao Roun, age 60. This couple, who work together in the farming business, has given birth to three children: one of whom is single and two are married. One of her daughter earns her living by selling some items in her community. Her products are fast foods, soft drink, shampoo, and plastic goods.  Ngoun L. is concerned that her core income in her family comes from her daughter’s business. Therefore, Ngoun L. will use her loan for her daughter to purchase additional products such as fast food, soft drink, and other necessary items for selling and to hire a domestic laborer to cultivate the rest of her farmland.

loans.use: To purchase additional products such as fast food, soft drink, and other necessary items for selling and to hire a domestic laborer to cultivate the rest of her farmland.

loans.name: Plang

texts.en:
Plang S., 24 years old, owns a small shop in the local market where she sells soft drinks and food. She typically makes around $5 in profit each day to ensure that her family has a comfortable living. She has been married for some years to Chorn Koerun, 35, a local farmer, and they have only one child who still lives under their roof. 

Plang S.’s husband wishes to buy cashews in bulk from other villagers who live in and around in his community at a low cost in order to sell them to make a profit. Plang S. has decided to seek a loan on Kiva as capital for her husband to buy cashews in bulk to sell later when the price increases.

loans.use: To buy cashews in bulk to sell  later when the price increases

loans.name: Ma. Flora

texts.en:
Ma. Flora S. is from the village of New Tambo, Katipunan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 48 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. Ma. Flora operates a family member's business in the services sector, primarily doing motorcycle repair in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for 10 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2006, Ma. Flora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Ma. Flora is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional accessories needed for motorcycle repair. This will be the 11th loan taken out by Ma.Flora from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Mariam

Mariam is a married woman who lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has operated a retail shop for over one year, selling to her neighbours and passersby. Mariam faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand and prosper in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for her retail shop. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to uplift her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Doña Maribel tiene 48 años de edad, localizado en casa de habitación zona # 2 de Nueva Guinea, es Comerciante desde hace 4 años, se dedica a la venta de ropa americana y nacional, tanto en su casa como a Domicilio, donde entrega a su clientela el producto a sus casas; no solo en la Ciudad, sino tambien en las comunidades aledañas de Nueva Guinea y asi de esta manera hacer mas efectiva sus ventas y conocer las carateristicas de sus clientes.  

Solicita su crédito, para  efectuar compra de mercaderia de productos y aumentar su inventario en su Pequeño Negocio de esta forma mejorar la atención de los clientes que demandan más diversificación de productos.  

Su mayor sueño es establecer una Tienda en la Ciudad y brindar mejor atencion a su clientela, a la vez desea tener salud siempre y que Diocito no la desampare.
texts.en:
Maribel is 48 years old and lives in zona # 2 (district 2) in Nueva Guinea.  She has been a saleswoman for 4 years.  She sells American and national clothes both from her home and at other people's homes where she delivers her products to her customers.  She does this both in the city and also in neighboring communities.  In this way, she makes her sales more effective and gets to know her customers.

Maribel is requesting a loan to buy merchandise and increase the inventory of her small business.  This will enable her to improve her service to her customers who are requesting a wider range of products.

Maribel's greatest dream is to set up a store in the city and provide her customers with a better service.  She would also like to enjoy good health and hopes that God never forsakes her.

loans.use: To buy American and national clothes to sell

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie P. is from the village of New Tambo. She is 52 years old. Virgie is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Virgie owns and operates a general store, selling different kinds of goods to local community members. Virgie has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately PHP1,500 a month for these activities.

In 2006, Virgie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virgie has successfully repaid a previous loan of PHP 3,500 from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Virgie is requesting a new loan of PHP 4,000, which will also be used to purchase additional goods for her business. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Virgie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods for her business

loans.name: Edmund0

texts.en:
Edmund0 J. is from the village of Maluno Sur, Benito, Soliven. He is 44 years old. Edmund0 is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Edmund0 owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting corn for sale. Edmund0 has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Edmund0 joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edmund0 is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Edmund0 from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Crecer Group

texts.es:
El grupo “CRECER” esta conformado por 11 miembros, mercedes es L. presidenta del grupo elL. es una mujer muy trabajadora durante mucho tiempo solo se dedico a su casa pero debido a su separación tuvo que encontrar L. manera D. ganarse L. vida  ya que tenia 03 hijos que mantener ellos fueron su inspiración para salir adelante elL. recordó que cuando trabajaba como enfermera siempre le ofrecían productos  diversos y que mucha gente los consumía es así que perdiendo el miedo elL. empezó hacer lo mismo  entre sus amigas y familiares quienes le empezaron a comprar también incursiono vendiendo diversos productos por campañas en época escolar ofrece uniformes,zapatos,medias etc. Ahora esta abocada en L. campaña naviD.ña  su préstamo lo usara para comprar juguetes tiene muchos pedidos D. sus clientas gracias a su trabajo pueD. cubrir los gastos esenciales D. su familia además D. sentirse bien por que trabajando ha encontrado estabilidad emocional para el futuro quiere acondicionar el garaje D. su casa para poner una librería bazar ese es un sueño que desea alcanzar muy pronto,  sabe que lo podrá lograr por que cuenta con el apoyo D. sus hijos.

* Mercedes es L. 5ta parada viste polo negro.
texts.en:
The 'Crecer' group has 11 members.  Mercedes is the group's president.  She is a very hard-working woman.  For a long time she has looked after her household alone.  When she separated she had to find a way of making a living since she had 3 children to support.  They were her inspiration to get ahead.  She remembers that when she used to work as a nurse people were always offering her different products and many people bought them.  So, conquering her fear, Mercedes began to do the same with her friends and family members who began to buy from her.  She started selling different products according to the season.  During the back-to-school season she would offer uniforms, shoes, tights, etc.  Now the Christmas season is here her loan will be used to buy toys.

Mercedes has a lot of orders from her customers and, thanks to her work, she can cover her family's main expenses.  She also feels good about herself because by working she has found emotional stability.  In the future, she would like to adapt the garage at her house so that she can set up a book store / stationery store.  This is a dream that she would like to fulfil very soon.  She knows that she can achieve her goal because she has the support of her children.

Mercedes is the person in the picture wearing a black top.

loans.use: To buy toys

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa C. is from the village of Villaflor, Oroquieta City. She is 49 years old. Elsa is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Elsa owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elsa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa is requesting a loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the first loan taken out by Elsa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Maria Felix

texts.es:
Maria Felix tiene de 40 años de edad, vive en la colonia los Angeles en el Municipio de Nueva Guinea, junto a su esposo que le ayuda en las actividades diarias de la Finca y su hijo Roberto de 18 años de igual forma realiza labores Ganaderas junto a sus padres; siendo esta actividad ganadera la principal fuente de ingresos de la Sra. P. quien posee una finca en  comarca El Almacen de Nueva Guinea, desde hace 10 año, laborando arduamente para crecer cada dia y llegar a obtener mayores ingresos y asi cumplir con sus obligaciones de pago. 

Por lo que solicita su primer crédito para realizar infraestructura de un corral galera y asi mejorar las condiciones que requiere su unidad de producción,  de esta manera obtener un ordeño limpio y saludable, 

Maria Felix sueña que sus animales se mantengan sanos y cada vez le generen mayor peso y por ende mejorar sus ingresos, asi tambien lucha por el bienestar de su Familia.
texts.en:
Maria Felix is 40 years old.  She lives in the Los Angeles residential development in the town of Nueva Guinea together with her husband, who helps her in her daily activities on the farm, and her son, 18 year-old Robert, who also works in livestock farming together with his parents.  Livestock farming is the main source of income for Mrs P. who has owned a farm in the El Almacen region of Nueva Guinea for 10 years.  She works hard every day so that she can grow and make better profits and thereby meet her payment obligations.

Maria Felix is requesting her first loan to build the infrastructure of a cow pen and shed so that she can improve the conditions of her production unit and carry out a clean and healthy milking of her animals.

Maria Felix dreams of her animals remaining healthy and putting on more weight, thereby improving her profits.  She also works hard for the well-being of her family.

loans.use: To buy materials to build a cow pen and shed on her farm

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mao M., 38, lives with her young child in Kompong Tom Province, Cambodia. She was married but she divorced her husband years ago. Mao M. is a hard-working woman who earns her living by selling Khmer noodle in her community, and she makes an income on average of $2 per day. This rice harvesting season, Mao M. wants to find more profit to support her family's daily expenses. That is why Mao M. is seeking for a loan to purchase many sacks of rice to store. She will sell them when the rice commands the highest price.

loans.use: To purchase many sacks of rice to store for sale at a later date

loans.name: Mjeni

texts.en:
Mjeni is a single woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a firewood-sales business for the past four years, selling retail to her neighbours and passersby. Mjeni faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to expand in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of firewood for resale

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome J. is from the village of Central Barangay,Dipolog City. She is 40 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Salome operates a family member's business in the food sector, making & selling delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for one year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Salome joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed for her 'carenderia'. Salome is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional ingredients for her cooked food vending business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Salome from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her 'carenderia' (cafe)

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael C. is from the village of Maluno Sur, Benito Soliven. He is 30 years old. Michael is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Michael owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Michael has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Michael joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Michael is requesting a loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Michael from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie E. is from the village of Campo 4, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 57 years old. Rosemarie is married and has 3 adult children. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Rosemarie has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 9450 PHP a month for these activities.

Rosemarie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Rosemarie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

location.town: Campo 4, Ramon MAgsaysay Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Florame

texts.en:
Florame is from the village of Sta. Filomena. She is 63 years old, married and has 3 adult children. Florame operates a family member's business in the agriculture sector, raising and selling ornamental plants in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2007, Florame joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her ornamental plants. Florame is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fertilizers, pesticides and flower pots for her business. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Florame from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers, pesticides and flower pots

loans.name: Fausto Jose

texts.es:
Fausto de 43 años de edad vive con su esposa Grace Gutierrez quien es ama de Casa y sus hijos quienes le ayudan en las actividades de la Finca, en la Comarca la Tigra, el Jicaro del municipio de El Almendro, es un productor y ganadero. Este señor recibe ingresos por venta de productos de su finca, siendo propietario de su unidad de producción, con esfuerzo propio ha logrado lo que ahora tiene, ya que es una persona muy trabajadora y de buenas costumbres, 
Quiere seguir progresando por lo que solicita su primer financiamiento mediante Kiva para invertirlo en mejorar su vivienda la que dará mejores condiciones a su núcleo familia. 

Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos sean personas de bien y brindarles mayor comodidad en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Fausto is 43 years old and lives with his wife Grace Gutierrez, who is a housewife, and his children who help him with the work on his farm in la Tigra, el Jicaro district of the town of El Almendro.  He is a producer and livestock farmer.  This gentleman makes income by selling products from his farm as he is the owner of his production unit.  Through his own hard work he has achieved all that he now has since he is a very hard-working man of good habits.

Fausto would like to continue making progress which is why he is requesting his first loan through Kiva to invest in improving his home which will provide his immediate family with better living conditions.

Fausto's greatest dream is for his children to be good people and to provide them with better comfort in their home.

loans.use: To buy building materials to improve his home

loans.name: Pen

texts.en: The persons shown in the picture are Mrs. Pen S. who has been living in Kompong Tom Province. Pen S. makes a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house. She raises them both for offspring and for slaughter. Her husband has been earning a living for many years by climbing the palm trees behind his house, and making a profit of approximately $2 per day. They have six children, three of whom are single and the other two are married. Unluckily, her pigs are not big enough due to lack of food. To help solve this problem, Mrs. Pen S. has requested a loan that she will use to buy many sacks of pig feed to fatten her pigs. She will use rest of the loan for her husband to buy a ladder for climbing the palm trees.

loans.use: To buy many sacks of pig feed to fatten her pigs. She will use rest of the loan for her husband to buy a ladder for climbing the palm trees.

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
El productor Pedro Pablo de 40 años de edad, vive con su esposa que es ama de casa, el es dueño de 50 mzs, las cuales están en buenas condiciones, localizada en la colonia Naciones Unida en Nueva Guinea, le brinda buen manejo fitosanitario a su inventario ganadero, su ganado lo vende a comerciante de la comunidad, y asi de esta manera obtiene sus ingresos para seguir en el mercado de la Produccion a la vez recibe otros ingresos por venta de leche y producción de cultivo de la finca granos básico, raices y tuberculos.  

Solicita a la institución de AFODENIC mediante Kiva financiamiento, con el objetivo de  realizar compra de 3  ternero desarrollo.  

Su mayor proposito es poder llegar a ser un alto Ganadero, gozar de buena salud y tener una Familia Digna y unida.
texts.en:
Pedro Pablo is 40 years old.  He lives with his wife who is a housewife.  He owns 50 mz (approximately 87 acres) of land which are in good condition.  His land is located in the Naciones Unidas subdivision of Nueva Guinea.  He looks after the health of his livestock inventory very well.  He sells his livestock to a trader in the community and in that way makes his income to continue in the production market.  He also makes income by selling milk and growing crops on his farm such as basic grains, root vegetables and tubers.

Pedro Pablo is requesting a Kiva loan through AFODENIC so that he can buy 3 growing calves.  His greatest goal is to become a top livestock farmer, to enjoy good health and to have a decent and united family.

loans.use: To buy growing calves

loans.name: Emie

texts.en:
Emie S. is from the village of Lapinig, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte. She is 57 years old. Emie is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Emie owns & operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector running a furniture making business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making & selling bamboo walls (Amakan) to local businesses and community members. Emie has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Emie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. Emie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Emie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:

She has been operating a stall selling food for the past four years.  Her potential customers neighbours and passersby. Alice faces a major challenge in delayed payments by creditors. She hopes to prosper in the future. 

With the Kshsh 40,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar

While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Imelda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Imelda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Paterna

Paterna A. is from the village of Mitugas,Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old. Paterna is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Paterna owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector runing a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as coffee, juice, sugar, shampoo, soap, toothpaste, and other items in the local community. Paterna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Paterna is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Paterna from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.name: Sipriana

texts.es:
Doña Sipriana de 55 años de edad, vive junto a su Esposo Lino Amador y sus hijos en Colonia Puerto Principe de Nueva Guinea, su principal actividad es la ganaderia, donde ha crecido por tanto conoce bien el manejo de su hato Ganadero siendo esta la principal fuente de ingresos, ya que realiza venta de leche y comercializa  ternero de Engorde,  es una mujer con principios, responsable y enprendedora, lucha con su Familia para obtener comodida y sobre todo salud.  

Solicita su crédito a Kiva para realizar compra de ternero desarrollo, asi aumentar su inventario ganadero y a la vez obtener mayor ingresos.  

Su sueño es que sus Hijos manejen bien su Capital y que gocen de buena salud que no les falte el pan de cada dia.
texts.en:
Sipriana is 55 years old.  She lives together with her husband, Lino Amador, and her children in the Puerto Principe subdivision of Nueva Guinea.  Her main business activity is livestock farming.  She has grown in her business and knows very well how to manage her herd of cattle.  This is her main source of income.  She sells milk and calves for fattening.  She is a principled, responsible and enterprising woman who works hard with her family to obtain comfort and, above all, good health.

She is requesting a Kiva loan to buy a growing calf so that she can increase her livestock inventory and make more profits.

Sipriana's dream is for her children to manage their capital well, for them to enjoy good health and for them never to go hungry.

loans.use: To buy a growing calf

loans.name: Men

texts.en:
Mr. Men M. (in the photo) is 50 years old and his wife, Mrs. Ream Mom, is 45 years old.  They have been married since 1988 and have four children  – two sons and two daughters. Two work in a garment factory and other two are in school. The family lives in a small village along National Road number five, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Ream is a rice farmer.  Men is a fisherman and construction worker. He also assists his wife in the farming business. He is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorized hand tiller for use on their rice farm.

loans.use: To purchase motorized hand tiller for rice farm

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en:
Mrs. Samnang T. (pictured here) is 30 years old and her husband, Mr. Thy Em, is 31 years old.  They have been married since 2005 and have one young daughter. They are living in a small village along National Road No. 5, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Samnang is a tailor. Her husband is an English teacher. She is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle for commuting

loans.name: Emeteria

texts.en:
Emeteria A. is from the village of Tonggo, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 62 years old. Emeteria is married and has 8 adult children. To make a living, Emeteria owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting bananas for sale. Emeteria has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Emeteria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emeteria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Emeteria is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Emeteria from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.name: Yean

texts.en: Yean L. has been spending her life cultivating crops. She is now married and has four children, three of whom are married and one is single. Her husband works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. Growing crops is an annual action with which she has had great success. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. Currently, Yean L. lacks money to help her son pay for his driving license fee. That is the reason why Yean L. would like a loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To pay for driving license fee for son

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Ramona B. is from the village of Poblacion, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 61 years old. Ramona is widowed and has ten adult children. To make a living, Ramona owns and operates a manufacturing business. The main source of income for the business comes from making and selling nipa to the local community members. Ramona has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ramona joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ramona has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Ramona is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This loan will be Ramona's third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.
