loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco Báez de 71 años de edad, vive con su esposa Daysi Calero en la Colonia el Serrano, donde tiene su finca con buenas condiciones técnicas para el desarrollo de su inventario ganadero, realiza actividades pecuarias, agricolas y sobre todo Ganadera, a pesar de ser una persona de la tercera edad se dedica con esmero y sabe cuidar y manejar su inventario y sus bienes; este señor cuenta con Liderezgo en la Zona por ser bien querido y ademas tiene una hija (Concepcion B. Calero) la cual es profesional, labora para Finca Nicaragua como asesor de credito, por tanto en conjunto coolaboran con los gastos Familiares y de esta manera ha venido creciendo en su invetario; Don Francisco ha obtenido creditos de parte de nuestra Institucion los cuales ha cancelado en tiempo y forma y a la vez agradece estos Financiamiento por que le han servido de mucho en su vida.  

Solicita desimo crédito, a la institución de AFODENIC mediente Kiva  para compra de ternero desarrollo.  

Y Sueña con ser una que su Hija tenga su propia familia y gocen de buena Salud.
texts.en:
Francisco Báez is 71 and lives with his wife Daysi Calero in the Colonia el Serrano, where he has a farm that is ripe for the technical development of his inventory of cattle, pigs, and crops.  Although he is a senior citizen, he works hard and knows how to care for and manage his livestock and goods. He is a Leader of the Zone because he is so well-liked.  He also has a daughter, Concepcion B. Calero, who is a professional who works for Finca Nicaragua as a credit assessor.  They all cooperate and share the family expenses, and in this way have been able to build up the farm's inventory.  Don Francisco has obtained previous credits from microfinance partner AFODENIC, which he has paid off promptly and which have helped him greatly.

This is his tenth credit with AFODENIC through Kiva.   He will use it to buy development land.  He hopes his daughter will have her own family one day and that they will all enjoy good health.

loans.use: Compra de Terneros de Desarrollo

loans.name: Sreypao

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreypao M. (pictured above) is 34 years old. She and her husband, Mr. Sophal Oem, 40 years old, live in a suburb about 20 kilometers away from Phnom Penh. They have two daughters.

Sreypao is a garment factory worker. Her husband is a motorbike repairman; he operates the business at home. Sreypao is asking for her first loan of $600 to buy spare motorbike parts for her husband’s business. She will also use part of the loan to dig a well for the use of the family.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for her husband’s motorbike-repairing business, and to dig a well for family use.

loans.name: Vanthan

texts.en:
Mr. Vanthan K. (in the photo) is 32 years old. He and his wife, Mrs. Yoirn Chan, 29 years old, live in a village along National Road Number Five, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have two daughters.

Vanthan is a rice farmer. He also drives a motor taxi when not on the farm. His wife is a garment factory worker.

He is asking for his first loan of $700 to purchase a water pumping machine and to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain his rice farm.

loans.use: To purchase a water pumping machine and to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain his rice farm.

loans.name: Los Girasoles Del Algodonal Group

texts.es:
Rosita tiene 33 años es parte del grupo “GIRASOLES DEL ALGODONAL”  cuando se inicio el grupo ella empezaba a incursionar en el mundo D. las ventas fue una representante D. una marca que la motivo para independizarse económicamente así fue alcanzando mas experiencia y pudo encontrar clientes nuevos a quienes ofrecía los productos que vendía como perfumes, talcos, lociones y maquillaje, en sus momentos libres también ayuda a su esposo que se dedica a la confección D. zapatos, con el tiempo rosita quiere tener un lugar donD. mostrar todos los productos que venD. para D. esa manera aumentar su clientela y sus ganancias, gracias a su trabajo ayuda a su esposo a solventar algunos gastos D. la casa, en esta oportunidad el dinero D. su préstamo le servirá para la compra D. productos surtidos  que ofrecerá esta campaña naviD.ña ya que son muy requeridos por estas fechas.

*Rosita es la 3ra sentada viste polo celeste.
texts.en:
Rosita is 33 years old and a member of the “Girasoles del Algodonal” group.  When she joined the group, she was just starting to break into the world of sales.  She was a sales rep for a brand which motivated her to become financially independent.  She gained more and more experience and managed to find new customers to whom she could offer the products she sold such as perfumes, talcum powders, lotions and make-up.

In her spare time, Rosita helps her husband who makes shoes.  Over time, she would like to have a place where she can display all the products that she sells so that she can increase her number of customers and her profits.  Thanks to her work, she helps her husband to cover some of their household expenses.  She will use the money from this loan to buy products with which to stock her business and which she will offer to her customers during the Christmas period since her products are very much in demand at this time of year.

In the photo, Rosita is the third person along (sitting down) and is wearing a light-blue top

loans.use: To buy beauty products

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: The man shown in the picture is Mr. Chea K., 47.  He is a fisherman. He usually fishes eight hours a day in and around the Tunle Sap River.  He catches around 8 kilos of fish per day and sells them in bulk to his customers, who are retail sellers in the market. His wife’s name is Vai Phaiy.  She is 46 and works with him in the fishing business. The couple is blessed with six children  –  five are single and the one is married and living in in another house.  Mr. Chea K. will use his loan to purchase nets and other fishing implements so he can catch more fish.  With the remainder of the funds, he will use to repair his house.

loans.use: To purchase nets & fishing implements, and to repair house

loans.name: Rosita

To make a living, Rosita owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing rattan furniture making services to local community members. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rosita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rosita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.name: Noun

texts.en:
Fishing is the most vital part of 26-year-old Noun M.’s daily work. She and her husband have been working on a fishing boat on the river for more than four years. This couple wake up every morning, drive their boat toward the middle of the river, and then fish. After the fishing is done, they hurry to bring their fish to the market and sell to their regular buyers on credit. They collect their M. after their buyers sell all of the fish that they bought. Noun M. and her husband support their only child, who is enrolled in school. 

This approaching fishing season, the lakes are full of fish but the family is lacking tools for fishing. Therefore, Noun M. is applying for a loan to purchase additional fishing equipment in order to support her business activities.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment

loans.name: María Ilda

texts.es:
María Ilda tiene 55 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su familia en el distrito D. San José, una zona pesquera que pertenece a la provincia D. Lambayeque y que se encuentra situada a más D. veinte minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio, allí suele ofrecer a sus clientes productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes a precios razonables y brindando una buena atención, adicionalmente ofrece en venta artículos D. oficina y útiles escolares durante la temporada escolar. Su negocio tiene bastante acogida en la zona y le sirve para ayudar a su esposo a sacar adelante a su familia.

Ella desea ampliar su negocio para poder responder D. mejor modo a su demanda, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su meta.
texts.en:
María Ilda is 55 years old.  She is married and lives with her family in San José district, a fishing area in Lambayeque province which is more than twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

María Ilda has a small grocery store in her home where she offers her customers essentials and groceries at reasonable prices and provides them with good service.  She also sells office supplies and school supplies during the school season.  Her business is quite popular in the area and it allows her to help her husband to get the family ahead.

María Ilda would like to expand her business so that she can better respond to demand.  She is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to help her achieve her goal.

loans.use: To buy products to expand the small grocery store she has in her home

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 52 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a un hijo de 16 años de edad en el caserío El Verde, una zona agrícola del distrito de Pítipo, zona situada en la provincia de Ferreñafe, a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace más de 10 años a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura, el cuenta con un pequeño terreno de cultivo en donde suele sembrar todo tipo de granos y cereales. Los ingresos que obtiene de estas actividades los utiliza para sacar adelante a su familia. En esta oportunidad ha sembrado maíz y se encuentra trabajando arduamente para sacar adelante su cultivo.

Jorge desea realizar labores de mantenimiento a su cultivo, para ello se ha propuesto adquirir fertilizantes, para realizar esta acción ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Jorge is 52 years old.  He is married and lives with his 16 year-old son in the village of El Verde, an agricultural area of Pítipo district, in Ferreñafe province, more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

Jorge has been working in agriculture for more than 10 years.  He has a small plot of land where he grows all kinds of grains and cereals.  He uses the profits that he makes from this business to get his family ahead.  On this occasion, he has grown corn and he is working hard to look after his crop.

Jorge would like to do some work toward maintaining his crops.  He would like to acquire some fertilizers and, in order to do this, he is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To maintain his corn crop

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José tiene 40 años de edad, es conviviente y reside junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en el Anexo Santa Rosa del Caserío Lagunas, una zona ubicada en el distrito de Mórrope, provincia de Lambayeque. La localidad se encuentra situada a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en la crianza y venta de animales desde hace diez años. El cría ovejas, patos, pavos y gallinas en algunos corrales ambientados cerca a su domicilio. Los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Esta actividad es la principal fuente de ingreso con la que sostiene a la economía de su familia, por ello trata de cuidarla del mejor modo posible.

José desea adquirir más animales y alimento balanceado para lograr que sus animales se desarrollen de mejor modo, asimismo desea brindar mantenimiento y algunas reparaciones a su vivienda. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
José is 40 years old.  He has a common-law marriage and lives with his wife and three children in Santa Rosa annex of the village of Lagunas, in Mórrope district, in Lambayeque province.  The village is more than one and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo.

José works raising and selling animals.  He has been doing this for ten years.  He raises sheep, ducks, turkeys and hens in some pens that he has near his home.  He feeds his animals grains and natural fodder and, when they have reached a good level of development, he offers them for sale to traders who usually visit the area where he lives.  This is the main source of income through which he supports his family financially.  For this reason, he takes care of his business as well as possible.

José would like to acquire more animals and balanced feed so that his animals develop better.  He would also like to maintain and make some repairs to his house.  To achieve his goal, he is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To acquire more animals and balanced feed so that his animals develop better

location.town: Anexo Santa Rosa - Lagunas - Mórrope - Lambayeque

loans.name: Sin's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of four low-income people who live in Siem Reap province. Sin K., age 25, has been selected to be the leader of the group. 

Sin K. is a ticket seller at private company in Siem Reap Province. Sin K. was married for many years, but she has been divorced from her husband for a few years. Sin K. has two kids who are still studying in school. Presently, Sin K. is not comfortable because her house often needs to be repaired. She would like a loan to repair her old house.

The other three borrowers include: 

Mrs. Lim V., a fish porter, who is asking for a loan to buy some pieces wood to repair her broken house.
Mrs. Uch R., who will use this loan to purchase a used motorbike to replace the old one.
Mrs. Sin P., who is asking for a loan to buy fishing equipment for her fishing business.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie A. is from the village of Mitugas,Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old. Elvie is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Elvie owns & operates a business venture in the services sector offering transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating a transport business. Elvie has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elvie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvie is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elvie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Yane

texts.es:
Yane tiene 26 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a su familia en el Caserío Santa Clara del distrito de Pítipo, una zona agrícola que se encuentra localizada en la provincia de Ferreñafe, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la ganadería desde hace cinco años. Ella cría vacas en algunos corrales ambientados cerca a su domicilio. Las alimenta de pastos naturales y extraen la leche que producen para comercializarla a un acopiador de la zona. Esta actividad le permite solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar al desarrollo económico de su familia.

Yane desea completar la suma de dinero que necesita para adquirir una nueva vaca, de modo que a futuro pueda percibir mas ingresos por sus ventas. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Yane is 26 years old.  She is single and lives with her family in the village of Santa Clara, in Pítipo district, an agricultural area in Ferreñafe province, one hour from the city of Chiclayo.

Yane has been working in livestock farming for five years.  She raises cows in some pens that she has near her home.  She feeds her cows natural fodder and she sells their milk to a trader in the area.  This activity allows her to cover her personal expenses and to support her family financially.

Yane needs to add to a sum of money she already has in order to buy a new cow so that in the future she can make more money for her sales.  To achieve her goal, she is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To add to a sum of money she already has in order to acquire a new cow

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. loans.name: María Virginia

texts.es:
María tiene 52 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su familia en el caserío Huaca de Barro del distrito de Mórrope, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque,  a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica  trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura junto a su esposo, ambos poseen un terreno de cultivo cerca a la zona en donde residen, allí ellos suelen sembrar granos y cereales. Los ingresos que perciben de estas actividades los utilizan para sacar adelante la economía de su familia.

Actualmente desean instalar un cultivo de maíz en su terreno, han realizado las labores de preparación y desean empezar a sembrar su plantación. Para adquirir los fertilizantes e insumos que necesitan y lograr su objetivo han creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
María is 52 years old.  She is married and lives with her family in the village of Huaca de Barro, in Mórrope district, an agricultural area in Lambayeque province, more than one hour from the city of Chiclayo.

María works in farming together with her husband.  They both own a plot of land near the area they live in.  There they grow grains and cereals.  They use the income that they make from this business to get their family ahead financially.

They would currently like to plant corn on their land.  They have already prepared the land and they would like to begin sowing.  In order to acquire the fertilizers and supplies that they need and achieve their goal, they are requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: Expenses of sowing and maintaining a corn crop

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina tiene 57 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en el sector Saltur del distrito D. Zaña, una zona agrícola situada aproximadamente a media hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en la crianza y venta D. animales desD. hace cinco años. Ella cría animales menores en algunos corrales ambientados cerca a su domicilio. Los alimenta D. granos y pastos naturales y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donD. resiD.. Esta actividad le permite ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento D. la economía D. su familia.

Alejandrina desea adquirir más animales y alimento balanceado para lograr que sus ventas aumenten y así obtener mayores ingresos. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 57 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and three children in Saltur sector of  Zaña district, an agricultural area located approximately half an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

Alejandrina has been raising and selling animals for five years.  She raises young animals in some pens that she has near her home.  She feeds them grains and natural fodder and when they have reached a good level of development, she offers them for sale to the traders who usually visit her area.  This business allows her to help her husband to financially support their family.

Alejandrina would like to acquire more animals and balanced feed in order to increase her sales and make more profits.  To achieve her goal, she is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To acquire more animals and balanced feed in order to increase her sales

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en: Chheng S. has been a farming businesswoman for a long time. She lives in the province of Kompong Cham. Since 1990 has owned and operated her farm and cultivates a rice crop, from which she earns a daily income. Chheng S., 36, is a married woman and she has given birth to four children. All of them are single. She has life partner with her husband who is employed as a building worker in his community. Chheng S. said that her husband always goes to his work place by taxi. He wants reduce the cost for traveling expenses. So, Chheng S. will use her loan for her husband to purchase a second hand motorbike in order to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a second hand motorbike for her husband to drive to work.

loans.name: Aun

texts.en: Aun K. is a 54-year-old, widowed who she currently lives in the province of Battambang. Her husband passed away for many years ago from illness. She is the mother of three children, all of whom are not married, and they still live with her under the same roof. Khen Kheng currently generates an income of approximately $3 per day by selling vegetables in the local market. One of her children makes a living as a motor taxi driver in the community and he always helps her pick up vegetables and drives her to the market place before he starts his business. Sadly, the motorbike  has broken down. Aun K. would like to request a loan for her son to buy a used motorbike to placing the broken one.

loans.use: To buy a used motorbike to replace her son's broken one.

loans.name: Oun

texts.en: Oun P. was born in 1988; she is a married woman and blessed with one child. Her child is a student in the local public school. Her husband, Vorn Saran, 29, is a local farmer who operates a farm which he got from his grandmother. Oun P. has built a pigpen behind her house where she raises many pigs to earn a living. Oun P.’s husband had planted rice and vegetable crops two months ago, but his crops are not growing well because they need more fertilizer. To remedy the situation, Oun P. would like a loan for her husband to buy sacks of fertilizer and seed for planting.

loans.use: To buy  sacks of fertilizer and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Huseyn

texts.ru: Хусенов Хусейн проживает в районе Вахдат. Ему 52 года. Женат. Имеет 4 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Хусейн имеет высшее незаконченное образование. Он печет самбусу и жарит пирожки для продажи. Арендует пекарню и тандур для выпекания самбусы. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 25 лет. Кредит берет для закупа лука, семян и угля. То есть он намерен запастись на зиму.
texts.en: H. Hussein lives in Vahdat.  He is 52 years old, married, and has four children.  His wife is a housewife.  Hussein did not finish college.  He makes sambusas (traditional pastries) and fried pies for sale.  He rents a bakery and tandoor to bake sambusas.    He has been doing this work for 25 years.  He is taking out a loan to buy onions, seeds and coal so that he can have a reserve for winter.

loans.use: buying onions, seeds and coal

loans.name: Rodel

texts.en:
This is Rodel D., 41, resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. He is married to Rosanna D., who works as a housekeeper, and together they manage the household and business. By the grace of God, Rodel has managed to support his children's schooling. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their every day expenses.

Rodel operates a variety store while managing their videoke ( a karaoke with a video showing the lyrics of the song being sung) and their motorized tricycle. They rent out the videoke on a 24-hour basis, while the tricycle enables them to get purchase and deliver their products. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go for to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Rodel earns income by getting supplies in wholesale price and selling them as single items.  His store is located adjacent to their house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of Php400 in sales every day.

To help Rodel continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php25, 000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 
 
Rodel dreams to be able to renovate their house soon and have his children finish their college education, with all of his work with the business. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand his product inventory

loans.name: Glory

texts.en:

To make a living, Glory owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Glory has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP when she sells one of her raised animals.

In 2006, Glory joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Glory has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Glory is requesting a new loan of 18000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Glory from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
This is Mary Ann M., a single young woman who, through her business, supports her family and their needs. She manages to look after her variety store and her electronic cellular phone loading station. These businesses enable her to continually provide income to her family.

Mary Ann operates a variety store and a loading station. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go for to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies in wholesale price and selling in piece rate.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php200 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php19, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Mary Ann hopes to be able to live a happy and abundant life, with all of her work with the business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her inventory

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Mrs. Virgilia B. is from the Barangay (village) of Dimaluna, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old and a widow. She is blessed with eight children, all of whom are now adults. To make a living, she is presently engaged in operating a sari-sari (variety) store business. She’s been engaged in this business for one year. At this time she is earning an amount of not less than $50 per month. 

In the year 2007, Virgilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virgilia, as a member of Paglaum MPC under the Regular Loan Program, is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. This will be her 2nd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting their basic needs, savings for future use, loan repayments and possible business expansions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma O. is from the village of Katipunan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental 7209. She is 40 years old. Vilma is married and has four school-aged children. loans.name: Annaliza's Group

texts.en:
Annaliza C., from the town of Sta. Maria, Cauayan City, is the 39-year-old group leader of a six-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Annaliza, who is married and has three school-aged children, makes a living from preparing and selling tocino (cured pork) and longganisa (pork sausages) in the local community. Engaged in her business for over four years, she earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Annaliza joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan from ASKI, she is now requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. This will be Annaliza's fourth loan from ASKI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

texts.en: Men Y., age 28, a resident of Kompong Tom Province, earns a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house. She raises them both for their offspring and for slaughter. loans.name: Rowaida

texts.en:
Rowaida is the mother of four daughters and two sons. Her husband is a construction worker. Rowaida earned her BA in Biology from the University of Jordan. She applied at many schools to teach but she has not had any luck being employed and with a big family she needs to find a job to help support her husband's taking care of the family.

Rowaida came to FATEN for a loan to equip a room in her house and to purchase items such as white-boards and chairs to start home-schooling students who need extra attention, as well as organizing private lessons.

Rowaida's brother in UAE currently helps her by sending her a small monthly allowance, which she will be able to replace once she starts teaching.

Rowaida appears in the picture above in FATEN's office.

loans.use: To equip a home-schooling room

Marilyn L. is from the village of Talahiron, Kibawe, Bukidnon. She is 55 years old. Marilyn is married and has 8 school-aged children. To make a living, Marilyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and raising pigs for sale. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marilyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Marilyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn P.'s main source of income comes from her direct sales and peanut butter vending in her community. She is 37 years old, married and has seven children. She is from the village of Upper Dicayas. Merlyn has been in her business for three years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2008, Merlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC which was used to purchase Avon products for her direct sales business. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials for peanut butter making. This will be her sixth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and to meet the daily needs of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for peanut butter

loans.name: Chhoeung

texts.en: The person shown in the picture is Chhoeung N. who lives in the province of Kompong Tom. Besides of farming business, she also raises a few pigs at her home. She is married to Bong Kong, age 40, who shares responsibility the family’s expense by fishing in the river around his house. This couple is blessed with three children; all of them are single and still under their roof at present. Chhoeung N. has a plowing machine for using on her farmland, and she can grow her rice crop at least twice time a year. Chhoeung N. now will use her loan for purchasing a few sacks of fertilizer her crop growing well, and the rest of fund uses to buy gasoline to fulfill her plowing machine in order to start plowing on her farmland for doing dry-season rice-field.

loans.name: Ashkhen

texts.en:
Ashkhen D. was born in 1961; she is a widow and lives alone in Azatamut village, Ijevan area. Ashkhen's three daughters are already married and now she has four grandchildren. 

Since 2002 Ashkhen has been running her own shop, where she sells food, household goods and children's clothes. She says it's very hard to manage the business single-handedly, but she doesn't complain about it, and Ashkhen is very proud that she was able to bring up three children, educate them and organize their weddings thanks to her business.

Before the New Year's holidays, Ashkhen wants to increase her shop assortment and she is asking for a 250,000 Armenian drams loan to buy children's winter jackets and candy for her shop.

This is Ashkhen's second loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: To buy children's winter jackets and candy for her shop

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Altantsetseg P. is 55 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her son attends university while her daughter is currently working after graduating from university. 

Altantsetseg and her husband operate a retail meat business in their town. They began their business in 2000 after living in a small town in their province between 1972 and 2000. After 10 years of operation, they have built up a stable operation and have managed to establish themselves in the business community. At first, they slaughtered and sold their own livestock at the local market. Soon, they started to purchase livestock from herders and sell the meat as retailers after slaughtering the livestock. 

Their monthly average sales income has reached to a level of 390,000 MNT. They plan to purchase a large number of livestock in order to sell the meat at retail prices for upcoming winter months. Altantsetseg says, "All I want is to provide my children's educational fees. My son is a very intelligent and an honored student but his tuition fees keep increasing year by year which is very difficult for me to afford. My dream is to open my own shop in the future." She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more meat to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more meat to sell

texts.en: Seymur S. is a 25 year-old-man who lives in the center of Saatli region. Seymur just got married. He is a very happy man. In 2007 he opened his own fruit and vegetable stand. texts.en:
Eva M. lives in the town of Western Pob., Lopez Jaena. She is 23 years old and leads a two-person GDMPC loan group. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, members are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Eva is married and has one school-aged child. She makes a living by running a small store where people buy items they need daily such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste. She has been in this business for over more than five years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month from her work.

Earlier this year, Eva joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is applying for a loan, her first, for 10,000 PHP to buy additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and M. Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell

Earlier this yerar, Liza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is applying for a loan, her first, for 5,000 PHP, to buy additional items to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to continue expanding it. 

About HSPFI:

loans.name: Madina

texts.en: Madina A. is a 51 year-old-woman, who lives on Shikhlinski Street of the Imishli region. She is married and a mother to one daughter. Madina sells meat and dairy from her cattle-breeding business, which she started in 2006. She is the only breadwinner in the family. Madina is grateful to Aqroinvest and Kiva for the opportunity given to her in the form of this first loan. She used this loan of 800 AZN to purchase three cows. Madina's goal is to increase the number of cattle she breeds regularly to ten heads.

loans.use: to purchase three cows

loans.name: Dashjargal

texts.en: Dashjargal D. is 57 years old and lives with his wife, daughter, and grandchild in Uvurhangai province in Mongolia. They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His daughter has worked for a press company since graduating from university, and his grandson attends a local secondary school. Dashjargal operates an iron-crafting business where he produces a variety of chimney, stovepipe, fence, steel door, truck trailer and other metal items. Before starting this business, Dashjargal worked as a driver in a local mine. He has also operated a car-repair center for several years. He plans to buy a new truck to transport his iron products to customers located in the countryside. In the future, he hopes to expand the business and build a house and a fence for his family. Dashjargal is requesting a loan for 700,000 MNT to buy the tools and supplies he needs for his iron craft business.

loans.use: To buy tools and supplies for his business

loans.name: Kanga

texts.en:
Kanga is a married woman with seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a vegetable stall for the past two years, selling retail to her neighbours and passersby. Kanga faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, vegetables and fruit. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, vegetables and fruit

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
This is Edna B., a resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. She has a high-school-aged child together with her husband, Edgardo B., a buying-and-selling agent. By the grace of God, Edna has managed to support her child's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Edna operates a variety store while overseeing operations of their foam mattress and pillow manufacturing business. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 Philippine pesos (Php) worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies in at wholesale prices and selling at a piece rate. Edna also manages her foam mattress and pillow business, where she supplies the local community with bedding and pillows. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She will also invest a portion of the loan to buy materials for the foam mattress and pillow business, supplies like rugby (adhesive), fabric and foam. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Edna dreams to be able to live a peaceful life together with her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She will also invest a portion of the loan to buy materials for the foam mattress and pillow business, supplies like rugby (adhesive), fabric and foam

loans.name: Mama Inuka Group

texts.fr: Francoise M. est entrepreneur, Secrétaire du groupe Mama Inuka, âgée de 42 ans, divorcée, mère de 6 enfants.  Elle vend l’huile de palme. Elle  commença son business  avec son fonds propre reçu de son ex mari avant qu’ils divorcent. Il ya 2 ans qu’elle est en activité. Plus tard, elle bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima pour renforcement de son capital. Elle installe ses produits  au long de la rue, prêt du petit marché sectoriel du quartier Ndosho. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  les 2 fus d’huile de palme, 2 sacs de riz, 1 sac de haricot. En plus, elle ambitionne augmenter son compte épargne, scolariser, nourrir et vêtir confortablement ses enfants. La cliente Francoise M. remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique.  Le groupe Mama Inuka est constitué de 8 membres.
texts.en:
Françoise M. is an entrepreneur, and secretary of the Mama Inuka group, which consists of eight members. She is a 42-year-old divorced mother of six children. 

She sells palm oil, a business she started with her own funds received from her former husband before they divorced. She has been engaged in this activity for two years. She displays her merchandise along the street near the local market of the Ndosho neighborhood.

She received a loan from the Hekima MFI to strengthen her working capital. This new loan will allow her to boost her stocks with two drums of palm oil, two bags of rice, and one bag of beans. 

She also plans to increase her savings, send her children to school, and feed and clothe them comfortably. 

Françoise M. wishes to thank Hekima for helping the less fortunate who can’t turn to traditional banks.

loans.use: Buying two drums of palm oil, two bags of rice, and one bag of beans

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Felina

texts.en:
Felina G. is from the village of Bocboc, Don Carlos, Bukidnon. She is 55 years old and married with one adult child. To make a living, Felina runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and junk food in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Felina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Felina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Paulin

texts.en:
Paulin is a 34-year-old married man. He and his wife have three children, who are between 1 and 5 years old. Paulin`s wife works as an executive secretary. Paulin is a self-employed businessman selling a variety of goods, as the photo illustrates. Among the goods he sells are cosmetics products like body lotions, toothpaste, soap, toilet paper, and foods like rice, sugar, and cooking oils. His shop is open every day from 6 am to 9 pm.

Paulin is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in the amount of $875 to expand his business by purchasing a large quantity of products. He plans to also start a wholesale business. By doing so, Paulin hopes to earn more profits which in turn will allow him to provide a secure and stable future for his three children.

loans.use: To expand his business by purchasing additional goods

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario D. is a a 68-year old married woman from Cubay South Bugasong Antique. She is married to Julito D.. They have children, but their children all have families of their own and their own houses, so Rosario and Julito live alone like newlyweds these days.

Even at her age, she explains that she is still strong and very motivated to succeed with her business. She really enjoys generating money from her business. The profits she realizes from her business help to sustain her and Julito by providing for their basic needs, which normally leaves some income that they give to their grandchildren as an allowance. She fundamentally believes in not just helping her relatives but also her community. Indeed, she believes that, if she helps others, God will provide her twice as much in return -- maybe not in the form of money, but possibly with good health.

She would now like to expand her store by purchasing additional inventory so that her store can be a convenient location for her neighbors' shopping needs. To realize this plan, she is seeking to borrow 20,000 PHP ($475). Her dream is to be able to support her children by sending her grandchildren to school, though she would also like to have some savings for her and her husband's future needs.

loans.use: To expand her store and to satisfy customer demand by purchasing additional goods

loans.name: Dominique

texts.en:
Dominique is a 48-year-old married woman. She and her husband have four children, who are between 14 and 20 years old. Dominique's husband works for the government.

She is now in her third year of business, and she explains that she works from 7 am until 6 pm every day. Dominique is requesting a loan in the amount of $875 to purchase more wedding clothes for re-sale purposes and to hire a new employee. Any profits she generates as a result of this loan would be reinvested back in her business to ensure that it continues to do well.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional wedding clothes and by hiring an employee

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a married man with ten children. Six of his children currently attend school, while four children have graduated from school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. He explains that his greatest monthly expenses are for food and school tuition fees.

To earn a living, he operates a goat meat business. Specifically, he buys and then sells goats at the market to nearby butchers. Charles's primarily challenge as of late has been the high cost of transporation. In the future, he hopes to expand his business (and to solve much of his transportation problem) by establishing a slaughterhouse. Charles is now seeking a loan in the amount of 40,000 KES ($500) to purchase goats for re-sale purposes. He decided to join Yehu because it enables him to access financial services.

loans.use: To expand and improve his business by purchasing additional goats

loans.name: Felina

texts.en:
Felina G. is a 32-year-old married woman from the village of Bocboc, Don Carlos, Bukidnon. She and her husband have two school-age children. To earn a living, Felina owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. Her primary source of income is derived from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothes and bath towels in her local community. Felina has been engaged in this business for over a year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2010, Felina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. By doing so, she is better able to engage n business activities and hopes to improve her family's standard of living going forward. Felina is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP ($125), which will be used to purchase additional products such as short pants and jeans. This loan would be the first loan taken out by Felina from HSPFI. She plans to use any additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional inventory

loans.name: Vivian's Group

texts.en:
From the village of San Rafael, Roxas, Isabela, Vivian L. is the 38-year-old group leader of a nine-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Vivian, who is married and has three school-aged children, owns and operates a business providing manicure and pedicure services in the local community. Engaged in her business for over 16 years, she earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Vivian joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Haveing repaid her previous loan of 9000 PHP from ASKI, she is now requesting her eighth loan for 10000 PHP to purchase materials needed to provide service. Vivian plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Alivera

texts.en:
Alivera is 44 years old and married with five children between the ages of four and 16. Her husband is a nurse. Alivera runs a general store that sells a large variety of food and other items. She has fifteen years of business experience and is able to employ two people.  
 
Alivera has requested a loan to expand her business. She will use her loan to purchase additional products to sell such as water, baby food, juice, and coffee. Alivera hopes to be able to build her own house with the profit from her loan.

loans.use: to purchase stock

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy B. is from the village of Bocboc, Don Carlos, Bukidnon. She is 60 years old and widowed with five adult children. To make a living, Nancy owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. Her main source of income comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, and beverages in the local community. Nancy has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

Nancy joined HSPFI in 2009 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI that she used to purchase inventory and use as working capital. Nancy is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products like junk foods and biscuits. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Nancy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.
 
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase products like junk foods and biscuits

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en:
Laurence is 35 years old and married with four children between 4 and 11 years old. She sells charcoal both wholesale and retail and is a proven entrepreneur. She has been running her business successfully for four years, and she works from 7 am until 6 pm every day. Laurence is pictured here in front of her sacks of charcoal which have been filled with coal and then stuffed with eucalyptus leaves.

Laurence has requested a loan to purchase more charcoal to sell. With this loan, Laurence hopes that her revenue will increase so she can save for her future and do her best for her children.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Jamyilakan Jumaeva's Group

texts.en:
Jamyilakan J. is 58 years old and married with two sons and a daughter. Her sons are policemen and her daughter is studying at school.  Jamyilakan lives in Tup, a small town in the Isykul region. 

Jamyilakan is a teacher and she is the leader of this group. She also breeds livestock animals for resale after fattening. She is able to earn 3,000 Soms per month. Jamyilakan will use her portion of the loan to purchase six sheep. In the future, she would like to see her children wed. 


Where did This Loan Come From?

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). 

MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: The Juliet Asuncion Group

texts.en:
Juliet A. is from the village of Sinippil, Reina Mercedes, Isabela. Juliet is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Juliet is 39 years old and married and with four school-aged children. To make a living she owns and operates a general store. Her main source of income comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Juliet has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

Juliet joined ASKI in 2009 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase products to sell. Juliet is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP also to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Juliet from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Her main source of income comes primarily from providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Leticia has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month.

Leticia joined HSPFI in 2008 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes primarily from their farm. Elmira has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, Elmira joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elmira has  a new loan of 50000  PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Elmira from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family.
About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

She will start selling jackets because they are in demand in her business area. With this expansion, Lucie will hopefully earn more profits, allowing her to maintain her business and build a secure future for her children.

Japhet has requested a loan to purchase a wide range of stock that he thinks will sell well in his area.  With these additional goods, Japhet hopes to earn more profits which will allow him to start saving for further investments in his business.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is 32 years old and is married with three children between the ages of 4 and 12.  Alex decided to become a businessman and started a small store selling food and other household items, as he believes it will be more profitable than farming and agriculture.  This is his fifth successful years in business.  His shop is open from 6 in the morning until 11 in the evening, every day except on Sundays.

Alex has requested a loan to purchase more stock for his store and to resolve some family needs such as paying school fees for his children and buying good quality food.  This loan will be very helpful to his family.

texts.en:
Gerelsuren T. is 57 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a traditional housing tent called a 'ger' and fence in Uvurhangai province, central Mongolia. Her two children attend university. Since 1997, Gerelsuren has been operating a dairy products trading business at the local market in the province. During the summertime she sells mare's milk (fermented milk) and has become quite experienced in the trade. 

After years of successful operation, she has gained a lot of experience as a businesswoman. Her son opened a grocery shop next to Atar Urguu company (flour making) that attracts many customers. Gerelsuren is a hardworking and open-minded woman. She wants to increase her current assets and is intent on expanding her business in the future. Her dream is to have her own dairy product-making factory for the future. She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a large amount of dairy products to sell at her stall and more grocery products for her son's shop.
